story:
Dear Fellow Cooperators, Allies and interested others,

Please consider helping CO-SOUND with our project of building our exchange with the Cecosesola cooperative of Venezuela. We hope to bring 4 members of Cecosesola to the South Sound region of Washington State in October 2015 and send 4 representatives from different local coops to Venezuela in February 2016. This will be our second exchange with Cecosesola. We are setting our goal at $6000 which will pay for airfare, costs associated with getting a visa, and partial living expenses for 3 of the 4 companeros.  The rest of the funds will come from other organizations participating in the exchange such as: The Evergreen State College, The Olympia Food Coop, The New Moon Cooperative Café, and other community partners.

The History of the Exchange:

The United Nations designated 2012 the International Year of the Cooperative. In the spirit of this declaration, a group of "cooperators" and community members in Olympia, WA. together with members of the Cecosesola cooperative in Venezuela, organized an exchange. Two members of the Olympia Food Coop, along with a group of students from the Evergreen State College, went to Barquisimeto in January 2012. They worked with Cecosesola, learned about its history, experienced the organizational process and brought that knowledge back to share with our own community.  In May 2012 four members of Cecosesola came to the South Sound region where they worked with the Olympia Food Coop, visited community organizations, and met with community groups seeking economic alternatives. The exchange culminated in a two- day conference on cooperatives that brought over 100 participants from Thurston, Mason and King Counties. The experience was an enriching, educational and productive one for all involved.

The knowledge gained from our exchange with Cecosesola has contributed to the development of new cooperatives in the Olympia area, including the New Moon Cafe and the Northwest Construction Cooperative (NWCC). As Micheal Snow, administrative coordinator of the NWCC said in a recent letter addressed to Venezuelan national representatives, "CECOSESOLA has been instrumental in demonstrating to us, and the rest of the world, that cooperatives and cooperativism are a real challenge to capitalism and all its defects... without the inspiration and example of CECOSESOLA, I sincerely doubt we would be in the place we are today."

Who are we?

CO-SOUND (South Sound Cooperative Network) is a networking and mutual support organization for cooperatives in our area. We seek to educate our community about cooperative development, and support the formation of new cooperatives. Currently, our organization is comprised of representatives from: The Olympia Food Co-op; The New Moon Collective; The Flaming Eggplant Cafe; The Northwest Cooperative Development Center; The Evergreen State College; Shelton Youth Advocacy; and The Northwest Construction Cooperative.

VISION

We are committed to building a vibrant, inter-cultural cooperative network in our community that includes  current cooperatives and expands beyond them. We are committed to improving access to the goods and services offered by these organizations and disseminating knowledge about how cooperatives work. We commit to supporting groups seeking economic self-determination through cooperative practice, and to letting social justice and respect for differences guide our work with one another and our community.

STATEMENT OF PURPOSE

CO-SOUND (South Sound Cooperative Network), a network of cooperative organizations and allies in Washington's South Puget Sound area, promotes community and self-sustainability among cooperatives through popular education, mutual assistance, and social and cultural activities.

We work to increase our own capacity as well as to offer resources for groups organizing for economic self-determination, with a focus on worker-owned and collectively managed workplaces. We work to develop infrastructure to support groups in growing a local and regional cooperative community.

Why cooperatives and why Cecosesola?

As Evergreen State College Professor John Baldridge wrote during the 1st, 2012 exchange, "The search for answers, in recent years, has led to a new resurgence of interest in democratic economic models, including cooperatives...Not only do cooperatives tend to weather economic crises more successfully than traditional businesses, co-ops also help to ensure that the economic benefits of business circulate in the local communities they serve because they are owned and operated by the people who work for them.  And unlike traditional local businesses, where a private owner can hire or fire people at will, cooperatives bring democracy into the workplace, allowing for innovative democratic solutions to economic challenges, which go beyond 'downsizing' or 'selling out.'" 

According to a recent study by CICOPA, the International Organization of Industrial and Service Cooperatives, the world cooperative economy currently generates around $2.2 trillion annually, while 250 million people worldwide are employed or earn their living thanks to a cooperative. With two million workers employed by cooperatives in the U.S. The U.S. cooperative movement represents a small but significant percentage of this global movement. Yet many within the US cooperative economy have little knowledge of cooperatives outside of the United States.

CECOSESOLA is a 50+ year old, non-partisan “cooperative of cooperatives,” with over 20,000 members, 1,600 workers (socios) and 80 different organizations represented. Services provided by CECOSESOLA include: a hospital, a funerary service, farming, food production and markets, money lending, and an appliance store, all of which provide quality services for low income and working class people at below average cost. For decades, CECOSESOLA has engaged in international exchanges and education with cooperatives from Egypt to Mexico, France and Germany. Cecosesola is non-hierarchical; its 1600 socios make decisions with participation from everyone, using a collective decision making process.

To learn more about CECOSESOLA please visit their webpage: http://www.cecosesolaorg.bugs3.com/

To learn more about the 1st exchange please visit this blog created by OFC staff members while they were in Venezuela: 

http://ofccecosesola.blogspot.com/2012/02/estamos-construyamos-la-confianza.html

Please be sure to view the "gallery" tab to see other relevant videos and pictures.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Samenvatting

Mijn naam is Michael Niclaus en op 17 juli 2011 stopte ik met alcohol drinken. Sindsdien legde ik een hele weg af die er onder andere toe leidde dat ik op 1 januari 2013 mijn eigen organisatie ben begonnen. Via ‘De Beste Beslissing’ geef ik lezingen voor jongeren, help ik mensen tijdens individuele sessies anders naar alcohol te kijken en eventueel te stoppen met drinken en sinds kort begeleid ik ook mensen die in hun dagelijkse leven omgaan met een alcoholverslaafde.

Tijdens mijn werk als alcoholcoach krijg ik enorm veel vragen over alcohol in het algemeen, hoe je kan stoppen met drinken en ook over hoe je iemand daarbij kan helpen. De overvloed aan vragen maakten me duidelijk dat er nood is aan een boek over hoe je kan omgaan met mensen met een alcoholprobleem. Er is heel weinig kennis over en nee, ik heb de waarheid niet in pacht. Ik ben me er zeer bewust van dat ik niet alles weet. Toch kan ik vanuit mijn ervaring als alcoholcoach nuttige inzichten meegeven die je op weg kunnen helpen.

Het uitgangspunt van dit boek is alcohol, maar eigenlijk gelden dezelfde principes voor alle soorten drugs. Gaat het in jouw situatie niet over alcohol, vervang dat dan in gedachten door de drugs in kwestie. Om de leesbaarheid te bevorderen, maak ik gebruik van ‘hij’ en ‘zijn’. Weet dat ik daarmee evengoed ‘zij’ en ‘haar’ bedoel.

De grootste uitdaging is de immense onwetendheid over alcohol. Dat houdt mensen als het ware gevangen, niet enkel de verslaafde, ook zijn naasten.

Dit boek wil een handleiding zijn dat je meer inzicht geeft in de problematiek zodat je begrip erover toeneemt. Daarin zit in mijn ogen de sleutel.

Wat heb ik nodig

Ik kan steeds nog wat steun gebruiken om dit boek in de wereld te zetten. Dit boek zal natuurlijk wel zoveel mensen kunnen helpen!!

Impact

Ik heb al zeer veel gedaan rond bewustwording van alcohol. Dit boek zal zoveel mensen helpen om bewuster met alcohol om te gaan! Ik heb al 25000 jongeren kunnen inspireren door lezingen te geven, help mensen individueel ook om te stoppen met drinken en nog zoveel meer :)

story:
Our Story

Students at Strawberry Mansion, and all throughout the School District of Philadelphia, fall victim to a perpetual budget crisis, lacking necessary outlets and resources like guidance counselors, nurses, technology, and sometimes even books. The environment of poverty in which they have grown up adds to the disadvantages in opportunity. 

We attend Lower Merion High School, one of the wealthiest and most successful public high schools in the state. We feel as though we have been trapped inside the "Lower Merion bubble" for our entire lives and decided to finally venture outside. For our senior project, for which we are granted 3 weeks off from school to complete, we visited Strawberry Mansion and spoke with students and teachers about the inequities in opportunity between Strawberry Mansion and Lower Merion. The results of our experience and research floored us, and we created a short film with the intended goal of sharing what we learned with our community. 

In addition to creating this film, we have created this page to play our small part in bridging the opportunity gap. We would like to help students at Mansion go on college visits. Visiting a multitude of college campuses is a necessary step in the college search process and something we take for granted. All students deserve equal opportunities, and this is one of them. All proceeds will go directly to Strawberry Mansion, where a fund will be created for this purpose. Please donate to help us reach our goal. Thank you. 

- Tori Klevan and Sander Haigh

story:
We are the first Chicago Public School to host a totally student centered licensed TEDx event. This will be our 3rd consecutive year being a licensed TEDx event, but we have been faced with major budget cuts and we are not able to fund important aspects of our event that really give our TEDx speakers the credit they deserve. 
Our TEDx speakers are people who are even more important than your typical TEDsters...they are our students. They are passionate. They are optimistic. They are realistic. They are honest. They are inquisitive. They are Chicago. They are cadets of Carver Military Academy. They are identified on charts and graphs as: 14 to 18 years old, 97% low income, 25.7% meeting and exceeding state tests, 47.8 % Hispanic, 50.3% Black, 1.3% White. Even with many odds against them, our students recognize they are more than just a statistic. Our students speak to the importance of particular community and social issues based on their own inquiry, investigation, and interests. TEDxCarverMilitaryAcademy is the megaphone through which their voices are heard. 
Here is where you come in... To make this TEDx as official and authentic as possible there are a few things we need funded...
-Videographer for the filming of the event and editing of TEDx videos. This is a requirement for our TEDx license to remain active and it makes the night last a lifetime! Cost: $1500 
-T-shirts for TEDx speakers and stage crew so they can proudly represent TEDxCarverMilitaryAcademy! Who doesn't love some swag? Cost: $300
-Dinner! Since the event starts at 6 pm, we like to feed our speakers and stage crew. In addition, we invite the families of our students to celebrate their child's accomplishment. It really makes the event special when we all get to sit down over some grub before the show begins. Cost: $200 
What's in it for you? 
1) You can come see what your money has done by attending TEDxCarverMilitaryAcademy from 6-9 pm on May 22nd! Tickets will be available soon, AND they are free. We would love to have you! 
2) You are empowering the youth to solve the problems that affect their communities AND share their ideas with an international audience. In the end, you are helping to make sure our youth feel a sense of purpose in this world. What more could you ask for?

story:
ALL REWARDS ARE DOUBLED FOR THE LAST 48 HOURS!

Our Mission
We are trying to empower Madagascan schools with technology. We have partnered with the Madagascar Ankizy Fund (for more information, see below) to bring six Madagascan schools into the 21st century. 

Imagine never experiencing the Internet before. Or even a computer. Or even electricity. Wow. 

Computers can be used for frivolous activities like checking social media, but in a classroom environment, they can alter the lives of thousands of young minds.

What are we trying to raise?
We are raising money to install:

  • Computers
  • Solar Panels (the schools are off the grid)
  • A working Internet connection

Who are we?
We are a group of ten high schoolers from Arizona. You read that right - we are in high school. We all share a common passion for technology, and we want to share that with the world. Using our knowledge and technological prowess, we built the website (techformadagascar.com) and this project from the ground up. 

General summary of the Madagascar Ankizy Fund
The Madagascar Ankizy Fund (ankizy means children in the Malagasy language) was founded in 1998 by paleontologist Dr. David W. Krause, a professor at Stony Brook University in Long Island, NY. Dr. Krause, as well as various colleagues and students involved in paleontological research in Madagascar, are committed to improving the lives of Malagasy children. We believe that ALL children have a right to basic health care and an education. 

In 1993 Dr. Krause fulfilled a childhood dream and journeyed to the remote island of Madagascar to search for fossils of Cretaceous vertebrate (backboned) animals. What he found there was a treasure-trove of complete or nearly complete skulls and skeletons of dinosaurs, turtles, snakes, crocodiles, frogs, birds, and even mammals. His early field crews spent time searching for these fossils and camping near the village of Berivotra in northwestern Madagascar (about an hour from the coastal city of Mahajanga). Shortly after beginning work there, Dr. Krause and the members of his expedition found themselves surrounded by children who were observing their work. These are some of the most destitute children in the world. The children that are the focus of his humanitarian work face lives in which basic education and health care are difficult, if not impossible, to come by. These children often die from very treatable medical conditions and face an uncertain future in a country that is one of the most impoverished in the world. Very quickly it became clear that the paleontologists were in a unique position to help these children. They were amazed to discover that $500 US dollars would pay the salary of a teacher for an entire year, and that $300 could buy school supplies for an entire classroom for a full year. With this knowledge in hand, members of the field crew came together with several relatively small donations, and The Madagascar Ankizy Fund was born.

Building Schools – Reported adult literacy rates in Madagascar vary greatly but, in many remote rural areas such as the one frequented by the paleontologists in the northwestern part of the island, it was essentially 0%. There were almost no schools in these areas and most children, who are bright and eager to learn, received no formal education of any kind. To date, MAF has built five primary schools and one secondary school.  Literally thousands of children are now receiving an education.  Several students from our first primary school have now gone on to receive a high school education and even gone on to attend the University of Mahajanga.

Health and Mortality – Infant mortality in Madagascar is over 12 times greater than in the USA and mortality for children under five years of age is over 20 times greater. These rates are much higher in rural areas. At least one-third of Malagasy children are severely underweight and fully half are stunted. Malnutrition, diarrheal diseases, respiratory infections, and malaria are the leading causes of death among children. Schistosomiasis, tuberculosis, and leprosy, as well as occasional outbreaks of bubonic plague and cholera, are also serious health care problems. While all of these diseases seriously affect Malagasy children, none is more rampant than malaria, with an average of 760,000 cases and 11,000 deaths reported each year. Oral health is also a particularly serious health issue.  We provide annual dental clinics (staffed by Stony Brook University School of Dental Medicine dentists and dental students) and monthly medical clinics in remote areas.  We have also initiated, with assistance from Rotary International, a solar water disinfection program that is providing clean water for approximately 24,000 villagers.  This alone will cut roughly in half the number of deaths of children under five years of age. We also support basic health and hygiene by providing training, providing medical and dental supplies, distributing mosquito nets, etc. 


Donating is Easy! We use a tier-based reward system to make checkout as smooth as possible!

Here's how it works:
When you order, for example, a Tier 6 item, you will receive tiers 1, 2, 3, 4x, 5, & 6. 

Tier 4 is a Little Special
This tier comprises five unique fossils. You have the power to choose whichever one you want! 
If you buy a Tier 5 item (or higher), we will email you privately regarding your fossil selection.

These children often die from very treatable medical conditions and face an uncertain future in a country that is one of the most impoverished in the world. Very quickly it became clear that the paleontologists were in a unique position to help these children. They were amazed to discover that $500 US dollars would pay the salary of a teacher for an entire year, and that $300 could buy school supplies for an entire classroom for a full year. With this knowledge in hand, members of the field crew came together with several relatively small donations, and The Madagascar Ankizy Fund was born.Building Schools – Reported adult literacy rates in Madagascar vary greatly but, in many remote rural areas such as the one frequented by the paleontologists in the northwestern part of the island, it was essentially 0%. There were almost no schools in these areas and most children, who are bright and eager to learn, received no formal education of any kind. To date, MAF has built five primary schools and one secondary school.  Literally thousands of children are now receiving an education.  Several students from our first primary school have now gone on to receive a high school education and even gone on to attend the University of Mahajanga.Health and Mortality – Infant mortality in Madagascar is over 12 times greater than in the USA and mortality for children under five years of age is over 20 times greater. These rates are much higher in rural areas. At least one-third of Malagasy children are severely underweight and fully half are stunted. Malnutrition, diarrheal diseases, respiratory infections, and malaria are the leading causes of death among children. Schistosomiasis, tuberculosis, and leprosy, as well as occasional outbreaks of bubonic plague and cholera, are also serious health care problems. While all of these diseases seriously affect Malagasy children, none is more rampant than malaria, with an average of 760,000 cases and 11,000 deaths reported each year. Oral health is also a particularly serious health issue.  We provide annual dental clinics (staffed by Stony Brook University School of Dental Medicine dentists and dental students) and monthly medical clinics in remote areas.  We have also initiated, with assistance from Rotary International, a solar water disinfection program that is providing clean water for approximately 24,000 villagers.  This alone will cut roughly in half the number of deaths of children under five years of age. We also support basic health and hygiene by providing training, providing medical and dental supplies, distributing mosquito nets, etc. Donating is Easy! We use a tier-based reward system to make checkout as smooth as possible!Here's how it works:When you order, for example, a Tier 6 item, you will receive tiers 1, 2, 3, 4x, 5, & 6. Tier 4 is a Little SpecialThis tier comprises five unique fossils. You have the power to choose whichever one you want! If you buy a Tier 5 item (or higher), we will email you privately regarding your fossil selection.

story:
Why support us?

Our city is changing; our society is changing. How can we ensure that Indianapolis will become inclusive and equitable? One thing we know: our youth are our future leaders and citizens. 

The zeitgeist of education in our city wagers numbers over names, and test scores over community, talent, passion. Indy Pulse uses spoken word poetry to activate that element of humanity essential to creating the society, and the people, we all hope for.

Parents: Are you concerned about your kid “making it”: making it through school, tests, and overcoming whatever temptations stand in their way to living a productive, happy life?

Teachers: When is the last time you were able to converse with your students about race and class? When was the last time you were able to authentically listen to—and validate—your students’ voices?

Students: When is the last time you were able to really say what you wanted to say? When was the last time you got to tell your story? When was the last time you felt included in a community who you could share your story with?

Through our events, culturally responsive practices, and Common Core-aligned curriculum we cultivate youth who articulate their vision for meaningful life paths. Their academic and interpersonal skills improve. The result: a Reflective youth who can Advocate for equity and actualize it through our Inclusive community. Our schools partners, families, and youth are from different “sides” of Indianapolis, and from different socio-economic and racial experiences.

How can you help build a better Indianapolis? Support our future leaders and citizens. Support Indy Pulse.

Impact to date

We partner with seven Indianapolis schools and six community partners to serve over 170 students. We provide students with mentorship from nationally ranked spoken word artists and empower our teacher leaders to increase their Pulse team’s capacity by providing support as they earn stipends, fellowships, and awards for their Indy Pulse work.

We sent Indianapolis’ inaugural spoken word team to the world’s largest youth poetry slam—Brave New Voices.  KJ, a Pulse leader, earned honorable mention at BNV; she is 13, the youngest allowable age to compete.  Our national and local media coverage increased three-fold.

Our curriculum’s cultural responsiveness activates student voice, which improves their academic success and behavior. NWEA scores and report cards show our students’ academic gains.

Indy Pulse is at an essential growth point. We're expanding to more schools next year. Ultimately—and with your support—we will create a city-wide league that promotes student voice, inclusion, and community. 

How your support helps

Where is the primary place our youth must go? Schools. We meet youth where they are; and we reformulate relationships amongst students, parents, educators, and community members.

Your support will go directly towards our facilitator-educators, materials, events, and College and Career Readiness. Our phenomenal Teacher Leaders lead biweekly programming, and our Professional Poet Mentors lead regular workshops with youth, families, and community Partners. Our Pule Pipeline Scholarship program supports youth as they complete high school and their college and technical education beyond.  

Our Team

Camea Davis is currently a Gates Millennium Scholar, was awarded the Teacher Creative Renewal Grant by Eli Lilly in 2014 to travel the European (Rome, Venice, Tuscany, Paris, Florence); she archived these sites and carry them to inner city communities and classrooms and engage students in reflective writing about their own environments—which exemplifies our approach: leveraging spoken word to bridge the Western canonical and the urban cultural experiences. She is in her second year as a doctoral student at Ball State’s Educational Policy and Cultural studies program, focused on educating African American children equitably.

Tony DelaRosa leads our branding and public relations, he speaks Spanish, which helps our Latino youth dive deeper into their identity and re-create their narrative. He is an Asian American teacher, currently working with TFA’s Culturally Responsive Teaching Pilot Cohort to create programming for corps members to help bring awareness and strengthen culturally responsive teaching best practices in the classroom. He is helping to design a city-wide youth summit aimed to help students find and leverage their leadership and voice.

Lauren Hall, as Executive Director, relentlessly increases her competency for this work; she increased her skills by completing the first semester at Indiana University School of Public and Environmental Affairs—ranked number one in the nation for my studies in Non-Profit Management. More fundamental to our functioning, she leads our community, city, and school partnerships; she crafts our strategic-planning, budgeting, calendar, and initiatives to establish long-term sustainability. She drafts our grant narratives and coalesced our curriculum's framework.

story:
How Sapana Nepal Started........

In 2006, I traveled to Nepal, because I was fascinated by the country's culture and unique terrain. Nepal is one of the poorest country's in the world, lacking many basic needs such as clean water, sufficient food and good education. After spending a few months in Nepal I decided I wanted to help educate children in a rural village. That is when my dear friend Rajesh Pariyar (a local Nepali and orphan) and I decided to start the organization Sapana Nepal. Since March 2009, Sapana Nepal has been providing free services to the local villagers of Pumdi, Nepal; services that the rural people did not have access to before our organization was launched. Our services have been very successful and include an Early childhood center that's been running for over six years by local villagers. We have built over 150 Improved Cooking Stoves, a water reserve tank and we continue to tutor local children on a weekly basis. We help villagers in need with medical assistance and community support. All of our projects have been funded by our organizations members along with fundraising projects and private charitable donations. For more information about Sapana Nepal and our projects visit SapanaNepal.org or email SapanaNepal@gmail.com.

OUR CAMPAIGN

Since the 7.9 earthquake hit Nepal on April 25, rural villages have been devastated, almost decimated and the aftershocks continue to rock the country weeks after the initial earthquake. On May 14th, Sapana Nepal united with the Red Cross and traveled to a village in Gorkha, a small village known as Aruasru  Bang; home to 130 people and 35 households to bring them food. They carried lots of rice, lentils, cooking oil and salt; this staple diet of "dahl bhaat" that Nepali's enjoy twice a day. Fortunately, only two deaths were confirmed in the area due to the massive earthquake; however food is scarce and 95% of homes where affected, most of them destroyed. As the villagers try to rebuild, build makeshift homes and continue on with their daily lives they are concerned about the coming monsoon. We hope the food brought to them will last 3-4 weeks. We were the first group of aid to visit the area and we know there are many more villages nearby that could use some assistance as well. Our goal is to raise enough money to help other rural areas in need by bringing them food and materials to rebuild and mend shelters. 

It only costs $35 to help feed a family of five for three weeks. However, the transportation costs are extremely expensive due to the rugged terrain of the remote areas. We are focusing our efforts on the most rural areas that are not otherwise receiving relief, areas that can take hours to hike to by foot after the road ends.  We have redirected some of our monthly budget to help with this cuase, but it's not enough!!! We need your generous support in helping the rural villages of Nepal that have been affected by this horrible natural disaster. All proceeds go to delivering food, shelter and medical supplies so that these wonderful people can simply survive as well as start rebuilding their lives. Stay tuned for our weekly updates. Thank you for your time and consideration. Namaste from Sapana Nepal and all of the Nepali people.

story:
Short Summary

  • "Nepal earthquake: Hundreds die, many feared trapped." BBC News
  • "Le Népal en ruines secoué par une violente réplique de 6,7" Le Monde
  • "Più di duemila morti nel terremoto in Nepal" Il Post
  • "Terremoto en Nepal: El mundo se moviliza ante la catástrofe" El Comercio

An earthquake with 7.8 magnitude caused a gloomy atmosphere over Nepal and the  rest of the world because of the loss of many lives. Staying as a bystander will not reduce their suffer nor pain. For the sake of humanity, we should be holding the hands of those people in need and share our concern with the society. 


It is known that the water is not safe to use, electricity problems are not solved which detaches them from the life. Most of the people lost their homes. Some people stays in airports if they are lucky, however there are more people who do not even have a shelter to meet their basic needs.


  • We are a group of Master's student at Grenoble Graduate School of Business studying MSc Innovation, Strategy and Entrepreneurship. Our team consists upon a variety of multicultural individuals, from 18 different countries and cultures. 
  • Our ultimate aim is to convey donations from all around the world to Nepal and create awareness of the situation. Acknowledging the importance of unity and cooperation under the hoods of humanity, help us to achieve this vital cause for Nepali people in need of our help!


The Impact

In this hard moments, we believe it is very crucial to convey the donations to the right people at the right time. Thus, throughout the donation period, we will be as transparent as possible and keep all contributors updated. 

We believe that the crucial aspect of this campaign is just to contribute, regardless of its amount. With all contributors, we will make sure that Nepali Earthquake Victims make themselves heard and ensure them that they are not alone.


Other Ways You Can Help

Our campaign is not the only way to contribute! Please feel free to contribute from any trusted network.

Mercy Corps

CARE Emergency

American Red Cross

Nepal Earthquake Relief Fund

story:
Why Support Isn't a "Donation"

  • No monetary pledge comes empty handed.  
  • Everything comes directly with a perk related to forecasting our future.  
  • No pledge is given out of pity either.  

Who Is Our Target Market?  

Our target Market is... human beings.  What do I mean by that?  Our content cannot be corrupted by search engines or personalized news feeds.  Our written content will be in the form of an eBook or eMagazine in PDF format.  

Our Success  is Based On Talent, Not SEO

Stephen King, Steven Spielberg, and Stephen Hawkings are not iconic influencers because they produced content with the best search engine strategy.  Nor is it because their content integrates with Facebook, Reddit, social networks, or personalized news feed.  

Purpose of Perspective

  • Have you ever heard of a publication that reports the future as if it has already happened?  Neither have I.  Which is why this is a brand new form of entertainment.
  • Perspective is presented from a alternative reality outlook in the future.  Hyperreality is defined as "as a condition in which what is real and what is fiction are seamlessly blended together so that there is no clear distinction between where one ends and the other begins."  Perspective is written from a near future perspective.

What You Get For Backing Campaign

  • Pre-order the flagship issue of Perspective as an ebook.
  • Attend our amazing events about foresight into the future and test new futuristic products!
  • The funds go directly to cover the cost to review the magazine and we want to produce a YouTube station for the publication.  
  • This will be divided into phases this crowdfunding campaign.  The $500 will be to just get the flagship issue launched by editors and proofreaders.  

Risks & Challenges

We are dividing this crowdfunding campaign in phases.  Right now $500 is just to pay to proofread 50 pages worth of content and stories presented as news in a near future setting.  The ambition of the project is much larger.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us reach 10,000 subscribers for our YouTube channel:

  • If our YouTube station gets 10,000 subscribers we are able to utilize YouTube's studios and equipment for free to produce amazing content reporting news from the future https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaKvJAKd4cYHpZ....
  • Tell your friends to support the project!
  • Submit content!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Last year, I was the first Ph.D student from an Interdisciplinary Ethics & Social Justice Program to be offered an opportunity to present. ("Integral Frames: Interdisciplinary Tools Supporting Cannabis Research"); as well as receive a travel award by the International Cannabinoid Research Society (ICRS) Symposium.  I was also the first student to crowdfund their way to the ICRS.  As a social scientist, advocate, and patient I was thrilled!  The trip to Baveno, Italy was incredible--and although it was terribly difficult given my limited budget and due to the fact I was incredibly ill, the learning experience was life-changing.

I wrote about one of the many connections I made with scientific researchers:

http://www.ladybud.com/2014/09/17/cannabis-beats-placebo-cbd-promising-for-treating-brain-damage-in-preemies/

A month after Ladybud published this article scientists from the U.S. confirmed this neuro-protective benefit.  I've also presented this story and many others involving clinical research in cannabinoid medicine affecting many health conditions: cancer, Alzheimer's, PTS, seizure-disorders, among others!

This year I've been invited back to the 2015 ICRS Symposium being held in late June in Nova Scotia on the Acadia University Campus.  In addition, I will receive a $500 travel award!  Good news, since those funds will only cover registration for the symposium; that means I need to raise another $1,500 to cover travel, food, and lodging. 

Though I've been making a lot of exciting press announcements about the launch of The eCS Therapy Center--a national 501(c)(3) organization, the funding we have acquired is all ear-marked for infrastructure,.  I will not be drawing a real paycheck for quite sometime and my financial aid (student leans) will not fund until weeks after this incredible academic opportunity has been achieved.  I need help!


Please support this campaign!

Bref descriptif de notre projet

Ça déménage à la Coop!! On aménage un nouveau local de 3000 pieds carrés pour notre école de musique dans le sous-sol de l’église St-Jean-Baptiste. On travaille fort pour financer les travaux, mais on a besoin d’un petit coup de pouce !

                              

La Coopérative des professeurs de musique est à l’étroit dans son petit local de la rue St-Denis et a du mal à faire face à la demande notamment pour les cours d’éveil musical. De plus, ce local n'est pas insonorisé ce qui n'est pas idéal pour une école de musique. Occuper un nouvel endroit est à la fois une manière de proposer d’autres cours de groupe tout en mettant de la vie dans un superbe lieu patrimonial. Les locaux seront plus spacieux, mieux insonorisés, plus confortables et offriront de meilleures conditions d'enseignement pour les élèves.

Ce déménagement nécessite de gros travaux : construction des murs et plafonds insonorisés, installation d'un système d'aération, de climatisation et d'humidification, etc.

    


En plus d'offrir des cours de musique, nous allons diversifier nos activités. Ainsi, nous mettrons en place une programmation estivale pour tous dès l'été 2016 dans le Parc Drolet derrière l’église et offrirons plusieurs fois par année des après-midi de conte ou des soirées musicales ouvertes à un public familial. Nous utiliserons également nos nouveaux locaux pour accueillir davantage de cours de groupe et mettrons en place dès septembre 2015 un orchestre préparatoire, un ensemble de percussions et un cours de composition assistée par Ipad. La musique, c’est bien, mais en groupe c’est tellement mieux !

Qui sommes-nous ?

Depuis 2009, la Coopérative des professeurs de musique (CPMM) offre à la population un enseignement musical dispensé par des artistes actifs sur la scène artistique nationale et internationale tout en donnant à ces derniers les meilleures conditions de travail possibles. L’enseignement de la musique leur permet une stabilité de revenu et nous assurons des honoraires de 25% à 50% plus élevés que la moyenne de l’industrie tout en conservant des tarifs concurrentiels. Nous sommes une coopérative de travail à but non lucratif dont les membres sont le personnel enseignant et administratif.

Impact dans le quartier

En plus de participer à la revitalisation de l'église, nous sommes voisins d'une maison pour aînés, d'une garderie, d'un centre d'activités sociales, d'un luthier et d'une piste cyclable. Nous sommes très heureux d'être situés dans un environnement si diversifié. Au cœur du Plateau, nous serons accessibles aux personnes souhaitant prendre des cours privés directement dans nos locaux (actuellement les cours privés sont donnés exclusivement au domicile des professeurs).

Financement actuel

Ce projet de 180 000$ est porteur de nouvelles idées et d’activités différentes offertes à tous, bref de projets qui nous donnent des étoiles dans les yeux. Nous avons engagé nos propres fonds dans les rénovations et reçu l’appui financier de quelques partenaires (Les Caisses Populaires Desjardins du Plateau Mont-Royal et de l'est du Plateau, l'Arrondissement du Plateau Mont Royal). Nos finances étant saines et notre gestion transparente, le Réseau d'Investissement Social du Québec (RISQ), Investissement Québec et la CDEC nous ont fait confiance pour nous accorder un prêt. Un grand soulagement pour nous ! Mais nous avons encore besoin d’un coup de pouce, puisque notre projet ne répond à aucun programme de subvention publique.

Où ira l'argent?

L’argent récolté servira à financer la construction et l'aménagement de deux locaux d’enseignement privé, incluant l’achat de 2 pianos.

Et si nous en avions plus ?

Au cas où nous dépasserions l’objectif fixé, le surplus récolté nous permettra d’acheter des instruments de musique de qualité pour les élèves ainsi que du matériel pour les cours d’éveil.

Contreparties

Afin de remercier tous les généreux contributeurs, nous organiserons le 18 décembre 2015 un concert de Noël, en soirée. Au programme,  le baryton Gino Quilico et l'ensemble Triosphère, Sonia Johnson accompagnée par des professeurs de la coopérative. D'autres surprises sont à prévoir ainsi qu'un tirage de prix de présence . Plusieurs sections sont disponibles et l'entrée pour les moins de 18 ans sera gratuite. Vous aurez aussi la possibilité de participer au cocktail après le concert qui marquera le lancement officiel de notre Fondation*. Enfin, nous vous proposons d'organiser un concert privé dans votre salon avec des professeurs de la Coop, dont Lyne Allard (violoniste pour l'Orchestre Métropolitain) et Pascal Valois (guitariste soliste).


D'autres façons d'aider

Donner c’est bien, mais si vous ne pouvez pas ? Sachez bien que même 5$ est un don significatif et que nous accueillerons toutes les sommes avec gratitude. De plus, si vraiment vous ne pouvez pas donner, aidez nous en passant le mot autour de vous ! Comment faire ?

  • relayez notre campagne sur vos médias sociaux.
  • parlez de notre projet à vos amis.
  • envoyez le lien de notre campagne à vos connaissances qui ont un intérêt pour la musique.

* Nous lancerons durant l'été 2015 une Fondation visant à offrir gracieusement des cours de musique à des élèves défavorisés et particulièrement méritant.
story_txt:
Bref descriptif de notre projetÇa déménage à la Coop!! On aménage un nouveau
local de 3000 pieds carrés pour notre école de musique dans le sous-sol de l’église St-Jean-Baptiste. On
travaille fort pour financer les travaux, mais on a besoin d’un petit coup de pouce
!                                
La Coopérative des professeurs de musique est à l’étroit dans
son petit local de la rue St-Denis et a du mal à faire face à la demande notamment
pour les cours d’éveil musical. De plus, ce local n'est pas
insonorisé ce qui n'est pas idéal pour une école de musique. Occuper un nouvel endroit
est à la fois une manière de proposer d’autres cours de groupe tout en mettant
de la vie dans un superbe lieu patrimonial. Les locaux seront plus spacieux, mieux insonorisés, plus confortables et offriront de meilleures conditions d'enseignement pour les élèves.Ce déménagement nécessite de gros travaux : construction des murs et plafonds insonorisés, installation d'un système d'aération, de climatisation et d'humidification, etc.     En plus d'offrir des cours de musique, nous
allons diversifier nos activités. Ainsi, nous mettrons en place une programmation estivale pour tous dès l'été 2016 dans le Parc Drolet
derrière l’église et
offrirons plusieurs fois par année des après-midi de conte ou des 
soirées musicales ouvertes
à un public familial. Nous utiliserons également nos nouveaux locaux 
pour accueillir davantage de cours de groupe et mettrons
en place dès septembre 2015 un orchestre préparatoire, un ensemble de percussions
et un cours de composition assistée par Ipad. La musique, c’est bien, mais en
groupe c’est tellement mieux !Qui sommes-nous ?

Depuis 2009, la
Coopérative des professeurs de musique (CPMM) offre à la population un enseignement musical dispensé par
des artistes actifs sur la scène artistique nationale et internationale tout en
donnant à ces derniers les meilleures conditions de travail possibles.
L’enseignement de la musique leur permet une stabilité de revenu et nous
assurons des honoraires de 25% à 50% plus élevés que la moyenne de l’industrie
tout en conservant des tarifs concurrentiels. Nous sommes une coopérative de
travail à but non lucratif dont les membres sont le personnel enseignant et
administratif.Impact dans le quartierEn plus de participer à la 
revitalisation de l'église, nous sommes voisins d'une maison pour
 aînés, d'une garderie, d'un centre d'activités sociales, d'un luthier et d'une piste cyclable. Nous sommes 
très heureux d'être situés dans un environnement si diversifié. Au cœur
 du Plateau, nous serons accessibles aux personnes souhaitant prendre 
des cours privés directement dans nos locaux (actuellement les cours privés 
sont donnés exclusivement au domicile des professeurs). 
Financement actuel
Ce projet de 180 000$ est porteur de nouvelles idées et d’activités différentes offertes à tous, bref de projets qui
nous donnent des étoiles dans les yeux. Nous avons engagé nos propres fonds
dans les rénovations et reçu l’appui financier de quelques partenaires (Les Caisses Populaires Desjardins du Plateau Mont-Royal et de l'est du Plateau, l'Arrondissement du Plateau Mont Royal). Nos finances
étant saines et notre gestion transparente, le Réseau d'Investissement Social du Québec (RISQ), Investissement Québec et la CDEC nous ont
fait confiance pour nous accorder un prêt. Un grand soulagement pour nous
! Mais nous avons encore besoin d’un coup de pouce, puisque notre projet ne
répond à aucun programme de subvention publique. 
Où

 ira l'argent?
L’argent récolté servira à
financer la construction et l'aménagement de deux locaux d’enseignement privé, incluant l’achat
de 2 pianos. Et si nous en avions plus ?Au cas où nous dépasserions l’objectif fixé, le surplus
récolté nous permettra d’acheter des instruments de musique de qualité pour les
élèves ainsi que du matériel pour les cours d’éveil. 

Contreparties Afin de remercier tous les généreux contributeurs, nous organiserons le 18 décembre 2015 un concert de Noël, en soirée. Au programme,  le baryton Gino Quilico et l'ensemble Triosphère, Sonia Johnson
 accompagnée par des professeurs de la coopérative. D'autres surprises sont à prévoir ainsi qu'un 
tirage de prix de présence . Plusieurs sections sont disponibles et 
l'entrée pour les moins de 18 ans sera gratuite. Vous aurez aussi la possibilité de participer au cocktail après le concert qui marquera le lancement officiel de notre Fondation*. Enfin, nous vous proposons d'organiser un concert privé dans votre salon avec des professeurs de la Coop, dont Lyne 
Allard (violoniste pour l'Orchestre 
Métropolitain) et Pascal Valois (guitariste soliste). 
D'autres façons d'aider

Donner c’est bien, mais si vous ne pouvez pas ? Sachez bien

avec gratitude. De plus, si vraiment vous ne pouvez pas donner, aidez nous en
passant le mot autour de vous ! Comment faire ?

sur vos médias sociaux.

story:
I AM CHANGING THE WORLD!!! WE ARE CHANGING THE WORLD!!!

We are changing the world with the two things that universally uplift us all--Music and Dance. Twenty years ago, in the first dance class I took, I immediately knew that I could not live anymore without having dance in my life.  No matter what I walked into a dance class carrying on my shoulders, I always left feeling liberated and reenergized.    

Once I got to class, everything in my life was left at the door.    This is the what I want to provide the youth of the world with--a safe haven for them to let go of any of life's issues, a place where they can release and revitalize themselves in a nurturing and healthy way.  We are empowering the next generation to preserve the traditions of their ancestors and ground them in an ever-changing world, giving them the strength to overcome the challenges of life through musical expressions. We are supporting the organizations that keep them safe within music and dance. We are  broadening the perspectives and lives of youth by connecting them to a global community of teaching and learning.  We are teaching understanding, respect, and tolerance.

story:
Pilot Project Summary

Drums For Solar is an organization that works to bridge our common humanity by helping small villages abroad in their quest to gain access to renewable energy and technology while maintaining traditional identity.

Small village communities have expressed a desire to embrace technology and modernization while preserving and maintaining cultural identity. In exchanging technology for cultural art, craft, and other gifts, we effectively create a reciprocal agreement that is beneficial for all communities involved.

Through international networking, fundraising, and organizing with partners and supporters, Drums For Solar is working diligently to help communities abroad move closer to self-sufficiency and economic sustainability. Due to constant power outages from insufficient or lack of utility infrastructure, small African village schools are unable to complete basic school functions without back up power sources. Portable solar generators can provide electrical needs required to power lights, computers, and printers. We are beginning with our Pilot Project in two West African villages to realize this common goal.
Drums For Solar (DFS) is comprised of a dedicated group of organizers, businesses, teachers, musicians, and supporters. DFS is working directly with public and private entities and education providers such as Bio-Passion Organic Farming, Level Up Village (LUV), The International Rotary Club, Children's Humanitarian International (CHI), The Agricultural College of Mali, as well as The Institute of Popular Education (IEP) who will be offering education in photovoltaic science and technology, free of charge to participating villages.  
The idea behind the Pilot Project is to create a system in which this type of project can be duplicated wherever the need is expressed, Africa and beyond! Please join us by becoming a Drums For Solar contributor today!

People helping People.

Pilot Project Specifics

Our initial goal is to raise $50,000 to complete the Pilot Project and continue planning other projects. The Pilot Project will serve two village communities, Kati and Karenguimbe, Mali in West Africa. Specifically, the funds will be used for procurement and installation of a portable solar generator in each village school includes technical, labor, transportation, travel, and follow up, business and administration costs including formal creation of DFS as a non-profit organization, plus investment toward creation of the permanent DFS program.

Successfully raising $50,000 for the Pilot Project will enact a sustainable change for the folks in the villages we mentioned, and will also serve as training home base to branch out to other villages once the program is in place. Further, part of the campaign is aimed at researching and developing a sustainable system to become the Drums For Solar Program that can be utilized globally.

Sharing our Humanity.

    The Impact

    DFS Pilot Project's two portable solar generator installations will have an immediate and poignant impact in the schools and communities in which they are placed.

    Once students can access energy to use tools like computers and printers reliably, they are able to work on school projects unencumbered by an unreliable power source. They can begin working with other students world wide on collaborative issues and enact the changes they want to see happen in the world.

    The Pilot Project is intended to create the platform for an ongoing DFS program. In creating a system we can duplicate, we are able to reach beyond borders abroad on the other continents and bring sustainable, renewable energy technology to villages in a mutually beneficial cultural exchange.

    Empower Us to Empower Others.


    Just a Few Challenges

    One of the challenges that DFS faces is that by bringing a new technology into a village that has no experience with this type of resource, we run the risk of both technical and user difficulties. By partnering with the local educational institutions to offer instruction in local languages, and other organizations working in the region, the level of understanding and ownership of the project is greatly increased, thereby increasing the likelihood that the project succeeds as intended. Regular, scheduled follow ups are also planned to address any issues that arise.

    Because we are working with villages in Africa, but are located in the United States, we face a geographical challenge. The Pilot Project includes two different villages within relatively close proximity to each other that will serve as the home base for the DFS Program. We have partners that work in the region that are helping to coordinate and facilitate the Pilot Project.

    The challenges we face can be overcome with your help! Please consider donating today and become a part of the Drums For Solar community- People helping people, sharing our humanity; empower us to empower others!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute to the funding campaign at this time, that's okay! There are other ways to help:

    Get the word out - word of mouth, social media (facebook, twitter, instagram, etc), email, phone, however you can!

    Contact us to become a volunteer. We always need people to put in time and energy!

    We thank you for your support in allowing us to support others!

story:
Are you a writer, artist, musician or creator of any kind of media? We’ve spent nearly three years developing DashBurst into an emerging community to help foster creativity and collaboration. And now we want to upgrade our tech, go mobile, and add even more features.


Whether you’re a blogger, curator, photographer, designer, big brand, or just a fan of interesting content on the Interweb, on DashBust you can explore and share new photos, videos, audio files, articles, infographics, documents, and even more forms of digital content - for the first time all in one place, with one simple Burst!


Publish whenever or wherever you want. Schedule and queue unlimited Bursts for later and watch them automatically get published to your DashBurst and other social media channels simultaneously, saving you time so that you can continue creating or just relax.

And you can do more than publish. Get updates directly to your web browser or email whenever your favorite musician, artist, blog, brand or anyone else you follow Bursts something new.


You can also use Boards to curate and showcase interesting content like your own work, must-read articles, songs you play on repeat, or anything else you love including those odd animal couples you’re obsessed with, too.


Sounds pretty cool, right? Well, there’s more in store…. but we need your help.

First, we want to allow you to make full use of the DashBurst network on your mobile phone or tablet by introducing brand new apps customized for Android and iOS that give you better ways to discover media on demand. The freedom to openly share and explore all kinds of different content, no matter what you’re interested in or where you are!

Second, we want to expand our servers on the cloud to ensure we can provide your content to audiences as fast as possible.

Lastly, we want to give you even more features to support your content including state-of-the-art syndication, robust analytics, custom branding and many more useful options.


The DashBurst Difference

Are you a painter or photographer looking to gain more exposure? Or how about a writer or journalist looking to generate more leads through your content? What about a speaker or educator who designs presentations? These days, there are lots of multi-talented creatives, but nowhere great for them to showcase their many different kinds of creative expressions.

Until now.

DashBurst is a new, super-easy-to-use content platform and portfolio host that brings the most creative art, music, writing, and photography, designs, slideshows, and more into one place. You can even share dozens of articles and links in one post. We are breaking down the barriers between content types in hopes of changing how we collaborate together online. We have enough niche social networks! At DashBurst, we want to make all your content more social.

You worked hard on your content, so we want to give you and your fellow creators more opportunities to build audiences around all your awesome creations, all in one place.

On DashBurst, you can display your work in the format it was intended to be seen in. And, because your work deserves attention, we make it look as beautiful online as possible.

Plus, we give you increased control over your content, from choosing your creative commons licenses to tailoring how your work is shared and embedded across the web.

By contributing to our campaign, you can consider yourself a champion of creativity worldwide!


Our Mission and Goal

On June 22, we launched the initial public version of DashBurst! Our mission is to inspire new ideas, support the free flow of information, and create space for collaboration. Now we’re aiming to raise $20,000 to help us expand our servers on the cloud, build mobile apps for our platform and give you even more features to support your ideas.

We also have several rewards we’d like to offer our backers:

DB Basic

A free package to get you started on your creative path which includes 15 GB of storage space and 48 Bursts queued simultaneously! So you know we mean business, you can take advantage of this right now for free by signing up for DashBurst here: https://dashburst.com/register


DB Pro

A great value package for content creators and startups. Get 50 GB of storage space, 1 Featured Burst and a queue limit of up to 250 Bursts scheduled at once!


DB Business

A silver bullet solution for small businesses and creative agencies. Get 500 GB of storage space, 4 Featured Bursts, and a queue limit of up to 1000 Bursts scheduled at once!


DB Enterprise

An enterprise-level package for large organizations and big brands. Get 2000 GB of storage space, 16 Featured Bursts, and an unlimited number of Bursts in your queue! You will also get early access to the DashBurst API and mobile apps upon their release.


DB Unlimited

For those of you who truly want to live limit-free and get the maximum exposure for your content, get this unreleased package (only available for a limited time here on Indiegogo) and use as much space as your heart desires! You also get 50 Featured Bursts to make your best content shine on the Interweb. And, to top it all off, you will be first in line for the DashBurst API and mobile apps, plus get secret investor updates about what features are coming next on DashBurst, other news, tips and more, including early access to those new features too!



Note - All DB Pro packages and up will be eligible for enhanced analytics, lead generation and custom content branding features when released at no extra charge. Also, please refer to our Terms of Service for what is considered acceptable content to share and what content you can request to be Featured on DashBurst: https://dashburst.com/terms.

And you all are invited to check out the launch of DashBurst and follow your favorite creators!

Thank You!

We want to thank you all for your support and contributions over the years. DashBurst isn’t just another social network, it’s our digital home for everything we do and love. We have been truly humbled by the positive feedback we’ve received so far, and would greatly appreciate if you could share the news about this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or wherever else you like.

You can also come visit us at SXSW V2V Startup Spotlight on July 20th in Las Vegas. Chat more about DashBurst and meet and greet the team!


Grab Our Press Kit Here

Join Us on the DashBurst Beta

story:
Give the gift of play!

For over 50 years The Pathway School has served children with neurological impairments, including Autism Spectrum Disorders, psychological disorders, and severe emotional disturbances. Our mission has, and always will be to prepare students for a life after they leave our school; part of that mission means helping them to establish healthy, active lifestyles and mature socialization skills. What better way to do so than by learning on a playground with other children! Can you help us  raise an additional $5,000 to create a  play area for students who need it the most?

Here's how you can help!

With your contribution we will be able to build a play area complete with slides, swings, climbing walls, and other fun components adventurous kids can enjoy! As a special "thank you" for supporting we have a variety of gifts based on the amount of your donation .

No donation is too small to make a BIG impact

Children with special needs and disabilities can benefit so much more than most from having a playground, here's why:

  • It helps them to build crucial social skills, as the children interact with others through the simplicity of play.
  • Children with disabilities are more likely to be overweight or obese than their typically developing peers. A playground creates a engaging opportunity to be active outdoors, and less reliant on computers, smart phones, televisions, or game systems for fun.
  •  Exercise and outdoor play offers a healthy outlet to relieve anxieties and frustrations, allowing for increased focus in a classroom setting.

We've only raised  30% of our goal...

But your donation can help us reach it! Through the generosity of several foundations and individuals we've been able to raise $40,000 of what we need towards the playground. This amount can't purchase the playground equipment that  our students need, so we are asking for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Although your donation will get us one step closer to building a playground at Pathway, your promotional support is just as powerful! Please continue to support our efforts by sharing our story with others and spreading the word via social media. Everything helps!
story_txt:
Give the gift of play!For over 50 years The Pathway School has served children with neurological impairments, including Autism Spectrum Disorders, psychological disorders, and severe emotional disturbances. Our mission has, and always will be to prepare students for a life after they leave our school; part of that mission means helping them to establish healthy, active lifestyles and mature socialization skills. What better way to do so than by learning on a playground with other children! Can you help us  raise an additional $5,000 to create a  play area for students who need it the most?Here's how you can help!With your contribution we will be able to build a play area complete with slides, swings, climbing walls, and other fun components adventurous kids can enjoy! As a special "thank you" for supporting we have a variety of gifts based on the amount of your donation .No donation is too small to make a BIG impactChildren with special needs and disabilities can benefit so much more than most from having a playground, here's why:
It helps them to build crucial social skills, as the children interact with others through the simplicity of play.
Children with disabilities are more likely to be overweight or obese than their typically developing peers. A playground creates a engaging opportunity to be active outdoors, and less reliant on computers, smart phones, televisions, or game systems for fun.
 Exercise and outdoor play offers a healthy outlet to relieve anxieties and frustrations, allowing for increased focus in a classroom setting.
We've only raised  30% of our goal...But your donation can help us reach it! Through the generosity of several foundations and individuals we've been able to raise $40,000 of what we need towards the playground. This amount can't purchase the playground equipment that  our students need, so we are asking for your support!Other Ways You Can HelpAlthough your donation will get us one step closer to building a playground at Pathway, your promotional support is just as powerful! Please continue to support our efforts by sharing our story with others and spreading the word via social media. Everything helps!

story:
Who We Are

Brought to life by a small group of families wanting something more for their children, the Scuola Media Gilbert Keith Chesterton was founded in 2008. Since then, the school has offered a classical curriculum based in Roman Catholic tradition and the writings of British philosopher and author Gilbert Keith Chesterton. The Scuola Chesterton focuses on a positive and healthy upbringing of its students, both inside and outside of the classroom.
For the past 7 years, the school has been run by the Societá Cooperative Sociale "Capitani Coraggiosi", a cooperative that has dedicated itself to education through the organization of after-school programs, summer camps, and countless other educational activities.

The Scuola Chesterton continues to grow, thanks to the students’ families and the constant support of many friends and collaborators. However it is legally considered a family school (or perhaps a type of “homeschool”), and we do not receive any support whatsoever from the government.

 Our school is ever expanding, and a large amount of the funds we raise will go towards renting a room adjacent to the school space we have now, and will cover the cost of building two new classrooms. We are also hoping to get a head start for the 2015-2016 school year.

Founding a school is almost unheard of in Italy, as the vast majority children and adolescents are educated almost entirely in the public schools. Recently, our school has become a reference point, at a national level, for those who are looking to be more involved in their children’s education, not just relying on the material taught in the public schools.

We ask that you consider helping us by donating; sharing news of our fundraiser and our school with your acquaintances; and/or by keeping our school, students, and their families in your prayers.

Thank you for your consideration!

story:
My 60 day campaign for March and April gave $645 and it allowed me to create pivotal pieces of content. Now I'll launch a new 60 day campaign.
-Johan Nygren, med.school drop out, inventor of Basicincome.co



Introduction


I'm creating something wonderful. A new kind of taxation infrastructure, and the first use case will be unconditional basic income. You don't have to wait for your authorities to give basic income to you, you can use the internet to create new authorities.

You might think that my system is just another hype. But, it's not. I've been at this for a year now, there's been a steady increase in attention. Take a couple of your dollars, put it into my startup-phase with Basicincome.co, and see it turn into a global peer-to-peer basic income network.






REFERENCES:

"To be able to create what is the beginning of a decentralised financial security – basic income – but without relying on a government, instead relying solely on technology and your own personal network, feels incredible. I know I’ll be the first one to sign up! What Johan Nygren has come up with is truly amazing!”

https://www.cryptocoinsnews.com/bitnation-announces-decentralized-application-basic-income-based-bitcoin-2-0-technology-voluntary-fees/

 
"The BitNation team displayed their excitement to incorporate this platform and highlighting its aim to provide a naturally peaceful solution. "

http://coinssource.com/bitnation-decentralized-borderless-government-universal-basic-income/


"We have a Bitnation 3rd Party DApp, called basicincome.co developed by the Swedish prodigy Johan Nygren, using p2p cryptoledgers to create a voluntary basic income system. "

http://hplusmagazine.com/2015/02/18/interview-bitcoin-pioneer-susanne-tarkowski-tempelhof-on-bitnation-and-m/


"Basicincome.co is a part of the Resilience protocol, which is a 21st century web-based standard for dividend allocation within a co-operative. "

http://www.basicincome.org/news/2015/04/bitnation-basic-income-application-set-for-bitnation/


"Instead of receiving a share of the profit of a centralized network, each person would receive a share of the profit from a vast number of smaller decentralized clusters. The accumulative dividend flow would be pretty much the same, as in the amount of basic income. "

http://www.bitnation-blog.com/voluntary-basic-income-on-a-co-op-dividend-scheme/


"Perhaps the most eyecatching digital basic income out there is the one associated with BitNation. "

http://vice.com/read/the-cryptocurrency-based-schemes-that-would-pay-everyone-just-for-being-alive-456


"The Pangea platform boasts a blockchain notary service for registering documents on the blockchain, an encrypted email service, and a ‘DApp Library’ with links to other services such as the Basic Income program"

http://cryptonewsday.com/bitnation-releases-proof-of-concept-for-decentralized-government-platform/



BACKERS:


http://basicincome.co/backers.html



VIDEOS:












WORKING PROTOTYPE:

SOURCE-CODE,
https://github.com/p2p-safety-net-co-op-dividend-scheme/server






TECHNICAL:

My plan is to support all currencies on all financial platforms. I use subscribe functions from APIs, which makes it easy.

Each user chooses how much they want to give, buying from someone 'replicates' their 'giving-behavior' (temporarily), buying from someone who gives nothing (someone outside the system) replicates that behaviour, and so on and so forth. This might sound weird, but it's really not. A lot of smart people believe in it, and I was recently featured in the mensa (super-high IQ-people) organization's newsletter. So, it might sound weird, but it's smart. 


Andre Coehlo explained this beautifully,
http://basicincome.org/news/2015/04/bitnation-basic-income-application-set-for-bitnation/

and Amin Rafiee too,
http://coinssource.com/bitnation-decentralized-borderless-government-universal-basic-income/


I'm not asking you to believe in it. I am asking you to trust me, and the others who believe in me, and to back my work with a couple of dollars.

A core concept is dividend pathways, 




These pathways are also really smart, but also a bit hard to grasp. Every time you buy something from someone who's part of Basicincome.co, you will create a dividend pathway. When the node that you bought from sells stuff to other people, it will pay dividends (you can also call it tax) to the Basicincome.co network, and this tax will be divided on the users of the network, but not directly, instead based on the pattern of dividend pathways that exist between consumers and producers. 



A nodes tax is not only shared on the nodes that have dividend pathways to it, but on every node that has a dividend pathway to any of the nodes that have a dividend pathway to the node.  This is better said with the visualization above.

A way of understanding this is to think about how profit is shared in different types of organization. Corporations give the profit to the CEO, which is smart if you want top-down executive decision making. Co-operatives give the profit to the workers and to the costumers, which is good if you want a more democratic organization. My system gives the profit to an extended network, and lets the co-operative model network, which grows its power and its influence. A co-operative can use my system to put pressure on its entire supply chain to also join Basicincome.co. People who like the co-operative model can join forces to grow their impact. It's very smart. Basicincome.co feeds growth back into the network, and actually makes growth a good thing.




When you receive money via your pathways, they will get used up. But you will be creating new pathways as your weeks go on, and these pathways will be constantly adapting to your life and your locality. I said in my pitch to Bitnation that "your safety net emerges through the sum of your financial interactions", which is pretty spot on. Again, this might sound weird, but 400 mensa members, a couple of famed political persons, a lot of entrepreneurs, some academia people, and some other high-impact people, have all been very impressed by the idea. One person said that I was like his morpheus, he'd been looking for my eureka for 10 years.

There's a lot more to dividend pathways then I could possible go through here. One thing is that dividend pathways created to someone who gives a lot provide higher flow. This means that you will want to buy from people who give a lot, and they will want to give a lot to compete over customers. This incentive structure has been used by co-operatives for a century, and I evolve it. There's a lot of patterns in my system that has existed in one form or another in the past, and I'm sort of remixing the best ideas out there, adding a bit of my own ingenuity, and creating what has been promised to 'lead the way for people to see the true power of decentralization and peer to peer technology'.


I have alot of content online. Look it up, learn, explore, and back me so I can transform the world. That is my dream. This is my dream. And, again, Basicincome.co is built on my Resilience protocol, and it's just the first use-case of what will become a new taxation infrastructure. Follow me.



MORE LINKS:

Live Network Graph,
http://graph_dev.basicincome.co

Whitepaper,
www.resilience.world/#!whitepaper/c21xm

Previous Indiegogo (got $645),
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/basicincome-co-a-peer-to-peer-safety-net-network--2/x/9577175#/story

Johan Nygren on Twitter,
https://twitter.com/resilience_me




BITNATION


Bitnation is a sort of pirate party 2.0, that has taken the world by storm in the past year. The movement was born out of the Bitcoin-movement, and uses the technology that makes Bitcoin decentralized to decentralize everything, from money to law to parlament to welfare. Decentralization is a natural reaction to evolution, and Bitnation is the logical conclusion of the internet. We have already decentralized social media, and we are about to decentralize everything.

The movement that has grown fast in the past year, and Susanne Tarkowski Tempelhof, the charismatic leader of Bitnation, has had frequent invitations to speak at high-profile networks such as Google and TED. She discovered my work almost a year ago, and has since been promoting it as what might become an important part of the future Bitnation ecosystem.




The Blockchain


The invention that started it all is the blockchain. The blockchain will let you network with those you trust, and it will let those you trust network with those they trust, and this will let networks of trust, overlapping networks throughout which we extend our trust, it will let those networks rule the world. 

Exactly how the blockchain works, and what it's good for, is really hard to explain. People often make sarcastic remarks about people mumbling something to explain Bitcoin, and, yeah, I see what they mean by that, but the problem is really that we don't have a language for these things yet. They are so new, it's like trying to explain the internet 30 years ago,

"and you'll be able to send electronic signals to anyone anywhere and send messages and do all kinds of things"

"why would I want that when I can just go to the post office !?"

So, I won't try to tell you about what the blockchain is in detail, but it's good that you know that it has pawed the way for systems like my Resilience. 




TOMORROW


"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has."

I give you Susanne Tarkowksi Tempelhof, the disruptor who's co-ordinating the evolution of Bitnation,

story:
The network that everybody is talking about...

Introducing WorkyApp.com

Meet WorkyApp.com, Let's say you have a tight budget for a home or business project or you think you are paying too much for any service, Submit your project here and find the right professional or contractor at the lowest price.


Professionals, experienced workers and contractors can now make money faster by adding their personal or business profile here


WorkyApp.com is the fastest way to make money for professionals and experienced workers, with more than 5 million visitors per month, we can help you increase your company exposure by letting you be in our homepage and display your profile in others businesses profile.



By creating your personal or business profile and sharing it with your family and friends your business get a big boost and you get a big chance of being in our homepage depending of how many time you share your personal or business profile or how many times people visit it.



We also help Homeowners and business owners to find the right professional at the right price.



We recommend to all of our professionals listed to adjust the way they charge,  or charge by the hour so they can get more jobs



SEO Technology

We have the most advance Search Engine Technology that allow your profile and business to be indexed very fast by Google, Yahoo, Bing and others so your  profile or business can appear in search results faster, get a good ranking and at the same time get new customers.



Funding Allocation: 

We will need this funding to continue developing the website and growing our brand.

With this money:

30% Will be used to further update the site's features, to keep it on the cutting edge technology, as well as for the creation of a mobile app.

30% Will be used for marketing purposes (e.g. creating an institutional video, creating brand awareness, promotions, etc.)

20% Will be used for administrative purposes (e.g. Hosting)

10% Will be used for content creation


WorkyApp.com

5 MILLION VISITORS A MONTH

2,000 professionals and experienced workers join daily


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us sharing this project using facebook, twitter, email, etc

story:
Reaching the Goal

LCA has been educating and discipling bilingual students in San Jose, Costa Rica for more than 20 years.

God has blessed us in recent years with new students and we're challenged with limited installations (especially the chapel where Bible, music, art classes share). For five years we've been working towards an $80,000 building project goal in order to have a multi-use room (art, music, library), science classroom and bathrooms for high school.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach the remaining $10,000 before August 4, 2015.  We're asking 400 supporters to make a suggested donation of $25.  All funds received (even if below the campaign goal) will go directly to the project.  See the sidebar for the "perks" associated with donations of $25, $50 or $100.

The Impact

As well as offering an excellent bilingual education (our school is known especially for math/English skills and projects), the school also focuses on discipling young people. One student recently shared his testimony in his home church (we are a ministry of Union Church) about coming to LCA as an unbeliever and learning about Jesus through his classmates. 

With this donation, your partnership will provide a needed space for students to experience the God of beauty (art and music classes) and creation (sciences).  

Other Ways You Can Help

We invite you to consider:

  • Pray that we'll make the goal before August 4th so students can begin classes with this construction completed.
  • Share this important opportunity with family, friends, and other social media contacts.
