What We Need & What You Get
 Our goal is to reach the remaining $10,000 before August 4, 2015.  We're asking 400 supporters to make a suggested donation of $25.  All funds received (even if below the campaign goal) will go directly to the project.  See the sidebar for the "perks" associated with donations of $25, $50 or $100.   The Impact As well as offering an excellent bilingual education (our school is known especially for math/English skills and projects), the school also focuses on discipling young people. One student recently shared his testimony in his home church (we are a ministry of Union Church) about coming to LCA as an unbeliever and learning about Jesus through his classmates. 
With this donation, your partnership will provide a needed space for students to experience the God of beauty (art and music classes) and creation (sciences).  
Other Ways You Can Help
 We invite you to consider:  Pray that we'll make the goal before August 4th so students can begin classes with this construction completed. Share this important opportunity with family, friends, and other social media contacts.

story:
Education for Hope is a non-profit organization that provides resources to build and repair schools suitable for learning in Sierra Leone. Since the organization’s founding, EFH has:

▪  completed a school structure in Tumba village, where more than 120 primary school children attend school

▪  shipped over 27,000 books to the Sierra Leone Library Board, which they distributed to libraries, schools, colleges and universities, and tertiary institutions across the country

▪  delivered 150 sport packs with school supplies to school children of All Nations School, School for the Deaf and Blind, and Tumba Primary

▪  provided teaching resources to 10 teachers.

Three Communities Elementary School Project

Education for Hope is currently embarked on an ambitious project building a nine-room primary school that will serve three villages with a total of over 160 children. Completing this school will give these children the opportunity to go to school for the first time. Many of the children are from impoverished backgrounds and live in homes with thatched roofs, no running water, or proper sanitation.  Most of their family members are not able to read or write. Their parents are subsistence farmers who depend on the surplus of their produce to support their families. 

Phase I of the project has been completed, which included the foundation and first layer of bricks. The project was put on hold due to the devastating Ebola outbreak, but it has now resumed. Phase II is underway, however, we need your help and support to complete this school. Each day that goes by is a day that these children are being denied the opportunity to break the cycle of poverty. You can help Sierra Leone recover from the civil war and the Ebola outbreak that have cost many lives and set back valuable progress gained over the past years - you can help by educating the leaders of tomorrow.

Please help Education for Hope take this project across the finish line?

The goal of Education for Hope is to raise $10,000 to complete this second phase and another $10,000 to complete the school. No donation is too small, and every penny counts. Know that 100% of your donation will support this project. Education for Hope is an all-volunteer organization. You can view the blueprint and photos of the project on our website at http://www.educationforhope.org/projects/three-... .

Thank you for your generous investment and support. Please note that all donations are tax deductible.

story:
We have been active since August 2014 and since that day we have never closed: every day we publish infographics, created by us, publish and share a couple of articles, written by us or for us by teachers.

We use a very particular communicative system made of quotations, aphorisms and concepts not by famous pedagogues or excellence of education, but we try to give voice to teachers today, those who make the school every - single - day.

The social pages and blogs have taken on a very particular character: that’s because the one who creates the images is not a graphic designer, the one who writes the articles is not a journalist, the one who programs the site is not a computer programmer and the one who deals with the social media is not a social media manager. We have become the way.

Striving more than ever to understand every detail of the task that we had to accomplish, inspired by the greatest of the sector, without ever forgetting who we turn to: the teacher.


 

How was Your Edu Action born?

Everything comes from a "Textbook Representative" of 24 years. (In Italy there are sales agents of the publishing houses that go to schools to propose school textbooks to be used in the following school year) and his way of seeing School through the eyes of a "neo-employed ex-student" of only 5 years.
After hundreds of interviews with Italian teachers of all levels, afternoon meetings with teachers and principals, assistance for multimedia versions of textbooks and training in digital teaching, he noticed one aspect of the Italian school which was not discussed in Mass Media and that no one knew (or imagined): the very low level of teacher motivation and a training mode that did not meet the real needs of today’s teacher.
And from that moment, enlightenment came to him: Why not create a community on the web, with a fresh style, to try to motivate the teacher reminding him every day that his work matters and sharing effective teaching strategies written by teachers themselves?
Obviously many other portals did this already, but in a more rigorous way, with terms not used in schools and written by journalists who, most likely, had not spent even a second in front of 25 students! Obviously everything was done as a hobby after work without any investment or sponsorship.
But after its launch , YourEdu Action, from being a complete stranger but with a quantity of shares to be coveted by any news organization, has attracted the attention of thousands of teachers and educators and companies in the education sector, for its striking communication style and the topics covered : in fact, after a few months, it was no longer the founder who wrote , but dozens of teachers who sent their teaching strategies used in the classroom to be made available to the whole community that increased day by day more and more!

 

Now, what do we do?

A year after its birth, YourEduAction has over 21k likers on facebook and a high involvement of teachers due to the high number of collaborations undertaken and initiatives that have had national resonance, such as the "Italian Week for the Teacher" supported by Corriere Della Sera, the leading national newspaper, in which we asked anyone to use the hash tag #RingraziaUnDocente (#ThankATeacher) to thank, even decades later, their teacher for what he had taught. A great success: in that week, many journalists, VIPs and politicians used the hashtag promoted by us, making it a top-tweet for several days! All this would never have happened if Your Edu Action had not reached an agreement with MasterProf, a site run by the students of a school that collects all the extra-ordinary stories of teachers to report to the Global Teacher Prize, the Nobel for teaching, promoted by the Varkey Foundation.

Franco di Mare supports "Settimana Italiana dell'Insegnante" (Italian teaching appreciation week)

Oscar Farinetti supports "Settimana Italiana dell'Insegnante" (Italian teaching appreciation week)

Paolo Crepet supports "Settimana Italiana dell'Insegnante" (Italian teaching appreciation week)

Beppe Severgnini supports "Settimana Italiana dell'Insegnante" (Italian teaching appreciation week)

Where Your Edu Action is going ?

Your Edu Action has the ambition to become a point of reference for the Italian teacher. And to do that it cannot continue its activities without an investment.
Everything we do is unpaid and is carried out in the hours after work and at weekends, with an awesome organizational effort! We want this to become our main activity.
We want to promote a new way of teaching that meets the real needs of today's students. A school situation where technology is the rule, not the exception. Where digital teaching is a means, not an end. Where the student is the center around which the whole process of learning evolves, and that happens through a socio-emotional path that places its bases on new technologies, and allows the development of knowledge and skills that persist over time, thanks to the publication of the teaching strategies by the teachers for the teachers.
A society and a government that truly appreciate and esteem the teacher considering him to be the fundamental element of a country that improves, thanks to the initiatives that we want to promote with the popular response.
We believe in the role of the teacher, after all. We believe in the awareness of the responsibility that the Italian educator has a country in his hands a country in need of revival, in need of a secure and certain future. We believe in his strength of mind though poorly supported by parents and annoying bureaucratic conflicts.

As for you: BELIEVE IN US!

story:
High unemployment rate, crime, and people leaving the city at a rampant pace, has left Flint in a state of much-needed rebuilding.

Being a resident of Flint my entire life, I've seen the good, the bad, and the downright ugliness of our city. But Flint is still my heart; my home, and rather than run away, I want to help make our city a beautiful place once again.

My mom had a strong walk with christ and because of that, she instilled a lot of great values in me and my sister.  Anyone that knew her knew she had a HUGE heart and was a big giver - whether it was her time, love, or money.  That spirit of giving still lives on.

I absolutely care for children, especially being a big kid myself. Anyone who knows me know this to be true.  I never realized that children had such an affinity for me until a Pastor gave me a prophecy when I was 19 years old. 

16 years later, I'm still doing things for the kids in my neighborhood, along with some other friends, such as, Buying basketball hoops, volleyball nets,  taking them to the park, etc. 



No matter what I'm doing throughout the week, you can find me every weekend at Sarvis Park with nothing less than 5-10 of the neighbors' kids with me.  However, sometimes the park isn't safe, which is why their parents won't let them go unless I take them.  This is why it would be nice to have a rec center where they could have a safe place to go.  Plus, I'll be able to reach more kids on a bigger scale, and find more like-minded individuals who are willing to help the cause.

Sure, there are lots of wonderful things going on downtown, but when I travel deep into the inner city of Flint, I get a chilling sense of emptiness.



Children are the future, and as more and more buildings get torn down (such as businesses, houses, parks, and even schools) there will be nothing left for the children we leave behind.


Help us to help our community restore its beauty once again, starting with mentoring our youth, and giving them opportunities to have another outlet besides just wandering aimlessly in the streets.

A place where we can be mentors and nurture their dreams, goals, and aspirations. Even helping them get on the right track to achieving what they want.
I have a cousin, George Grundy Jr., who is a war veteran, that also decided to come back and help the community. He has a non-profit organization with Habitat for Humanity, and is having a building renovated downtown as we speak, thanks to the support of GM, Consumers Energy, and a few others. 

Whether it's $1 or $100, it's the thought that counts. I'll be sure to give credit to any and all those that contribute. If you'd rather remain anonymous, that's fine, and I'll respect your wish.

If a financial contribution isn't possible for you right now, you can still help. I welcome all the assistance we can get just by spreading the word. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use... whatever you feel is appropriate to do.

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Lamont Lloyd

story:
Let's build a college!

Join us in starting an accredited college that will "truly" be reasonably priced and help those who need and desire get a quality college education.


Problems we will solve:

  1. High Cost
    • High Tuition
    • Fees for just about anything
  2. Difficult Admissions Requirements
    • Strict credit transfer rules
    • High GPA requirements
    • Admissions tests
    • Letters of recommendations
  3. Scheduling Flexibility
    • Having to wait for the start of a term
    • Not offering the courses you need in a term
  4. Degree Program and Course Issues
    • Courses are not relevant to the program
    • Degree not marketable
  5. School Issues
    • Schools are not transparent
    • Lack of "real" graduate job placement assistance

So as you can see there are several problems with colleges and universities these days and we will solve them starting with cost.

Question: Why do most people who want to go to college end up NOT going?

Number 1 Reason: The cost!


Problem 1: High Cost of College

As you may have noticed, the cost of college is astronomical! And there is no reason for it. For example, there are colleges that get billions of dollars in endowments and donations each year, but the tuition for those schools are the highest! It doesn't make sense. Also, have you noticed that colleges nickel and dime you to death with fees? They have admission fees, graduation fees, transfer fees, technology fees, registration fees, student activity fees, and many others! By the time all those fees are added to your tuition, your tuition has doubled. Again, it does not make sense - especially for on-line schools! The tuition should easily be able to take care of everything, and it should be reasonable.

Our Solution to High Cost:

  1. Change the business model. Our realistic and common sense infrastructure and business model will ensure that our tuition rate will be one of the lowest in the country, if not the lowest. We researched private colleges that offer similar programs to those that we will be offering, and we were shocked. For example, a basic two-year associate degree ranged from $24,000 to over $38,000! And that is just for an associate degree! You can double those costs for a four-year bachelor degree. Our associate degree will be one fourth the cost of their programs! That's 75% less, and for a better degree!
  2. There will be no fees! Period!
  3. We will establish a not-for-profit foundation and 100% of all donations will go to pay for tuition scholarships and grants for those who need it. Any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation.

Problem 2: Difficult Admissions Requirements

Most schools have strict and sometimes very difficult admissions requirements, such as credit transfer rules, GPA requirements, admissions test, letters of recommendations, etc.

Our Solution to Difficult Admissions Requirements:

  1. We will not have any strict requirements. Our requirements will be what are minimally required by the State Department of Education and Regional Accreditation Boards. And remember, there will be no admissions fee.
  2. You will be able to enroll at any time and get accepted very quickly. You will not have to wait for a specific enrollment period.
  3. We will have the most flexible course credit transfer rules possible. We will allow the maximum number of transfer credits based on what are minimally required by the State Department of Education and Regional Accreditation Boards.

Our goal is to make getting into college extremely simple.


Problem 3: Scheduling Flexibility

There are two huge problems you often see with colleges: 1) having to wait for the start of a term; and 2) the courses you need are not offered in a term.

Our Solution to Scheduling Flexibility:

  1. There will not be any terms. Our schedule will not be based on terms. You will be able to enroll in a course at any time.
  2. All of our courses will be on-line and available at any time.

Problem 4: Degree Program and Course Issues

Often degree programs are not marketable and courses are not relevant to the program. We have engineered processes to solve these problems. All of our degree programs will be highly sought after and marketable.

Our Solution to Degree Program and Course Issues:

  1. We will perform a needs analysis for all of our programs and courses. We will research the needs of employers. Our courses will be current and relevant based on what knowledge and skills employers are looking for. It only makes sense! Why take a course that is not needed?
  2. All of our professors will be required to have several years of "real world" experience in their field of expertise and not just have a college degree. Our students will greatly benefit from this experience being passed on to them in their courses.
  3. Our programs and courses will focus on how to apply the knowledge you learned in a course, rather than just bookwork or memorization. In most cases our students will be learning by doing.
  4. Our courses will be smaller, bite-sized, and cover the specific information you need to know. Most courses offered by colleges are long and drawn out over a period of time, often causing unnecessary information added to the courses just to meet course size requirements. We will not add fluff to a course just to meet course size requirements.
  5. We have designed detailed review processes in place to ensure our programs and courses remain current and relevant. We will continue to review the knowledge and skills employers are looking for.

Problem 5: School Issues

  • Schools are often not very transparent about their programs, costs, staff, and requirements. You have to dig or talk to admissions staff member, who is often a sales person, just to find out something. There are schools that don't even post their tuition costs on their website. You have to call them and talk to a salesperson to find out. Usually, this means they have something to hide, such as high tuition rates.
  • Additionally, most schools don't offer much in terms of graduate job placement assistance. Often they simply offer counseling and not much more. We will offer "real" graduate job placement assistance to help our graduates find work when they graduate.

Our Solution to School Transparency:

  • We will be extremely transparent. You will be able to easily find any information about our programs, costs, staff, or any other information on our web site and school catalog. We will also have academic advisers, not admissions or sales staff, available to answer any questions.

Our Solution to Graduate Job Placement Assistance:

  1. We will partner with state employment agencies, recruiters, and employers to bring them and our graduates together.
  2. We will establish our own on-line jobs board. Our graduates will be able to post their resumes at no cost. Employers and recruiters will be able to search and access those resumes. Additionally, employers and recruiters will be able to post jobs to the job site that our graduates will be able to access.
  3. Our graduates will have access to a trained career counselor on staff that will provide guidance, answer questions, and review resumes.
  4. Our graduates will have access to professional development and continuing education courses after graduation to help you keep your skills sharp, current, and relevant so you can stay competitive in your career. They can help you with career and salary advancement by becoming more effective in your job.

Project Goals

Phase 1: Infrastructure

  • In this first phase we will need to develop the infrastructure and processes to design, develop, and deliver our programs and courses to our students. This is required and needs to be in place for licensing and accreditation purposes.

Phase 2: Course Development

  • In this phase, our instructors, subject matter experts, and academic staff will develop the needed courses for the degree programs.

Phase 3: Department of Education License and Approvals

  • In this phase we will secure the required approvals and licensing through the state Department of Education.

Phase 4: Accreditation

  • In this phase we will apply for accreditation. School accreditation is extremely important because it shows that a school meets certain standards of quality. It also helps with program acceptability and recognition by other schools for the transfer of credits and validity of the program by employers.

Project Team

  • The project team consists of several higher education professionals with years of experience in teaching, education administration, education development, and licensing and accreditation.

  • The project team is lead by Gary Harris, a long time educator, who was a former Dean of a large on-line university, and is retired from the United States Air Force. His impressive credentials and passion for education has spanned more than 30 years. Gary has developed and taught several courses and has managed the design and development of over 120 courses.



  • Gary has a master's degree in Engineering Management, has project management credentials from PMI and Stanford University, and is currently working on an Education Specialist degree at the University of Missouri.

The Impact - A College Like No Other

We can accomplish these goals with your support and start a new college like no other.

  • A college that has reasonable tuition rates and does not put a financial burden on students.

  • A college that is easy to get in and be able to enroll in the courses you need.

  • A college that offers relevant and quality programs and courses with degrees that are highly marketable.

  • A college that will "really" help their graduates find work.

How will the funds be used?

As you can see, this sizable undertaking will require some serious funding needs. But with your support, we can do it.

  • The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds for phase 1 of the project which is to develop the infrastructure and processes to deliver our programs and courses. This will include the development of needed systems such as a learning and student management and mobile web systems; and the development of processes and policies, such as course development and delivery processes. This will also help fund two new positions for this work. All of this sounds boring, but it is required to be in place before applying for licensing and accreditation.

  • 52% of the funds received will go to perks and rewards and 48% will go to the project phase to develop the infrastructure and processes to deliver our programs and courses.

  • Any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation. If we don't reach our funding goal, we will still apply the funds received to the project and continue to work to fund the project because we believe in this project. This will simply slow the project, but not stop it.

Risks and Challenges

  • The risks are minimal. None of the risks will stop the project, but simply delay it, such as limited funding.

  • The one main challenge we have is the requirement to have everything in place prior to applying for Department of Education approvals and licenses. This includes the infrastructure, processes and policies, degree programs and courses, headquarters facility, instructors, and support staff. We have mitigated this challenge by investing over three years of research and developing a detailed project plan to cover this and other challenges and potential risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Please tell your friends and family about our project on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other sites. Indiegogo has some great share tools to help get out the word.

  2. Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/@PSICert

  3. Link to us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/professional-s...

  4. Connect to us on Google+: https://plus.google.com/+Professionalstandardsi...

  5. To get additional information, news, and announcements about the project, and to track its progress, visit and monitor www.ePoly.org.

  6. If you or someone you know have a master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited college or university with several years of experience in your field of expertise and may be interested in developing or teaching courses, monitor the project web site www.ePoly.org as we will be posting job openings in the future.

PERKS

And for supporting us, we have some really nice perks and rewards for you. As you can see - we have a passion for education - for supporting our project we will support you.

They include courses, professional certification and credential programs, and discounted tuition to the new college.

$5 Support - Supporter

  • In recognition of your support, your name will appear on our website donor page.

$15 Support - Believer

  • In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 4-hour continuing education course.

$20 Support - Associate

  • In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for an associate level certification.

$30 Support - Senior

  • In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a senior level certification.

$40 Support - Master

  • In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a master level certification.

$50 Support - Professional

$75 Support - Specialist

  • In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a master level certification and a voucher for two 4-hour continuing education courses.

$100 Support - Builder

This means that you can take a currently offered program or course, or a future program or course offered in the next two years. For information on available and future programs and courses, please visit www.ProfessionalStandardsInstitute.com.


Thank You!

The names of all donors will appear on our website donor page.

And remember - any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation.

Together, we can make a difference in many people's lives - maybe even yours.
story_txt:
Let's build a college!

Join us in starting an accredited college that will "truly" be reasonably priced and help those who need and desire get a quality college education.

Problems we will solve:

High Cost

High Tuition
Fees for just about anything


Difficult Admissions Requirements

Strict credit transfer rules
High GPA requirements
Admissions tests
Letters of recommendations


Scheduling Flexibility

Having to wait for the start of a term
Not offering the courses you need in a term


Degree Program and Course Issues

Courses are not relevant to the program
Degree not marketable


School Issues

Schools are not transparent
Lack of "real" graduate job placement assistance



So as you can see there are several problems with colleges and universities these days and we will solve them starting with cost.
Question:  Why do most people who want to go to college end up NOT going?
Number 1 Reason:  The cost!

Problem 1:  High Cost of College


As you may have noticed, the cost of college is astronomical!  And there is no reason for it.  For example, there are colleges that get billions of dollars in endowments and donations each year, but the tuition for those schools are the highest!  It doesn't make sense.  Also, have you noticed that colleges nickel and dime you to death with fees?  They have admission fees, graduation fees, transfer fees, technology fees, registration fees, student activity fees, and many others!  By the time all those fees are added to your tuition, your tuition has doubled.  Again, it does not make sense - especially for on-line schools!  The tuition should easily be able to take care of everything, and it should be reasonable.


Our Solution to High Cost:

Change the business model.  Our realistic and common sense infrastructure and business model will ensure that our tuition rate will be one of the lowest in the country, if not the lowest.  We researched private colleges that offer similar programs to those that we will be offering, and we were shocked.  For example, a basic two-year associate degree ranged from $24,000 to over $38,000!  And that is just for an associate degree!  You can double those costs for a four-year bachelor degree.  Our associate degree will be one fourth the cost of their programs!  That's 75% less, and for a better degree!

There will be no fees!  Period!
We will establish a not-for-profit foundation and 100% of all donations will go to pay for tuition scholarships and grants for those who need it.  Any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation.


Problem 2:  Difficult Admissions Requirements

Most schools have strict and sometimes very difficult admissions requirements, such as credit transfer rules, GPA requirements, admissions test, letters of recommendations, etc.


Our Solution to Difficult Admissions Requirements:

We will not have any strict requirements.  Our requirements will be what are minimally required by the State Department of Education and Regional Accreditation Boards.  And remember, there will be no admissions fee.
You will be able to enroll at any time and get accepted very quickly.  You will not have to wait for a specific enrollment period.
We will have the most flexible course credit transfer rules possible.  We will allow the maximum number of transfer credits based on what are minimally required by the State Department of Education and Regional Accreditation Boards.

Our goal is to make getting into college extremely simple.

Problem 3:  Scheduling Flexibility


There are two huge problems you often see with colleges: 1) having to wait for the start of a term; and 2) the courses you need are not offered in a term.


Our Solution to Scheduling Flexibility:

There will not be any terms.  Our schedule will not be based on terms.  You will be able to enroll in a course at any time.
All of our courses will be on-line and available at any time.


Problem 4:  Degree Program and Course Issues


Often degree programs are not marketable and courses are not relevant to the program.  We have engineered processes to solve these problems.  All of our degree programs will be highly sought after and marketable.


Our Solution to Degree Program and Course Issues:

We will perform a needs analysis for all of our programs and courses.  We will research the needs of employers.  Our courses will be current and relevant based on what knowledge and skills employers are looking for.  It only makes sense!  Why take a course that is not needed?
All of our professors will be required to have several years of "real world" experience in their field of expertise and not just have a college degree.  Our students will greatly benefit from this experience being passed on to them in their courses.
Our programs and courses will focus on how to apply the knowledge you learned in a course, rather than just bookwork or memorization.  In most cases our students will be learning by doing.
Our courses will be smaller, bite-sized, and cover the specific information you need to know.  Most courses offered by colleges are long and drawn out over a period of time, often causing unnecessary information added to the courses just to meet course size requirements.  We will not add fluff to a course just to meet course size requirements.
We have designed detailed review processes in place to ensure our programs and courses remain current and relevant.  We will continue to review the knowledge and skills employers are looking for.


Problem 5:  School Issues


Schools are often not very transparent about their programs, costs, 
staff, and requirements.  You have to dig or talk to admissions staff 
member, who is often a sales person, just to find out something.  There 
are schools that don't even post their tuition costs on their website.  
You have to call them and talk to a salesperson to find out.  Usually, 
this means they have something to hide, such as high tuition rates.


Additionally, most schools don't offer much in terms of graduate job placement assistance.  Often they simply offer counseling and not much more.  We will offer "real" graduate job placement assistance to help our graduates find work when they graduate.


Our Solution to School Transparency:

We will be extremely transparent.  You will be able to easily find any information about our programs, costs, staff, or any other information on our web site and school catalog.  We will also have academic advisers, not admissions or sales staff, available to answer any questions.


Our Solution to Graduate Job Placement Assistance:

We will partner with state employment agencies, recruiters, and employers to bring them and our graduates together.
We will establish our own on-line jobs board.  Our graduates will be able to post their resumes at no cost.  Employers and recruiters will be able to search and access those resumes.  Additionally, employers and recruiters will be able to post jobs to the job site that our graduates will be able to access.
Our graduates will have access to a trained career counselor on staff that will provide guidance, answer questions, and review resumes.
Our graduates will have access to professional development and continuing education courses after graduation to help you keep your skills sharp, current, and relevant so you can stay competitive in your career.  They can help you with career and salary advancement by becoming more effective in your job.


Project Goals

Phase 1:  Infrastructure

In this first phase we will need to develop the infrastructure and processes to design, develop, and deliver our programs and courses to our students.  This is required and needs to be in place for licensing and accreditation purposes.

Phase 2:  Course Development

In this phase, our instructors, subject matter experts, and academic staff will develop the needed courses for the degree programs.

Phase 3:  Department of Education License and Approvals

In this phase we will secure the required approvals and licensing through the state Department of Education.

Phase 4:  Accreditation

In this phase we will apply for accreditation.  School accreditation is extremely important because it shows that a school meets certain standards of quality.  It also helps with program acceptability and recognition by other schools for the transfer of credits and validity of the program by employers.


Project Team

The project team consists of several higher education professionals with years of experience in teaching, education administration, education development, and licensing and accreditation.

The project team is lead by Gary Harris, a long time educator, who was a former Dean of a large on-line university, and is retired from the United States Air Force.  His impressive credentials and passion for education has spanned more than 30 years.  Gary has developed and taught several courses and has managed the design and development of over 120 courses.



Gary has a master's degree in Engineering Management, has project management credentials from PMI and Stanford University, and is currently working on an Education Specialist degree at the University of Missouri.


The Impact - A College Like No Other

We can accomplish these goals with your support and start a new college like no other.

A college that has reasonable tuition rates and does not put a financial burden on students.

A college that is easy to get in and be able to enroll in the courses you need.

A college that offers relevant and quality programs and courses with degrees that are highly marketable.

A college that will "really" help their graduates find work.


How will the funds be used?
As you can see, this sizable undertaking will require some serious funding needs.  But with your support, we can do it.

The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds for phase 1 of the project which is to develop the infrastructure and processes to deliver our programs and courses.  This will include the development of needed systems such as a learning and student management and mobile web systems; and the development of processes and policies, such as course development and delivery processes.  This will also help fund two new positions for this work.  All of this sounds boring, but it is required to be in place before applying for licensing and accreditation.



52% of the funds received will go to perks and rewards and 48% will go to the project phase to develop the infrastructure and processes to deliver our programs and courses.


Any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation.  If we don't reach our funding goal, we will still apply the funds received to the project and continue to work to fund the project because we believe in this project.  This will simply slow the project, but not stop it.


Risks and Challenges


The risks are minimal.  None of the risks will stop the project, but simply delay it, such as limited funding.

The one main challenge we have is the requirement to have everything in place prior to applying for Department of Education approvals and licenses.  This includes the infrastructure, processes and policies, degree programs and courses, headquarters facility, instructors, and support staff.  We have mitigated this challenge by investing over three years of research and developing a detailed project plan to cover this and other challenges and potential risks.


Other Ways You Can Help


Please tell your friends and family about our project on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other sites.  Indiegogo has some great share tools to help get out the word.

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/@PSICert

Link to us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/professional-s...

Connect to us on Google+: https://plus.google.com/+Professionalstandardsi...

To get additional information, news, and announcements about the project, and to track its progress, visit and monitor www.ePoly.org.

If you or someone you know have a master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited college or university with several years of experience in your field of expertise and may be interested in developing or teaching courses, monitor the project web site www.ePoly.org as we will be posting job openings in the future.


PERKS

And for supporting us, we have some really nice perks and rewards for you.  As you can see - we have a passion for education - for supporting our project we will support you.
They include courses, professional certification and credential programs, and discounted tuition to the new college.
$5 Support - Supporter

In recognition of your support, your name will appear on our website donor page.

$15 Support - Believer

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 4-hour continuing education course.

$20 Support - Associate

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for an associate level certification.

$30 Support - Senior

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a senior level certification.

$40 Support - Master

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a master level certification.

$50 Support - Professional

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a master level certification and a voucher for a 4-hour continuing education course.

$75 Support - Specialist

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for the testing and certification fee for a master level certification and a voucher for two 4-hour continuing education courses.

$100 Support - Builder

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 15 to 19 hour instructor facilitated professional development course.

$125 Support - Champion

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 20 to 24 hour instructor facilitated professional development course.

$150 Support - Executive

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 25 to 29 hour instructor facilitated professional development course.

$175 Support - Visionary

In recognition of your support, you will receive a voucher for a 30 to 34 hour instructor facilitated professional development course.

$10,000 Support - Honorary Founder

In recognition of your support, you will receive all of the perks listed above, plus your name will be listed on the new college "Founders" page as an honorary founder.

Note:  The vouchers for training and certifications above are good for two years.  This means that you can take a currently offered program or course, or a future program or course offered in the next two years.  For information on available and future programs and courses, please visit www.ProfessionalStandardsInstitute.com.
Thank You!

The names of all donors will appear on our website donor page.
And remember - any funds received above and beyond our funding goal for this campaign will be applied to other phases of the project or go to the not-for-profit foundation.
Together, we can make a difference in many people's lives - maybe even yours.

story:
The 67th Precinct Clergy Council, Inc., is a charitable organization providing relief to the distressed and underprivileged community members of the 67th Precinct in Brooklyn, New York.

We focus on lessening neighborhood tensions and the burdens on government, combating community deterioration and juvenile delinquency, and acting as a liaison among police officers, community members, and the Corporation’s congregation.

The Corporation’s  membership is comprised of local pastors, associate pastors, ministers, elders and evangelists, who further the religious and charitable mission of the Corporation by supporting youth and crime prevention programs, providing counseling and support to members of the community and offering solutions to problems arising in the 67th Precinct (Brooklyn, New York).

We need your help to carry out our mission to support families who lost children to gun violence. No donation is too small.

You can also show your support by volunteering in the community and sharing our campaign with your friends and family.  For more information please log onto our website.www.67clergycouncil.org Please Mail Checks to: 203 East 37th St. Brooklyn, NY 11203

story:
My name is Jakub Kadziak and I am a graduate of English Studies at the University of Łódź in Poland. Now, you might have heard Woody Allen’s warning, ‘Just don’t take any courses where they make you read Beowulf.’ But take, for example, The Lord of the Rings or Game of Thrones with their grand battles, fearsome monsters and brave heroes. The epic motion pictures of today owe much to the heroic epic of old. Even though Beowulf was written more than a thousand years ago, its message is surprisingly modern: what it takes to be a hero. After all, is it not so that everyone wants to be one? Some want to destroy the Ring, others – power. And I want to take a course where they would make me read Beowulf.

Like a hero does, I set off on a journey, since Poland’s distance from Northwest Europe can be a bit of a disadvantage when it comes to Anglo-Saxon and Viking studies. The lack of experts and sources prompted me to leave home in summer 2013 and make for Britain, where I had to fight monsters – like a hero.

The brutal life of an immigrant was the first to come: as a newcomer to the UK, I had limited job opportunities, which usually meant underpaid labour. No matter my first class degree, I mopped the floor, washed grime dishes, and cleaned toilets.

Time was next: often holding more than one position, I tried to balance my professional life and academic pursuits. After work, I was writing my personal statement for postgraduate study at Durham and I was rewarded when my offer letter arrived.

And the most fearsome, money, comes last: I come from a lower-class background; my family cannot support me financially. Through my hard work I have accumulated approximately £13,500, the best part of what I need to cover tuition, meals and accommodation, books and resources. But the total cost of study is £17,000. Hence my kind request for your support in this fight.

Ally yourself with me and donate. You can change my life!

story:
The Next Chapter Book Club is a community-based literacy and social program for adolescents and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. In 2010, Memphis Center for Independent Living received its first grant to bring the Next Chapter Book Club here, and we are currently seeking funding to continue this program for its fifth and sixth year. This program requires about $5000 per quarter to run. This funding covers books and supplies, a small salary, and assistive technology to help our book clubs remain accessible and inclusive. Any donation is welcome and appreciated. Please help us keep this program going strong and growing strong.

To learn more, e-mail elise@mcil.org.

The Memphis Center for Independent Living is at 1633 Madison.

Elise Fuller is the Next Chapter Book Club Coordinator for the Memphis Center for Independent Living.

story:
Educate and Empower. Fund 1 of 141 schools that will change the face of Pakistan. ‪#‎CARE141‬


 We have collectively mourned the injustice of  innocent lives lost. We have vowed never to forget. 

Our tears will not make a difference. Our actions Will.

In Commemoration of the Peshawar Army Public School Attack, in which 141 innocent children lost their lives, CARE Pakistan  has launched a 141 School Adoption Programme. The goal is to adopt 141 Government Schools in failing conditions and transform them into flourishing and liberating institutions which will bring the light of education into the lives of thousands of children. 8 schools have already been pledged. This will be the 9th.

We, the Trustees and Friends of CARE Pakistan in the UK, beleive that the best tribute possible to each life lost is to invest in the one thing that can directly undercut the criminal ignorance that took their lives. EDUCATION.

The sad fact is that Pakistan has the second largest number of children out of school in the world, at more than 7 million.  Even sadder is the fact that there are tens of thousands of government schools across the country which are non functional.

CARE is the only Pakistani charity that focuses on adopting, repairing and equipping government schools and running them at a standard comparable to the better private schools. Presently CARE educates 175000 children in 257 schools across Pakistan. 

When CARE adopts these schools they have a basic building but no facilities at all;  no electricity, no fans, no black boards, no furniture and most importantly no teachers who teach and so no education.  CARE repairs the buildings and adds more rooms according to need, puts in fans, electricity, toilets, running water, furniture, a library, a laboratory and most importantly  teachers it has trained with  Montessori and other state of the art teaching methodologies.  The result is that children flock to the CARE schools . The demand is overwhelming! A large majority of CARE schools run on double shifts. CARE was also the first charity in Pakistan to use English as a medium of education, with the goal to give underprivileged children an even playing field with their more fortunate brothers and sisters. Children studying in CARE schools regularly achieve top positions in Board exams.

We believe CARE's model is the most economically efficient and effective way to counter the education crisis in Pakistan.


It only takes £14000 to repair and equip a school of 350 children and run it for a year. 

If 500 people were to give £28 each we could have the school up and running within 2 weeks....that is all it takes. 

 Every Pound that you contribute will help empower a child.

For more information visit our website: 

http://www.carepakistan.org.uk

#CARE141

story:
Dear fellow earth-lings!

What you see is what you get and that is the reason why I am running this campaign. I do not want anyone to be bullied just because she has disturbing teeth formation when you can actually help her achieve an Anti-Bullying Smile.. That "her" thing is me. I hear people criticizing my teeth. I heard them saying "I pity her. She has brains but I am afraid she can't afford braces coz her teeth looks like saw." I took a break in school because I was bullied a lot just because of my teeth but I dont want to end up my life like a turtle hiding itself inside its shell when afraid. I know and I pray that generous people can help me . 

I, myself, want to ask for something that can change my life for me to continue it and I do not doubt that there are nice people who are willing to help or to donate any amount of money so I can have my teeth fixed. Please help me achieve an Anti-Bullying Smile. Thank you for those who will help and to those who read my profile.

story:
Ever wonder what kind of charity a Nobel Prize-winning economist would support?  A capacity-building charity! Dr. Robert Shiller and Dr. Virginia Shiller will tell you why in our video clip.

NEWS FLASH!  Sunday, April 19, 2015!  The Shillers have just donated  $2000 in fulfillment of their offer of a matching grant!  This is a wonderful BOOST to our fund-raising effort!  Thank you to ALL our supporters for stepping up to the challenge!  (Please take a look at our new perks, especially for our many grateful Shiller fans!)

In Haiti, people with disabilities need rehab — and they need to receive their therapy from Haitian therapists!  A new Rehab Department is about to open  at the Episcopal University of Haiti  ( UNEPH*).  The new department is affiliated with their well-respected School of Nursing (FSIL*) .

The nursing school started the first four-year degree in nursing, in just the same way, at UNEPH, ten years ago.  It now also has a master's degree program for Family Nurse Practioners!

We will offer 4-year degrees in Occupational Therapy (OT, or in French érgothérapie) and Physical Therapy (PT, or in French physiothérapie). For the first time Haiti will have its own team of rehab professionals: OTs and PTs who will be able to do it all:

  • evaluate patients
  • plan therapy
  • supervise rehab technicians
  • assess progress
  • implement prevention programs
  • advocate for rights of persons with disabilities

The healthcare system of this remarkable country is about to take a step into its promising future — with your help! 

We are a group of volunteer OT and PT faculty, a nurse, a public health analyst, a Haitian rehab technician, and a social worker.  We work  in partnership with Haitian rehabilitation clinics and UNEPH.  Our hands are full with planning for curriculum, clinical education sites, materials, and faculty. 
Right now, we need to stock the library!  We need $22,400 to buy a class set of textbooks in French for one year, for each class, and to buy a tablet for each student, which will be pre-loaded with curricular resources. 
We also need scholarship money for our first class of students and for salaries for our Haitian staff.  We are in the process of submitting formal grant applications for operating funds for the first two years, and for construction of additional classrooms to begin next fall.   Our full budget for the first year is posted on our website, at www.haitirehab.org.
We need your help!  And we have two new PERKS, staying with our theme of BOOKS!

  • All donors  will receive Gabby's recipe for Sōs Pwa: a delicious vegetarian supper entrée! 
  • For a gift of $40 we will send you a beautiful book of photographs, called Two Good Feet, by Marc-Yves Regis 1, a Haitian photojournalist.  See a picture of the book on the Gallery page! 
  • Donors who give $60 will have a textbook dedicated in their name.  
  • If you can give $100 or more, you will also receive a one-pound bag of marvelous rich Haitian coffee, from the Singing Rooster (even-more-than-fair-trade) Company.  
  • A unique gift for yourself or someone you love is available for a donation of $100!  Robert J. Shiller will autograph a copy of the new 3d edition of Irrational Exuberance - the book that brought psychological insights to economics! 
  • And if you can give us $15,000 toward our dream, you will be flown to Haiti as our VIP guest, to attend the opening ceremonies of the new rehab department, at the end of September 2015, in Léogâne!


Can't make a contribution now?  Please help by sending on our link, spreading the word and keeping the excitement going!


*UNEPH = Université Episcopale d'Haïti, or Episcopal University of Haiti
*FSIL = Faculté des Sciences Infirmière de Léogâne, or Nursing School in Léogâne
*FSRL - Faculté des Sciences Réhabilitation de Léogâne, or Rehabilitation School
story_txt:
Ever wonder what kind of charity a Nobel Prize-winning economist would support?  A capacity-building charity! Dr. Robert Shiller and Dr. Virginia Shiller will tell you why in our video clip.
NEWS FLASH!  Sunday, April 19, 2015!  The Shillers have just donated  $2000 in fulfillment of their offer of a matching grant!  This is a wonderful BOOST to our fund-raising effort!  Thank you to ALL our supporters for stepping up to the challenge!  (Please take a look at our new perks, especially for our many grateful Shiller fans!)
In Haiti, people with disabilities need rehab — and they need to receive their therapy from Haitian therapists!  A new Rehab Department is about to open  at the Episcopal University of Haiti  ( UNEPH*).  The new department is affiliated with their well-respected School of Nursing (FSIL*) .The nursing school started the first four-year degree in nursing, in just the same way, at UNEPH, ten years ago.  It now also has a master's degree program for Family Nurse Practioners!
We will offer 4-year degrees in Occupational Therapy (OT, or in French érgothérapie) and Physical Therapy (PT, or in French physiothérapie). For the first time Haiti will have its own team of rehab professionals: OTs and PTs who will be able to do it all:


evaluate patients
plan therapy
supervise rehab technicians
assess progress
implement prevention programs

advocate for rights of persons with disabilities


The healthcare system of this remarkable country is about to take a step into its promising future — with your help! 
We are a group of volunteer OT and PT faculty, a nurse, a public health analyst, a Haitian rehab technician, and a social worker.  We work  in partnership with Haitian rehabilitation clinics and UNEPH.  Our hands are full with planning for curriculum, clinical education sites, materials, and faculty.

If you can give $100 or more, you will also receive a one-pound bag of marvelous rich Haitian coffee, from the Singing Rooster (even-more-than-fair-trade) Company.  


A unique gift for yourself or someone you love is available for a donation of $100!  Robert J. Shiller will autograph a copy of the new 3d edition of Irrational Exuberance - the book that brought psychological insights to economics! 


And if you can give us $15,000 toward our dream, you will be flown to Haiti as our VIP guest, to attend the opening ceremonies of the new rehab department, at the end of September 2015, in Léogâne!

story:
Who We Are:

The Traverse Life Center is a non-profit organization dedicated to reducing poverty and family breakdown in our community. Our core values state that all people are designed and gifted to make a positive contribution in this world. The Traverse Life Center attacks the problem of poverty and family breakdown in unique ways.

Life Works Program Overview:

PROBLEM…

Our future leaders from ages 12-15 years old are old enough to stay at home unsupervised during the summer months, yet are too young for most entry level jobs. Much of their summer is spent at home wasting time, and not preparing for their future responsibilities and obligations as our next generation of leaders.


We also see in today’s workforce people who simply don’t have a good work ethic. Many are unable to get past entry level positions, and frequently bounce from job to job. In short, they lack the necessary foundation and tools needed to succeed and thrive in a career and thus become stricken in poverty.

SOLUTION…

Traverse Life Center decided to take these two problems and marry them together with a solution.  Our solution is an educational program called Life Works.  Life Works is designed to stop generational poverty before it gets started by educating young people with employable skills.  We offer young people ages twelve to fifteen an eight week training program in employment and life skills that will help equip them for their future.  The boy’s education program runs five days a week from 8:00-4:00 and the girl’s education program runs 3 days a week 8:30-4:00.


What they're taught:

  • They’re taught that each one of them have value and are wired with different gifts and talents that are meant to be used to generate income and make a difference in the world.

  • They’re taught how to be responsible.  They are required to set their own alarm clocks to get up in the morning.  Their parents are not allowed to do this for them.  If they’re going to be absent for the day they need to call their crew leader and explain why, not their parents.  Just like a real job.

  • They’re taught useful and employable skills such as: how to use tools, power equipment, cook, sew, how to communicate with others, how to set proper boundaries, how to handle finances, how to maintain and take care of things they own and use, how to respect authority, and that actions have consequences.

  • They’re taught that the world does not revolve around them but was made to be impacted by them.  They learn this by doing work projects for people in our community.  They have built a brick walkway for a fire department, worked with Team Elmer’s to plant flowers at the Women’s Resource house and installed a handicap accessible walkway at an adult care facility. They’ve also worked at Reining Liberty Ranch doing projects for the veterans around the ranch, they have stained decks, put up drywall, painted, chopped wood, bailed hay and many other projects for people.

  • They're taught that working hard has its rewards. Each day they have a time card and are paid “shekels” based on their performance. These factors include: timeliness, coming prepared, participating as expected during the workday, how they interact with their family at night, obedience, and helping out around the house. Parents are able to add or subtract shekels based on their daily home interaction. Every few weeks they’re able to spend those shekels on items in an auction. It might be a gift card, bike, football, fishing pole, camera or other item available. It requires them to figure out how much they need to save to get what they want, and it teaches them a very important life concept of delayed gratification.


Since the inception of the Life Works Education Program in 2013 we have had 43 young people participate and benefit from it.


Purpose and specific use of funds:

 The Traverse Life Center is seeking assistance in the purchase of student tools, shirts, boots, auction items, and instructional fees.


2015 Life Works Proposed Budget:

  • $9,556.10 Student tools, shirts, boots, auction items, instructional fees

  • $6,360.38 Program purchases; misc. tools, supplies, fuel, community project supplies

  • $32,000 Crew Leader expense

The actual cost per young man is $1,446.52 and per young lady is $1,100.00. However, we believe that every young person should have the opportunity to learn these very important skills, so we only charge $50.00 per student.  Life Works is a yearly education program that is sustained by grants, donations and fundraising.

Number of people served and benefited:  304+

  1. 36 students with an average family size of 4 = 144 people

  2. 9 crew leaders, 6 volunteers with an average family size of 4 =60 people

  3. Community work projects would be at least 100+ people benefiting, completed over 23 community work projects the last two years

  4. The young people’s school teachers, fellow students and their future employers, children and spouses

We look forward to seeing what's possible with this wonderful program thanks to ordinary people like you. Thank you!  :)

story:
The mission of XChange Ministries, a restoring and equipping center, is to minister to the specific needs of college students and generate spirit-led transformation on college campuses by simply loving, boldly preaching, practically teaching, and radically living the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

Since it conception in 2008, every spring semester XChange attends The Ramp, a transformational conference held in Hamilton, Alabama. Initially, “The Ramp Trip” consisted of 12 to 15 people; the Lord has blessed and expanded XChange Ministries from 12 to upwards of 100 members but with increasing cost.

God has been faithful in meeting the needs and costs of this trip. This year many students have desired to go on this life changing trip but financially many are unable to afford the cost.

XM (XChange Ministries) and other sponsors are working together to provide financially for students, but your contribution helps us in allowing more people to attend “The Ramp Trip”.

What is The Ramp?

The Ramp is a Christ-centered ministry that has “three primary purposes: awakening,equipping and send.”

Awakening calls people into their divine purpose, giving them permission to live radical lives through an undeniable encounter with the living God.

Equipping prepares and trains individuals with tools that enable them to advance the kingdom of God in their own areas of influence.

Sending propels these equipped believers into the world in order to awaken and equip others."

story:
Help kids navigate depression and anxiety

Today’s world has rapidly changed from when we were kids into a hugely different place. A hugely digital place. A hugely complicated place.

Outside feels more important than inside. It’s who you know, not what you know. It’s brands not brains. There’s more text less talk.

The path to positive health, communication, happiness and opportunity is mapped in a totally different way, and it’s easy to get lost.


Brainy Box: A tool to help navigate:

· Brainy Box is a progressive learning toolbox incorporating mentorship, purpose, connection and technology.

· Aiming to engage and support youth to navigate their way to greater social and emotional resilience.

· Helping them understand their own innovation, creativity and resiliency, which is critical to shaping their future success.

· Brainy Box is arranged around three themes: CREATE, FIT and MIND. Each theme includes a personal challenge, up to five interactive gifts, a personal guidance mentor, and access to a social media platform to keep in touch.

BRAINY BOX: CREATE 

Using creativity as an outlet and a channel for self-understanding. Includes activities in art, music and performance


BRAINY BOX: FIT  

Based around understanding physicality. Focussing on fitness, being part of a team, nutrition and body health.


BRAINY BOX: MIND

How to understand and build a healthy mind. With a focus on meditation, mindfulness, cognitive behavioral therapy, positive psychology and neuroscience.


BRAINY BOX TRIAL SCHEDULE:

Sept/Oct 2015 – Idiegogo crowd funding campaign

Nov (through to Feb) – Connect and confirm student participants, ethical approval application, detail user journey mapping, product delivery, construct survey, youth hub registrations, define theme challenges, employ facilitator and mentors.

Dec/Jan 2016 – Administration, budgets and logistics completed.

Feb – Move in to production office, present and meet with student participants and parents. Distribute Indiegogo perks.

March – Trial 50 x Mind:Box

April – Evaluation, analysis and interviews with students. Preparation for next trials of Mind:Box and Fit:Box

May – Trial 50 x Create:Box, 50 x Fit:Box.

June - Evaluation, analysis and interviews with students. Preparation for next trials.

July - Trial 50 x Mind:Box, 50 x Fit:Box, 50 x Create:Box.

August/Sept - Evaluation, analysis and interviews with students. Conclusion and strategy for product development and launch. Preparation of launch boxes.

October – Launch Brainy Box


What we need:

To deliver a trial of Brainy Boxes that provides measurable impact results with integrity we will need $16,000. This is made up of:

·  $3,000 – Box and Journal manufacturing

·  $5,000 – Box content and interactive gift procurement

·  $4,000 – Technology and design 

·  $4,000 – Administration, distribution and logistics

In the case that we do not reach our $16,000 goal we will downscale the trials to meet the budget. This will still allow us evidence that this product will make an impact.


The impact:

Epidemic: a rapid spread or increase in the occurrence of something

Disease: a condition that causes pain, distress, social problems or even death

Living with disease can alter ones perspective on life and ones personality, with heartbreaking results for the individual and their loved ones.


The epidemic:

·  Increasing mental illness

·  Low productivity

·  A lack of adulthood foundation skills affecting ability to ‘grow up’


The Brainy Box solution:

·  Helps to combat the depression and anxiety epidemic

·  Helps youth form solution based attitudes

·  Develops emotional skills, confidence and awareness

·  Creates resilient young adults with a positive perspective

·  Helps alleviate lonliness

·  Empowers youth

·  Inspires youth into action

·  Adresses teen mental health

·  Supports kids at a vulnerable age

·  Builds a community

·  Connects youth to mentors

·  Uses: CHOICE - Compassion Happiness Optimisim Insight Consciousness Emotion


Advice and guidance is from the following credited psychologist and professors, whose support and mentorship is much appreciated.

Dr Paul Jose – Associate Professor Psychology, Victoria University

Dr Aaron Jarden – President of The Positive Psychology Association of NZ, Senior Lecturer AUT, Lead investigator for International Wellbeing Study, Co-editor for International Jour al of Wellbeing, Senior scientist for Assessing Wellbeing in Education.

“Sometimes it takes a while to recognise that someone has a special ability to get us to believe in a better and different way of living, and to imagine that together we can do great things to impact the wellbeing of our youth, and thus the future of our society. With Brainy Box Tamara is that person who is reaching beyond current limitations of what we know is possible with our youth, and in doing so is utilising a range of contemporary, fun, engaging, and interactive materials.” - Dr Aaron Jarden

Anouk Kelling - MSc (Hons), PGDipClinPsych, BCA, BA, MNZCCP, Clinical Psychologist


The student's user journey:

·  Student registers for Brainy Box

·  Student fills out survey

·  Student requests or is assigned their Box Theme which best seems to identify with their needs

·  Box is delivered to student's school

·  Student receives box, opens it and interacts with gifts

·  Student logs into Youth Hub: creates profile and connects with their mentor

·  Mentor ‘onboards’ student to Youth Hub and sets their challenge

·  Days 1-30: Student is required to log in daily and submit their challenge results with either an image or word find from their set challenge.

·  At completion of each challenge the student receives a reward and climbs the Brainy Box leaderboard. Students can connect with the online social space and with other students in their box theme or in the wider Brainy Box community.

·  Day 31, the student fills out same original survey and results calculated

·  In the following week or soTamara Waugh interviews each student to find out what worked and what could be improved


Risks and challenges:

1.  Falling short of the funding amount requiring a downscale of the trial

2.  Any hiccups with logistics, distribution and production of boxes

3.  Youth not engaging with boxes

4.  Corporates and charities unable to facilitate mentoring

Solutions:

1.  Funding grants and corporate partnerships

2.  Allowing enough time for box production and organisation

3.  Focus groups with youth to define their interests and engagements

4.  Finding a ‘buy in’ for charities and corporates that will make this partnership irresistible!    

Other ways you can help:

Although this Indiegogo campaign is specifically about raising funds to launch the program, we understand it’s not always the right time to help. Alternatively word of mouth is really important to us to get the Brainy Box name out there.

PLEASE help us share our Indiegogo campaign by clicking HERE to do this now.
PLEASE share our Launchrock page so we can gather a community that supports what we do. Click HERE
PLEASE like and share our Facebook page: HERE

story:
Massanutten Military Academy

Massanutten Military Academy was established in 1899 and has continued to be a place that encourages students to become successful and contributing members of society as well as well-rounded individuals.  I may be a little partial being a former cadet, but Massanutten Military Academy has so many wonderful programs that students can take advantage of.  With continued support, we can continue to provide an excellent education for students.


  • #1 Military School in Virginia
  • 1 of only 9 Co-Educational Military High Schools in the United States and Canda
  • STEM: Project Lead the Way
  • Dual Enrollment
  • Possibility to obtain your Associate's Degree
  • 100% College Acceptance Rate
  • Admissions Guarantees with Susquehanna University and Norwich University  
  • All Cadets Play a Sport
  • 9th-12th Grade Cadets Take Leadership Classes

Where Is My Contribution Going?

Your contributions will be put into the Annual Fund.  Basically, what the Annual Fund does is provides us with the means to continue providing students with the tools they need to succeed.  To name just a few ways that the annual fund helps the school, it goes towards equipment for the classrooms, maintaining facilities, and providing transportation for the students to travel to sports games and even to transportation hubs.


The Biggest Challenge

In all honesty, our biggest challenge involving in raising money is that we are a boarding school.  People see that and they stop looking, but we are also a Non Profit!  Everything that we bring in goes back out to creating a better experience for our cadets.   


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word!
  • If you are interested in volunteering or donating equipment or services, please contact us.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello! My name is Maria Aponte-Gonzalez, founder of Latina 50 Plus. Latina Fifty-Plus™ pays tribute to Latinas over fifty years of age who were pioneers. They shaped their careers in a time when Latina women were venturing onto pathways where very few Latinas were seen or accepted. This program acknowledges the trailblazers who were among the first in their profession.  By creating this venue which expresses public appreciation for Latina women over fifty, they will have the opportunity to tell their personal narratives

What We Need & What You Get

 

In June 2014, Latina 50 Plus was launched and is in the process of building programming to support Latinas over 50 who want to pursue different career paths,  a degree or career development. The program will also focus on a mentoring program for younger Latinas who are looking for support for those with more life experience.  The response to Latina 50 Plus has been overwhelmingly positive with a strong support base from many Latina 50 plus professionals from a wide range of career paths. The heart of Latina 50 Plus is development of the scholarship funds for Latinas over 50 who are interested in moving forward in difference career paths or professional development.

Latina 50 Plus Give Back Scholarship Fund

The Latina 50 Plus Scholarship Fund is dedicated to Latinas over 50 who are interested in continuing their Education or changing career paths.  Help us support those who have supported others! 501(c) (3) status is pending

Become a part of something important and special as we celebrate the Legacy of Latina 50 Plus.  Be one of the first Founding Members that creates the Latina 50 Plus Scholarship Fund by donating.  Scholarships will be named after a Latina 50 Plus in each category listed in the program: Arts, Community Service, Health Care/Medicine, Literature and Law. The scholarships will be in the amount of $2500.00. Our goal for 2015 is to award the first two scholarships in Community Service and Education at the Latina 50 Plus Luncheon/Award Ceremony in June 2015.  How you can donate:

Founding Members

Donations can be made to in your area of interest in the amounts of $100.00 or $150.00.

In appreciation of your donations in what every monetary form you wish to make the perks included are your gifts. They include the Latina 50 Plus postcard with endorsements from Award Winning Authors, Julia Alvarez and Dahlma Llanos Figueroa!  The Latina 50 Plus coffee mug with note pad and pen, also if you wish to honor a Latina 50 Plus who helped shape your life we will graciously honor her in the Latina 50 Plus marketing promotions in all events

 

The Impact

 

By raising the monies for Latina 50 Plus we will be able to focus on creating the Mentoring Program, and offer professional development workshops for Latina 50 Plus. The focus will be on creating a space where women can gather to network, share life experiences and provide a platform to encourage positive outcomes from self-improvement and development. Since the June 2014 launch, Latina 50 Plus has hosted a networking event called, “Café Fuerte Mujeres Fuerte” where Latina’s over 50 met over brunch to discuss current issues that they are dealing with today as Elders. This event was in partnership with AARP Latino. March 2015, Latina 50 Plus hosted its’ first Networking Event at the Bronx Museum of the Arts.  The event included artist’s and business such as, New York Life, All State, The Bronx Women’s Resource Center, with a networking panel consisting of our 2014 Latina 50 Plus Honorees.  The panel discussion focused on career paths and working with our younger generations and how to work together. Latina 50 Plus is 501(c)(3) status is pending.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

In helping build Latina 50 Plus transparency is key, so therefore there you will be contacted via email on all fundraising sources and updates as to what programming is being funded and how. This information will be listed on the Latina 50 Plus website and will be emailed to all funders periodically. As the creator/founder of Latina 50 Plus in order to launch Latina 50 Plus, personal funding was used for the 2014 launch. Creating and managing a budget with limited funding was challenging, but when you believe in something you make it happen. But I also received support from our community who believed and continues to believe in the importance of honoring our elders and embracing our histories. So with support of our community and my personal investment Latina 50 Plus is now supported by over 200 people and their contacts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support Latina 50 Plus monetarily sharing the information with your contacts is just as important. So please feel free to share with your Social Media Networks. Email friends and if you know a Latina 50 Plus that you feel would benefit from the program then let them know.  Your support in anyway will be greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

The goal of this project is to launch an open data visualization platform that will be the source of interactive digital visualization content that will help bloggers, online new sites, social commentators, and traditional media outlets tell their stories in a more visual and engaging way. It is designed to encourage citizen engagement, help combat corruption and government wastes in Sub-Sahara Africa. The project is planned to commence in Nigeria, with possible replication in other countries.

Your contribution will help actualize more than 2-years of efforts unlocking public data in PDFs, copying and pasting, transforming these into computer-readable formats.

The platform (name is still confidential) is expected to be formally launched in early August 2015.


What We Need & What You Get

The funding needed is $50,000, which will help do the following:

If the target amount is not reached, the project will still go ahead using whatever amount is realized with the help of volunteers who will be willing to donate their time for access to some of our data. Having invested more than 2 years and about twice the amount requested into this project, there is high motivation  to see it to completion.


The Impact



Risks & Challenges

Slow release of data by public officials: there are laws to expedite the process

Poor internet access and connectivity: web access and subscription is on the increase in that part of the world

Data format are non-computer readable: we've successfully harvested most of our data from PDFs files

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help share the word and be positive with suggestions.
