Short Summary

Sky News:"Children are the unseen victims of Greece's debt: abandoned because of a crisis that began before many were even born"

Daily Mail:"Athens' Ark of the World youth center said four children, including a newborn baby, had been left on its doorstep in recent months."

Washington Post:"Either deserted at maternity wards days after their birth, bundled inside pillowcases, or packed in cardboard boxes dumped on the doorsteps of churches, clinics and charity centers, abandoned babies are turning up all over the country."
That is just a vague description of the big picture we are currently witnessing in Athens and the rest of the country.Whatever you imagine is not even close to reality.Just a short walk around Omonoia Square and Metaxourgeio is a proper slap in the face,a hard welcome to the cruel actuality.Street children (though the term 'street children' is problematic as it can be employed as a stigmatizing label) are among the most physically visible of all children, living and working on the roads and public squares of cities all over the country. Yet, paradoxically, they are also among the most 'invisible' and therefore hardest children to reach with vital services such as education and health-care, and the most difficult to protect.I could have  uploaded hundreds of photographs depicting kids sleeping under bridges or searching garbage bins for some food but what would be the point in that?The problem exists and gets gigantic proportions as days go by.The headlines and broadcasts of major international news channels serve as uncontradicted evidence of the obvious.
I have decided to set up a crowdfunding project exactly because i want to better the future of these children.I am quite realistic to know that i cannot change it,i cannot provide them with a decent family environment no matter how hard i want it.But every little help can make a big difference. I did not know about the crowdfunding platforms to be honest.Just very recently became familiar with this entire "new world" for me, and i believe that can really connect people of different ethnic groups,different religions and beliefs and improve our world.The economic recession has been causing an ever-increasing influx of social and economic problems and, consequently, an increase in the calls for assistance, to which the association felt the compelling need to respond to. Many people affected by the crisis have not been able to cover for their everyday needs, and child welfare organizations are experiencing dramatic budget cuts and reduced funding
I am not asking you to raise funds for the payment of the Greek debt.I do not believe that you must pay for all the corruption of Greek political scene,the tax evasion of payers and the financial mismanagement of Greek authorities. 
What i am asking you is to support our effort  for the children.In Greece there are many decades of non-profit voluntary Organizations and Institutions for Children (with special needs or not) and quite a few hundred of  Social Welfare organizations (more than 100 in Attica alone). Their main concern is defending children's rights, not just on paper but in practice as well, providing services to children on a 24-hour, 7 days a week, 365 days a year-basis, working for their physical, mental, and psychological stability. With zero financial liquidity and zero donations at the current moment are experiencing a financial deadlock, while requests for help and assistance are soaring from children and families with children.Every single Institution  receives, on a daily basis, tens of requests for help from children and families across the country. They are truly anxious about whether they will be able to continue standing by the thousands of children supported until now, but also the thousands in need from now on.The vast majority of these children are so-called “social orphans,” meaning one or both of their parents are still alive. In most of these cases, the government took the children away because of abuse or neglect. Others were simply given up by their families. Many children abandoned in Greece have disabilities or suffer from medical conditions caused by a lack of pre- and neo-natal care. Their parents tend to be poorer and less educated than the general population. Some are struggling with drug or alcohol addictions. Others still live with their parents or grandparents and have a hard time finding work. In many cases newborn abandonment is caused by the hard living conditions of their mothers. These vulnerable parents have little emotional support. They feel unprepared to take care of a baby and believe the state can offer their child a better life.Unfortunately,nowadays, that just isn’t the case. 
   What We Need & What You Get 
We are seeking to raise 300000$  in order to
support Children Institutions and ensure their supply with  vital necessities like heating
oil (on average an orphanage needs 8000 ltrs of heating oil per month), medicine and food.  Principle goal is to fund at least three (3) institutions working for children who are orphaned, abandoned or whose families are
unable to care for them, as possible. Mainly orphanages, children villages and shelter
Foundations will get benefit from your contributions. Due to the large amount
of NPO’s, Social Welfare organizations and Children Institutions acting in
Greece at the moment, the selection of the ones getting funded is very
difficult. Certain criteria should be taken into account and some serious
scrutinizing must occur. That is the most intractable part of the campaign in
my opinion. Having to manage and dispense other people’s money is a very
demanding and blameful role by itself. But when those funds are destined to
support abandoned children, then , automatically, you start to feel you have so
much on your plate that you’re left feeling overwhelmed and stressed out. That
thought is  utterly terrifying.
What I am planning to do is distribute the funds
proportionally to every single institution based on:
· 
the
number of children served every year, 
· 
its
amenities, 
· 
the
active years in the country, 
· 
a
clean background check 
· 
the
amount of sponsor and the volume of donations it has
After having completed the aforementioned check the
relative funds would be deposited ,in the form of donation, into each
Institutions bank account. Supply of heating oil, medical aid and food must be top priority. The contributors will remain informed and updated at all
times, until all the money gets dispensed.
FAQ's

Why do you offer perks since this is a charity campaign?
For 2 main
reasons: A)I strongly believe
that every act of philanthropy must get rewarded with a small token of
appreciation and B)All products are handmade and Greek, thus your contribution
has a dual significance and support.
In any case, should
you want to get involved but you don't want a perk, you can  simply add your contribution without
selecting one.
Do you have a company (or any connection to one) that produces any of
the offered perks?
Absolutely
not. Neither myself, nor any of my relatives have any affiliation to any of the
manufacturers/producers of the perks whatsoever. The selection of the perks was
made based on : the fast availability of the products in large volumes, and the
traditionality of them.
What is the main reason behind the organization of this charity campaign?
The main
reason? The support of abandoned children due to Greek crisis, like stated on
the title. There is no hidden meaning or catch. I am a Greek scientist, member
of the academic staff of Medical School of University of Athens for more than 9
years. The reason for pursuing a scientific orientation in the field of Human
Genetics was (and remains) the eradication of Genetic diseases and
abnormalities in children. I am doing the best I can in order to alleviate
children suffering, both in my professional career and my personal life.  Having to watch kids’ sleeping on the streets
of Athens (or anywhere in the world) , engaged in begging and salvage food from
garbage bins/eating the waste off dust bins it, really, exasperates and chagrins
me.The government does nothing,someone must act.
Why don’t you use Paypal?
Unfortunately
the latest economic crisis had detrimental effect on Paypal services as well. According
to PayPal, “We are carefully following the situation in Greece, as well as
developments in the negotiations between the Greek government and its lenders.”
“Due to the
recent decisions of the Greek authorities on capital controls, funding of
PayPal wallet from Greek bank accounts, as well as cross-border transactions,
funded by any cards or bank accounts are currently not available. We aim to
continue serving our valued customers in Greece in full, as we have for over a
decade,” the company said in a statement.
PayPal relies
on traditional banks and credit cards to transfer money, which demonstrates the
difficulty in dis-intermediating banks from the flow of money.
  Other Ways You Can Help 
SO, there you have it! I'd love for you to fund this campaign as much as you possibly can, that will really help! For those who can't contribute financially, please support by sharing this campaign to social media. All of this will help draw others to us!
Thank you so much for your time & contribution.

story:
The Accuracy Review of Wikipedias Foundation is dedicated to maintaining accurate, unbiased, easy to understand, free, and open Wikipedia articles.

Hi, my name is Stephen Haray. I have devoted my life to running and building medical centers throughout the United States and abroad including in the war zone of Baghdad, Iraq. In Hawaii, I was the Executive Director of an island hospice. Now that I've settled down to live the aloha life, I've decided to devote my skills to leading the Accuracy Review of Wikipedias Foundation, because together we can do more for humanity and future generations by improving upon the best methods of crowdsourcing to prevent inaccuracies, bias, difficult to read, and out-of-date passages in the reference material on which the whole world has come to depend.

I'm asking you to donate to hire professional fact checkers and proofreaders to create current, accurate and easy to read Wikipedia articles. By donating, you won't just help insure that Wikipedia content is higher quality for yourself, you will also be helping billions of your fellow human beings.

What we need and what you get

We're trying to raise enough money to hire as many checkers and proofreaders as possible. We could easily use several million dollars per year, but it will be easier to get grants from the the WikiEd Foundation and Wikimedia Foundation donors once we have proven our technology on a statistically significant number of paid task trials, and we think the minimum required to do that is $5,000. Even a fraction of that would go a long way to demonstrating our multi-level accuracy review technology.


We pay professional fact checkers and proofreaders, and accept the help of volunteers in the best traditions of crowdsourced encyclopedia improvements, along with sysadmins and Python programmers to improve the Mediawiki bots we use to find candidate passages in Wikipedia for review, improve automation of reviewer workflow, maintain servers with an auditable reviewer reputation database, and produce the necessary reports.

We are offering the following perks with the AROWF logo: 

stickers, t-shirts, hoodies, canvas tote bags, water bottles, a USB thumb drives, USB battery chargers, and wall posters of Steve Lewis's accuracy review process diagram shown above. If we raise at least $100,000, the first twenty donors of $2,500 or more will be invited to a party at Steve Haray's farm on Maui.

The impact

The importance of accuracy on Wikipedia can not be overstated. Everyone in all walks of life in the developed and developing world depend on Wikipedia for basic information, skills, news, and obtaining assistance. How many times have your questions been answered by Wikipedia?

The Wikimedia Foundation can't spend any of the millions of dollars they raise on opposing paid advocacy by improving articles without risking libel and defamation lawsuits, and less than a quarter of their budget is spent on "direct support to the communities." Former Wikimedia Foundation Director Sue Gardner warns that donating to the Wikimedia Foundation is not supporting Wikipedia article quality improvements, and may lead to corruption within Wikipedia Editor Chapters.

Moreover, Google uses Wikipedia to detect news events and measure their magnitude, and to improve the accuracy of its PageRank search results. Wouldn't you prefer to support those efforts directly, instead of having to wait for a Wikimedia grantmaking effectiveness review committee to recommend spinning off a new Foundation? You don't have to wait; please contribute generously today.

Risks and challenges

If we don't raise enough money, we won't be able to counter the threat to Wikipedia quality from paid advocates, vandals, and ordinary poor writing. We have already qualified hundreds of professional fact checkers and proofreaders who have proven they understand the rules and needs of Wikipedia. We have proven our plan with trial runs over months of painstaking software architecting and development.

Other ways you can help

  • Please help get the word out and alert your business contacts, friends, relatives, and anyone else who might take the opportunity to make a more direct improvement in Wikipedia quality content than has been previously possible through donations.
  • Please create an Indiegogo account today, and use Indiegogo's share tools to create your personalized custom referral URL if you want to participate in our referral contest, whereby we will reward you in proportion to both the number of referred donations and total amount raised from referred donations.

Not affiliated with the Wikimedia Foundation. Wikipedia is a trademark of the Wikimedia Foundation. Logo and video icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com.

story:
Herbal Gardens For Schools (#HG4S) is a project that educates children and youths about local herbs and their uses as well as empower them to create Herbal Clubs and establish Herbal Gardens in their schools as a means to help improve on their health, the environment as well as their general living standards

I remember using Aloe Vera to rub on the bruises I obtained during play. Today, it is rather unfortunate that a majority of children and youths barely even know the Aloe Vera plant, talk less of having planted and tendered for a medicinal plant.

World Health organization reports state that some 80% of the world’s population depends on traditional medicines for their primary health care needs, but while herbal plants are in demand, the tradition and culture associated with them is fading.  As such, if young people do not develop an appreciation for herbs and conserve them, then the knowledge and herbs that have developed over generations within various societies is at risk of becoming extinct.

It is for these reasons that the the goals of #HG4S are;

  • To encourage and promote 5 schools to introduce Herbal Clubs and Herbal Gardens as well as teach them how to grow, preserve and market herbs.
  • To inculcate a sense of familiarity from childhood with surrounding biodiversity and its conservation, especially herbal plants
  • Establish via a two day workshop, a Training Manual (Herbal Education Kit) on local Herbs and their uses for Herbal Education
  • To raise awareness on naturopathy and increase the value of herbal plants, and its intake in food as flavors or spices
  • To organize an inter-schools Herbal competition that shall focus on three major components; Herbal Poster with Recipe, Herbal Profiles and Herbal Gardens. The competition shall end with the award of prizes.

#HG4S targets schools because most schools especially in rural communities do not have Infirmirians, talk less of an Infirmary. Besides, the schools are mostly far away from district health centers and even lack first aid boxes. As such, students who have bruises, headaches or injuries always suffer for some time before getting to the health center or hospital unlike in a situation where if they knew about certain medicinal plants or naturopathy, they would have prevented or remedied their situation prior to getting to the hospital

#HG4S is important because, Governments and international development partners are increasingly interested in school gardens. These have traditionally been used for science education, agricultural training or generating school income. School herbal gardens have new multiple roles to play. The belief is that school gardens can become a seed ground for a nation’s health and security; this idea is increasingly backed up by experience and research (FAO, 2010)

#HG4S intends to work with 5 Schools; 3 Primary Schools and 2 Secondary Schools of the North West Region of Cameroon. Teachers from these schools as well as community members, Traditional Doctors, Traditional Rulers and Medical Doctors shall in a 2 day workshop brainstorm, consult and adopt key local plants (herbs) as well as their uses that shall feature in the Herbal Education Kit.

The Herbal Education Kit shall comprise of a Training Manual about some selected Herbs, their uses, value, packaging, etc. as well as an Activity guide of 36 Activities for the 36 Herbal Club Days of the 36 Weeks of the Academic Year in Cameroon. The kit shall also make provision of didactic materials such as papers, colors, glue, etc. which will be used in the Herbal profiles and Herbal Poster with recipe inter schools competition which shall be used for Herbal Education. The participating Schools shall then integrate Herbal Clubs as a new club in school extracurricular activities. These schools shall also provide a 10 sq. metres plots for the establishment of their Herbal Gardens by their Herbal Clubs. The Greens and partners shall provide herbal plant seeds and seedlings as well as the Herbal Education kit to the assigned club supervisors (teachers of the benefiting schools). The Greens shall also assign members of the organization to be in charge of monitoring and evaluation of the project. The establishment of the Herbal Clubs and Gardens shall mark the onset of an inter-schools competition that shall have three major components;

Herbal Poster with Recipe

Use of herbs is increasing in cookery practices and forms an important dietary supplement. In view of this, the participating schools will prepare a food recipe focusing on one particular herb and presented the end of the academic year. 

Herbal Profile

Schools will prepare the profiles of up to 20 herbs outlining their uses and values in written form on A4 page (one herb per page, both sides).

Herbal Garden

Schools will be encouraged to set up 10 sq. metres herbal gardens within their school complexes to be evaluated at the end of the academic year.

Sustainability

To give continuity and sustainability to the efforts started by the project, the schools’ herbal gardens, profiles and posters will be judged once every year and prizes awarded. Herbs from the School Gardens will be preserved, packaged and sold to community members on the day of the award of prizes so as to raise funds to create New Herbal Gardens for other schools.

Budget Notes

2 Day Workshop of 30 participants drawn from The Greens, Traditional Rulers, Traditional Doctors, Medical Doctors, Community members and Teachers for them to propose and adopt a Herbal Education Kit which shall be used for Herbal Education in Schools. The money will be used to purchase workshop materials like flip charts, books, folders, renting of projectors, etc. as well as provide feeding and transportation allowance for the 30 people who shall for two days deliberate and adopt an education kit. $150 will be spent on transportation of participants for two days, $300 will be spent for feeding for two days and $550 will be spent for workshop organization. ($1000)

Printing of 10 Herbal Education Kits for the 5 selected Schools. The other five copies will go to The Greens, Traditional Rulers’ representative, Traditional Doctors’ representative, Ministry of Secondary Education and the Ministry of Public Health. The Herbal Education Kit shall comprise of a Training Manual about some selected Herbs, their uses, value, packaging, etc as well as an Activity guide of 36 Activities for the 36 Herbal Club Days of the 36 Weeks of the Academic Year in Cameroon. The kit shall also make provision of didactic materials such as papers, colors, glue, etc which will be used in the Herbal profiles and Herbal Poster with recipe inter schools competition.  ($1000)

Purchase Herb Seeds and 500 Herb Seedlings. Each school will be provided with seeds to nurse as well as 100 Herb seedlings to plant in their Herbal Gardens. ($500)

Purchase prizes such as watering cans, digging tools (spades), sprinklers, Herbal Education books, etc to award to winners of the Inter schools Herbal competition. ($400)

Others: $100

story:
Short Summary

This is a project brought up in twin association of Leo Club of Chitwan Central, Leo District 325 B2, NEPAL  and Leo Club of Nawala Metro, Leo District 306, C2, SRI LANKA.

  Leo Club of Chitwan Central a short background:


Leo Club of Chitwan Central is a non profit organization and a volunteer organization formed by youths motivated towards social services with the theme "Lead For A Need". It was established under Lions Clubs International with registration number 125787 under District 325 B2, Nepal. It has already conducted various social projects like First Aid Donation, Stationery Donation, Health Works, Awarness Program, Cleanliness Campaign and many others.

Leo Club of Nawala Metro a short background:

Leo Club of Nawala Metro which is sponsored by the Lions Club of Nawala is one of the most outstanding Leo Clubs in Sri Lanka. The Leo club has conducted a large number of community service projects, giving a ray hope for the people in need. And due to tremendous service rendered by the Club, it became the most outstanding new Leo Club in 2013/2014 and most outstanding Leo club 2014/2015 in both Leo District 306C2 and Leo Multiple District 306, Sri Lanka.

We have sufficient volunteers youth who can wholeheartedly give their time to serve  society with motto "WE SERVE". But the problem is insufficient fund. Recently we donated First Aid Kits to  Girls Orphan Home in Devghat. We were too much touched by their dire situation and we wanted to do more for them. However, insufficient fund to serve them have become our major hindrance. That's why we have launched this fund raising campaign.

We know many people around the globe seek to help but do not find a suitable place to make it. If you are seeking to help then this is the perfect place where you may help. Every contribution you make will help to bring smiles on the faces of those kids at Girls Orphan Home. That's the ultimate blessing every human being can expect.

What We Need & What You Get

We want potential donor who can support our program:

  • We have aimed to collect $1000. Out of that we will use $250 for the fooding, $250 for Clothes to those kids while $250 to launch the regular health check up camps for them and $250 for stationery donation.
  • If some balance persists, we will utilize them for emergency fund to those little kids.
  • Thus we have aimed to provide fooding, clothing, health camps and education to these kids.


#FYI

1. Your $20 is enough to feed 18 children healthy balance diet for a meal.

2. Your $50 is enough to carry out monthly health check up of 3 Children.

3. Your $100 is enough to provide new clothes to 5 Children.

4. Your $150 is enough to provide curriculum books and stationery to 5 children.

Every penny of your help counts.

The greatest happiness that we feel serving others is the eternal satisfaction that can never be bought by money.

This project is really valuable because the girls home we are fund raising for is really in a poignant. We couldn't withstand just seeing them . We want to do something for them. Here we are ready to volunteer with every penny of the donations you make.

It is obvious that you might doubt on us but we have provided the details with our international registration number which is 125787. So you can trust us that we will make a full transparency and utilize the donation you make to the fullest. We will mail each donor with the receipts of expenses once we accomplish the project. We are Leo Club. Each and every actions of ours is checked by Lions Club International.


Other Ways You Can Help

There's always alternative to help. If you cannot help us simply by monetary donation you can share our link so other potential donor from around the globe may be interested to help us.


Thank you so much. Keep Serving. "LEAD FOR A NEED".
story_txt:
Short Summary This is a project brought up in twin association of Leo Club of Chitwan Central, Leo District 325 B2, NEPAL  and Leo Club of Nawala Metro, Leo District 306, C2, SRI LANKA.

  Leo Club of Chitwan Central a short background:
Leo Club of Chitwan Central is a non profit organization and a volunteer organization formed by youths motivated towards social services with the theme "Lead For A Need". It was established under Lions Clubs International with registration number 125787 under District 325 B2, Nepal. It has already conducted various social projects like First Aid Donation, Stationery Donation, Health Works, Awarness Program, Cleanliness Campaign and many others.

Leo Club of Nawala Metro a short background:
Leo Club of Nawala Metro which is sponsored by the Lions Club of Nawala is one of the most outstanding Leo Clubs in Sri Lanka. The Leo club has conducted a large number of community service projects, giving a ray hope for the people in need. And due to tremendous service rendered by the Club, it became the most outstanding new Leo Club in 2013/2014 and most outstanding Leo club 2014/2015 in both Leo District 306C2 and Leo Multiple District 306, Sri Lanka.
We have sufficient volunteers youth who can wholeheartedly give their time to serve  society with motto "WE SERVE". But the problem is insufficient fund. Recently we donated First Aid Kits to  Girls Orphan Home in Devghat. We were too much touched by their dire situation and we wanted to do more for them. However, insufficient fund to serve them have become our major hindrance. That's why we have launched this fund raising campaign.
We know many people around the globe seek to help but do not find a suitable place to make it. If you are seeking to help then this is the perfect place where you may help. Every contribution you make will help to bring smiles on the faces of those kids at Girls Orphan Home. That's the ultimate blessing every human being can expect.    What We Need & What You Get We want potential donor who can support our program:  We have aimed to collect $1000. Out of that we will use $250 for the fooding, $250 for Clothes to those kids while $250 to launch the regular health check up camps for them and $250 for stationery donation. If some balance persists, we will utilize them for emergency fund to those little kids.
Thus we have aimed to provide fooding, clothing, health camps and education to these kids.


#FYI
1. Your $20 is enough to feed 18 children healthy balance diet for a meal.
2. Your $50 is enough to carry out monthly health check up of 3 Children.
3. Your $100 is enough to provide new clothes to 5 Children.
4. Your $150 is enough to provide curriculum books and stationery to 5 children.
Every penny of your help counts.
 
The greatest happiness that we feel serving others is the eternal satisfaction that can never be bought by money.
 This project is really valuable because the girls home we are fund raising for is really in a poignant. We couldn't withstand just seeing them . We want to do something for them. Here we are ready to volunteer with every penny of the donations you make.
It is obvious that you might doubt on us but we have provided the details with our international registration number which is 125787. So you can trust us that we will make a full transparency and utilize the donation you make to the fullest. We will mail each donor with the receipts of expenses once we accomplish the project. We are Leo Club. Each and every actions of ours is checked by Lions Club International.   
    Other Ways You Can Help There's always alternative to help. If you cannot help us simply by monetary donation you can share our link so other potential donor from around the globe may be interested to help us. 

Thank you so much. Keep Serving. "LEAD FOR A NEED".

story:
Dear friends and athletes everywhere,

Welcome to our TRACK IN THE WOODS @ Harwood Union High School crowd funding page! Here's our vision and story.

OUR GOAL!

We are going to raise $400,000 to build a new, unique, environmentally friendly state-of-the-art 8 lane destination track and field complex – a TRACK IN THE WOODS - for Harwood Union High School in Vermont's Mad River Valley, the state of Vermont, and the Northeast as a whole. 

We are starting our project with this $40,000 IndieGogo campaign to show the world that we've got grassroots support for this exciting and unique idea. Join us as a donor!

WHY A NEW TRACK?

Here's the story. Harwood Union High School’s current track is decades-old, covered with grass, and in dramatic disrepair. (CHECK OUT OUR FUN VIDEO). This, despite the fact that 10-15% of the Harwood student body participate in track and field related sports throughout the school year, AND Harwood's boys and girls cross country and track teams have won a total of THIRTY FIVE Vermont state Division II championships during the past FORTY years. “The Harwood Track & Field program prides itself on being an all inclusive program, allowing varying abilities to participate, while still being one of the top Teams in Vermont Division II, with multiple Team State Championships as well as numerous individual State titles,” explains head coach Taggert Haslam. "We always ask  - how hard are you willing to work for your teammates’ success?"  

WHY NOW?

Given our incredible legacy at Harwood, we feel it is now time to build our high school, our towns, and our state a Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS that reflects the history, pride, and future prospects of our community – a track we can all celebrate and enjoy!

WHAT IS A "TRACK IN THE WOODS," EXACTLY?

 Picture this. We imagine our Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS complex as a unique athletic facility in the heart of central Vermont that matches our region’s character. We will design and build our TRACK IN THE WOODS in an environmentally-friendly way: selectively cutting trees, harvesting on-site wood and stone for on-site facilities, and tapping into the local wisdom of our foresters, designers, architects, construction engineers, coaches, and athletes to create a destination complex of which all of us can be proud, AND a site that attracts athletes from all over the state and region.

$40,000 - IS THAT ENOUGH MONEY TO FUND THIS INCREDIBLE IDEA?

Not quite. We have a two-phase plan to fund the Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS, based on an estimated  $320,000 cost for the 400 meter track itself. (WONKY MATH ALERT: 8 lanes of 400 meters each = 3200 meters; so $40,000 buys a single lane, and $100 buys one meter of each lane).

So...

Phase 1: We will raise $40,000 from the HUHS running community, alumni, friends, families and supporters to support a single lane through our INDIE GOGO crowd-funding campaign. (September through December 2015).  ($100 buys a meter; all $100 donors or more will have their names affixed on a plaque that will grace the Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS entrance.)

Phase 2: We will raise $280,000 through business sponsorships and foundation partnerships to complete Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS funding for the track itself – businesses and foundations can buy /fund lanes or share the cost of lanes, and will be honored on our site in some public way. (January 2015 through May 2015).

Exciting, right?

Please give generously, and share our story with your family, friends, colleagues, and loved ones through email, social media like Facebook, and best of all, word of mouth.

We hope you will join us in making this exciting vision a reality!

Sincerely,

Friends of the Harwood TRACK IN THE WOODS Outreach Group

Jared Cadwell, Fayston

Laura Caffry, Waitsfield

Taggert Haslam, Waterbury

John Kerrigan, Duxbury

Duane Pierson, Moretown

Rob Rosen, Warren

Liz Schlegel, Waterbury

Anneka Williams, Waitsfield

Rob Williams, Waitsfield

story:
Short Summary

Every summer, thousands of high school (and a few middle school) students from all across the United States and several countries across the globe converge on the campus of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln to celebrate, share and participate in fantastic theater. For decades, the International Thespian Society, a students organization  that focuses on service through and to educational theater, has held and grown this maxing event to become the "Broadway of High School Theater". Supported by the Educational Theater Ascociation, schools participate at many levels. Any school can bring a group and see dozens of shows, attend educational workshops, meet college reps and share their passion with other like minded students from all over the world. Students come with their own ideas, mounting shows within the week with the new friends they have met. Troupes can sign up for limited stage space to perform in play marathons that run all week. Some schools compete in their own states to earn a spot on the chapter select Showcase, where states and region show off their best work on stage in short cuttings or one acts.  And then, full length shows can apply to be one of a very few of the Main Stage performances that highlights the week.
This is where we are. We have very ambitiously applied with two shows, from two of our high schools, Bradford High School and Indian Trail High School and Academy. The shows have two completely different groups of students from all over the county to represent Kenosha on the Mainstage. 

What We Need

The cost per student for is trip is $850.00. That includes room and board for the week and transportation to and from the festival. This does not include the production costs, which we try to raise separately. We have 100 members of our company, cast and crew, from our two shows. That's it, that's what we're fundraising for; room, board and transportation for our students. We refuse to leave anyone behind.
Our first show:
Representing Indian Trail High School and Academy, Hello! My Baby, an original musical written and directed by Cheri Steinkelner. Cheri lives and works in California, but came to direct the festival entry after work shopping her production with us last year. The show includes memorable songs from the 19-teens and a gender bending plot that Shakespeare would be proud of. This show was adjudicated and accepted to the festival in November. 
Our second show:
Representing Bradford High School, Disney's The Little Mermaid. Our hope in picking the classic story that so many of our students grew up watching was actually to do a joint project with a performing school in China, where the story is well known and very popular. Sadly, due to the way the school calendars, the festival and our potential new friends exam schedules lined up, the joint project did not go through, but our very dedicated group did not want to put the project aside. This show will be adjudicated March 7th. We have decided not to wait to fund raise, but to plan ahead and work our butts off so we will all be at the festival together.
If we don't make our goal, we will spread the money out and lessen the cost on individual families. If we can take the bus per student cost off the top, then students will only be paying room and board.
The total bus cost will be 200.00 per student.  Room and board make the balance.

The Impact

I could write a book on why theater is an important part of education and what the value of the arts in society is, but I will spare you that and tell you what this festival does for our students.
On the very practical side, this allows them to be seen by colleges who come specifically to scout students for their programs. And the Mainstage is the best way to do it. They can also audition for scholarships even if they are not planning to go into the performing arts for a living. 
Less tangible, but even more important, they connect and communicate with people they will never forget and would never have met otherwise. Careers have started at this festival. Life long friendships have started at his festival. New found passions and untapped confidences have grown at this festival. 

Risks & Challenges

Being between two major metropolitan areas, we have a lot of students who are economically challenged. We are not arts schools, we are not private schools. Kenosha Unified is a public school district with a high number of families that fall into the free and reduced lunch programs. Raising money is a challenge for us. As adults, we are artists, dedicated to our students and our work, but not wise in the where's and how's of pulling in funds. We hope to start changing that and we hope you will help us to do it.
What we have going for us is this: KUSD Theater produces great art. Our great art is the result of the talent and dedication of our students. Every student deserves to be on the Mainstage. We will not leave one of these talented, hard working, deserving young artists behind because of money. As educators, as parents, and as a community, this is our goal.
Our parents are planning local fundraisers, we canvas and sing at local farmers markets and our students produce benefit shows to help raise money for the trip. We are reaching beyond the borders of our county to ask for your help to get us to the International Thespian Festival this year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help us in other ways. Join the KUSD Theater Arts FaceBook page. Become a part of our community, spread  the word about our fundraisers, come see our shows. We have alumni all over the country, working in and out of the arts. You know you're out there! Spread the word and help your successors have the same amazing experiences you did. We can make this happen together. Use the Share tools on the site, tell your friends, toss us a few bucks.

Get us there.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

It absolutely breaks my heart to see these children struggle through this disaster after knowing how difficult their daily lives are already.  One report mentions that there was more rain in 24 hours than they normally get in one month.  These 3 sisters  are part of a family of 7 children that live alone as both of their parents died of AIDS.  Their older brother and sister take care of them and now their house is destroyed.  There are many other children that go to The Jacaranda School that have been affected by this disaster.  Their amazing will to survive and get an education is an inspiration.  Please donate to help in providing emergency food, water and shelter and then REBUILDING OF HOMES FOR JACARANDA STUDENTS.

You can read stories at these links and really begin to understand what is happening and how amazing these children are.

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/comment/children-in-malawi-cant-afford-soap-let-alone-tweet-about-the-floods-that-are-destroying-their-lives-so-should-we-just-ignore-them-10025780.html

https://imusthavesaidyes.wordpress.com

http://jacarandaschoolfororphans.blogspot.com


What We Need

The number of homes destroyed is estimated to be 50, at this point, but that number will grow over the next few weeks.  The task is large, but not impossible

  • I have estimated that we will need approximately $100,000 to rebuild and repair houses.
  • There will also be a need for food, blankets,and extra medical supplies as cholera, malaria and other water born diseases are always a potential in situations like this.
  • http://www.nyasatimes.com/2015/01/15/cholera-outbreak-fears-over-malawi-floods/

The Impact

The Jacaranda School in Malawi offers free education to more than 400  children, orphaned by AIDS.  The children that attend this school have had many struggles in their lives and without the help of Jacaranda, these students would not be able to attend school.  Marie Da Silva, the founder and her husband Luc Deschamps, the director,have committed their lives to this project.

The students at Jacaranda have so much potential, but with the recent flooding they have come up against another setback that will challenge them, but it will not stop them from getting an education.  There are so many success stories at Jacaranda.  A few examples would be Kondwani who is in his 2nd year at The University of Malawi studying Agricultural Engineering.  John Samson, who won the Commonwealth Essay Contest in November 2012 and got to travel to London to accept his award from the Queen.  Alinafe who recently visited New York to attend the United Nations Assembly and afterwards did presentations at schools in the New England area. Joyce and Vanessa sang at Mary's Meals annual banquet last year in Scotland and Austria. This is just a sample of some of the 400 students that attend Jacaranda.  These children have amazing talents in so many areas and given the chance, they will shine. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please give what you can and take a second to share this campaign with your friends and family.  If you work at a school, maybe begin a project with your students.   Every little bit helps.  We can get the Jacaranda students into new homes with your help.  These kids are fighters; they have been fighting the odds since birth.  They will bounce back after this horrible disaster.   

Check this link for a report on CNN about the disaster in Malawi.

http://edition.cnn.com/2015/01/17/africa/malawi...

Or this one on BBC

 http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-30820220

story:
Saving Daniel Foundation is a new non-profit organization that is in need of some assistance to pursue it's mission. Our mission is to inspire hope and contribute to strengthening families of children with mental illness by providing support, education, and advocacy.  Without your help we cannot help the parent's of children that have a mental health illness.  

  • My name is Stephanie Escamilla, I'm a mental health advocate and a mother of a 16 year old with a mental health diagnosis.  
  • When my son was first diagnosed, I was a single mother.  I had very little support and no one sat down with me and explained to me the seriousness of what mental illness can do to my son or my family.  I didn't quite understand what stigma was till I told my family about his illness.  
  •  Your contribution will help me build my non-profit to  meet the mission of educating parents, creating support groups for both parents and their children with mental illness, get training to educate school professionals about children's mental health.
  • I am currently seeking $10,000 to start my organization.  This will get the ball rolling for training and support groups that are definitely needed for parents.  We need a place to start.
  • Your contribution will help educate, support, and give hope to a family on the brink.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution, please share our campaign.  Anything is appreciated.

story:
dzwiek.org

Jeśli lubisz tę stronę, możesz ją wesprzeć finansowo. Dzięki Twojemu wsparciu strona może stać się lepsza.

Na co zostaną przeznaczone pieniądze?

Różne ciekawe skrypty poszerzające funkcjonalność strony są płatne i na nie zostaną przeznaczone zebrane środki.

story:
Short Summary

As the publisher of The Paper Maché children's newspaper I see my background     experience and training as a perfect marriage for this work.  I studied journalism and was a reporter for a small town Prairie newspaper where I was editor of a children's column.  Later I obtained a degree in Education and  taught at several elementary schools.  It was no wonder the idea to have children's work published in a newspaper stayed with me since the mid 80's and is is now a real and exciting dream come true.

I think the motivating energy to keep pursuing the idea of children having an opportunity to see their work published came from my first hand experience as a reporter.  It was always thrilling to see my work in print after working hard on a story.  My research revealed that there was a lot of literature out there that was written for children by adults, including my column, but nothing exclusively dedicated to publishing children's writing  and artwork.  So why not a newspaper . . . and The Paper Maché was born!

Of course like every story there is the short version and the "how long do you have " version but for the purpose of this campaign let's say that there has been a lot of good fortune and many angels along the way.  This is our third year of publication and we have just published issue number 31 and issue 32 is ready to be laid out.  

From the very beginning the Paper Maché Publishing Society, a non profit organization with registered charitable status, was established to produce the paper.  My publishing role for the society, includes working with a designer to create the paper, visiting classrooms to talk with teachers and students about being involved, delivering the paper each month and fund raising. 

The Society prints 6,000 copies of the 16 page newspaper every month during the school year and they are delivered to all the elementary schools in the Victoria, British Columbia capital region.  Approximately 15,000 students have an opportunity to read the paper and readership increases considerably when the paper is shared at home with parents.  You can read our past issues here - http://papermpublishing.com/past_issues.htm

In the first couple of years of publishing advertising was the way to cover part of the cost of production.  However it's common knowledge in the newspaper industry that advertising revenue has dropped off considerably and most publications are struggling. This is certainly true for The Paper Maché.

And that is what brought this campaign about.  We need $7,000 for next year's  production.  This includes printing, administration, design, car/gas and contingencies.  This will cover the monthly expense of $700 for the 10 month school year 2015 - 2016. 

This is a remarkable and unique cause and the Paper Maché is a valuable venue for children's creativity. By publishing children's writing and art work we are supporting, developing  and growing  literacy that inspires and influences children's self-esteem.

In terms of real impact I believe the letter below says it all. This note came from a teacher whose classroom I had recently visited  to talk about students being involved and contributing to the paper.
                                                                *    *    *
"Thank you again for coming to speak to us at Happy Valley.  We enjoyed your insight and inspirational message.  One student in particular relished the opportunity to meet you in person.  He has contributed an ongoing story over the past few months and was absolutely thrilled to shake the hand of the person who chose to publish his writing.  This young man aspires to be a writer and the Paper Maché enabled him to see his first tangible snapshot of his long term goal.  In other words, his goal of becoming a writer is becoming real. 

This opportunity has also resulted in an improvement in confidence.   He is proud of his achievement and radiates a smile that lights up the room when he recognizes his writing in the newest edition.  This young man is on the autism spectrum and is diagnosed with Aspergers.  For him to smile and extrude confidence is thrilling for those who know him or work with him.  The impact of this opportunity will be greatest measured in 15 years when we can ask him what difference it made on his life, but until then, he will continue to write and smile."

                                                                 *    *    *

story:
Ambassador Christian Academy

Ambassador Christian Academy is a Kindergarten through Eighth Grade Christian School that has been in Toms River, New Jersey for 35 years.  

Our campaign is important to our students because they need tuition aid to be able to continue their education at our school.  We want all students to have the opportunity to attend our school and your donations will help them.      

You, the contributor, will help us in our cause of raising funds to teach a Classical Christian Education to students of families who choose this education.   90% of our alumnae have attended college and go into our world as successful leaders and entrepreneurs.   We teach all the core curriculum as well as Public Speaking, Debate, Logic, Latin, and Spanish.  We will teach the greats in history; Michelangelo, Norman Rockwell, and Andres Derain.  We listen and study the music of Leonard Bernstein, Chopin, and Bach. 

We teach about the greats in literature, history, science, and math.       

What We Need & What You Get

As a staff of 8 full time teachers, 6 part time teachers, and an office staff of 3, we need $65,000 to continue financial aid to students who are currently attending Ambassador Christian Academy.    

We are a non profit school and you may take a tax deduction with our EIN.

If we do not reach our entire goal, all funds will go to the Student Tuition Aid Fund and be used solely for tuition.     

The Impact

Our students will stay in this Classical learning environment, and continue on to their chosen college and into a world ready to be a life long learner, debater, artist, scientist, historian, and so much more.  
We make a difference by preparing students to be ready to contribute and make an immediate positive impact in their world.  

Risks & Challenges

As we pursue our campaign, we know there are risks and challenges.  We are Hosting a 35 Year Reunion Dinner to also raise funds for our students. During this campaign we will overcome challenges as we have before.  No obstacle is too great for our community.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and tell everyone you know about our fund raising  campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you know anyone who is supportive of a Classical Christian Education, let them in on our Fundraiser and Dinner.

story:
Welcome to Reality Comics: the world's first online community built for the comic book enthusiasts, by the comic book enthusiasts.   Reality Comics LLC was formed in 2012 for the sole purpose of creating an online community where indie creators, store owners, and comic book enthusiasts could meet, buy or sell comics, and cultivate new ideas.  To create this new community, we have incorporated three key pillars on which the platform will stand on: social networking, eCommerce, and community outreach.

The biggest challenges that face indie creators and store owners is getting their business noticed and their work out to readers

All the resources needed to be successful in the comic book community are spread out all over the internet, and learning how to use each one effectively can be quite difficult. You have to have a website, a ton of social media accounts, an eCommerce page to sell your work, and a host of bills just to keep those sites up. Why has there not been a social network that combines all the features of social media with the direct sale benefits of eCommerce yet?

Well, that is what we are here to accomplish!

We launched the alpha build of the community in October2014 at www.reality-comics.com to test our initial ideas, features, and code. Over the past 3 months, through constant feedback from our 100 plus alpha testers, we refined our approach and design. The initial plan for the platform was to help comic book store owners broaden their customer base, but we quickly learned that our platform could be the answer to an even bigger problem. With the right features, Reality Comics could make the world of comics easier not just for store owners, but for the indie creators trying to sell their books, and for the enthusiasts looking for a place where they are celebrated.

We also spent those 3 months creating a companion app to the platform for both Android and iOS. We recently launched the Android version to the Google Play Store and in the weeks to come, plan to submit the iOS version as well to the Apple App Store as well.

Download the android app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.slinfy.realitycomics&hl=en


We need your support and help in finishing this project. We have created the alpha build of the website at reality-comics.com and apps for iPhone and Android, but the features we want to introduce that will benefit the indie creators and store owners the most  require a lot of man power and financial resources, something we do not currently have.

By helping fund this project, we will be able to hire the rest of our programming team, buy more servers, and invest heavily in the architecture of the platform so that it is safe, easy to use and always online.


Buy and Sell comics: For the indie creators out there looking to get their comics into as many hands as possible, this is the place to be.  Your profile is your business. With a store front, you can sell your comics directly to other members without requiring people to go to another website. It is a great place for readers to discover and support indie comics.

Auction House: A place where members can post their comics up for auction. With only a 2.5% transaction fee, this is the cheapest auction system that is also safe and easy to use.

Reality X-Change: The best companion to all comic book collectors! Look up the current value of your comics, find out if it is gaining value or losing value, and get alerts on what new books you should buy that may be valuable over time.

Badges: take part in community challenges to earn badges and points from local comic book stores, and indie creators. The biggest game of achievement hunting now comes to the world of social networking in a whole new way!

Social Centric: listen to podcasts or upload your own, watch and share videos, participate in forum discussions, discover new stores, and make new friends in a fun, safe and supportive online community.





Custom Gift Box Reward Example (See Below)






If you want to partner up with us, and offer your comic book as a reward to our backers, email us at community@reality-comics.com and we will work out a partnership agreement.




Account levels:

Will the platform be free to use?

Yes. Everyone can create an account for free and use the platform free of charge. But there will be specific features that will require a subscription to use. This subscription fee will be used to cover any costs associated with the feature and its maintenance.

Can I use the alpha build right now?

Yes you can. Just head over to www.reality-comics.com, create an account and join our community of over 100 alpha testers.

How do I contact you if I have any questions about this campaign?

You can reach us by email at community@reality-comics.com

What if I live outside the U.S, can i still be a backer?

Yes you can. If you're outside the US or Canada, you have to add shipping on top of your selected reward before you check out. When you pledge, add the International shipping amount indicated in your perk as an "additional gift".

I love the campaign and project but i cannot contribute right now, how else can I help?

No worries. You are still a valued member of our community. If you can please share this campaign with your friends and family and on any social network you are on that would be awesome!  You can also sign up to use the alpha build of the site right now and provide us with valuable feedback. And finally, like our facebook page (Reality Comics), follow us on twitter (@realitycomics) and subscribe to our YouTube channel (Reality Comics).

Where can i find the android app?

Go to the Google Play Store, and search for "Reality Comics Companion" or click on this link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.slinfy.realitycomics&hl=en

Will it work on all Android phones?

The app supports all Android 2.2 and up devices.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Cluster Headaches What are they ?

Cluster Suicide Headaches are exceptionally severe headaches that occur for no known cause. Cluster Suicide Headaches are more rare than migraines, affecting only 69 out of every 100,000 people - less than 0.1 % (percent) of the population.

Cluster Headaches are excruciating, unilateral headaches of extreme intensity. The duration of the common attack ranges from as short as 15 minutes to three hours or more. The onset of an attack is rapid, and most often without the preliminary signs that are characteristic of a migraine

The pain of Cluster Headaches is markedly greater than in other headache conditions, including severe migraines; experts have suggested that it may be the most painful condition known to medical science. Dr. Peter Goadsby, Professor of Clinical Neurology at University College London, a leading researcher on the condition has commented:

“Cluster headache is probably the worst pain that humans experience.

The video above shows you what a Cluster Headache Sufferer has to endure during an attack. We want to thank Hilde for having the courage to post her video on        YouTube.

Who are we ?

  • Cluster Suicide Headache Inc is a Non Profit Foundation based in Canada. Our initial goal was to bring awareness through our educational programs, leading to better and earlier diagnosis, however we quickly realized the need for front line, hands on care and support, without prejudice or discrimination.
  • We are raising funds to purchase a property to create a respite & convalescent retreat; a place for Cluster Headache sufferers and their supporters, the unsung heroes, can come and receive the support and care they so desperately need.
  • Cluster Headaches are called 'suicide headaches because sufferers, who feel they have lost their quality of life, will often decide to end the pain. This is a debilitating, incurable disease.  By providing a safe, quiet environment that sufferers can go, to regroup and regain their strength we strive to never lose another to this disease.

What We Need

We need your support to open Redrok Meadows Respite & Convalescent Retreat. We plan to purchase an acreage with an established home and expand on it. Our intention is to establish Redrok Meadows in Tennessee. Cluster Suicide Headache Inc will become a registered 501(c)3 Non Profit Charity in the State of Tennessee prior to the opening of the facility.

  • We are looking to raise $1,000,000 to be able to purchase a property outright. If we exceed our goal additional funds will be used for the operational costs - providing employment for nursing and ancillary staff.
  • What if we don't reach your entire goal? All funds raised will be solely used for the opening of Redrok Meadows.  If we are unable to reach our goal with this campaign the funds will be held in trust until the remaining amount is raised through other fundraising campaigns. 

The Impact You Will Have By Donating

We will be able to provide crisis intervention and support; hands on nursing care; psychological support for both the sufferer and their family; a place of comfort in peaceful surroundings, free from any stigma or discrimination. Their is no such place in the world provided specifically for Cluster Headache sufferers and their families.

  • As a contributor to this campaign you are helping all Cluster Headache sufferers at the grassroots. While other campaigns use advocacy and work on developing research projects, no one is providing the grassroots care that sufferers need.
  • This is our goal. We need a place like Redrok Meadows - a home away from home with one simple goal: provide all the necessary care and support we can to help relieve some, if not all, of the suffering.
  • Cluster Headache sufferers commonly suffer from PTSD as well.  As such, suicide is often considered by sufferers to be a serious option.  Sufferers have frequently commented that it's "one way to put a stop to The Beast, and end the agonizing pain and torture" that they endure. This is why we desperately need to open Redrok Meadows Respite & Convalescent Retreat.

How you can join us and "Get Your Indiegogo on !"
  • Contribute today. Give graciously, generously and to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back".  Give a gift from the heart. Invest in today, tomorrow and the future.
  •  Spread the Word. Make some noise! Spread the word about our Indiegogo Crowd-funding Campaign. Check out Indiegogo's easy sharing tools.
  • Stay Connected Check back often!  As our campaign success unfolds we will keep you up to date. Connect with us through our Facebook page, and Website

Cluster Suicide Headache Inc "Time for Action"

On behalf of all people living with Cluster Headaches and their loved ones - we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Contribute today. Give graciously, generously and to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back".  Give a gift from the heart. Invest in today, tomorrow and the future.
 Spread the Word. Make some noise! Spread the word about our Indiegogo Crowd-funding Campaign. Check out Indiegogo's easy sharing tools.
 
Stay Connected Check back often!  As our campaign success unfolds we will keep you up to date. Connect with us through our Facebook page, and Website
   Cluster Suicide Headache Inc "Time for Action"On behalf of all people living with Cluster Headaches and their loved ones - we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
You Can Make a Difference

Many teenagers in Bulgaria, Europe and the world are unemployed and the number is rising dramatically!

Help us turn the tide by training teachers to train youth for jobs in local communities for the rising eco-tourism, hospitality and other local industries which vary by country.

We want to first contribute to a team of Bulgarian Teachers. They will train youth with the skills they need to qualify for meaningful, rewarding jobs locally.  Then we will transfer this program to other countries with a new group of local teachers!

With your contribution of any amount, you can help youth in many countries with this program!

With your contribution, you can help youth in many countries with this program!

Thank you in advance for your help for the youth of the world!

Our Vision:

With our training of Bulgarian teachers we are building jobs locally and rescuing disenfranchised youth from a life of poverty and desperation.

When we pilot this program in Bulgaria, we will immediately create jobs and improve local economies throughout the country.

Most importantly, because we have successfully replicated programs like these throughout our 35-year career, we will transfer this template to local economies anywhere in the world.  

Our vision is to create jobs through the efforts of local teachers and local students, and bring hope back to local economies worldwide!

Our Mission:

Our mission is to create jobs and positively change lives and communities worldwide.  

In the past 35 years, we have:

 Created 200 jobs for teachers who used our lessons to prepare over 740,000 inner city students for jobs in the construction, hospitality, and service sectors in Atlanta Georgia after graduation,

 Developed 55 teachers to prepare hundreds of high-school graduates to qualify for jobs in the Media Industry in Malaysia,

 Taught young adults to work in the oil industry in Qatar by learning enough technical English and Knowledge-economy skills to qualify for these jobs

 Developed youth in UAE to qualify for jobs in the booming Aerospace industry there.

 Created jobs for inner-city youth in Chicago, Illinois by developing their learning skills and encouraging their interest in many local service-sector industries to give them the confidence to stay in school and step into paying jobs after graduation.

These are just a few examples…we have dozens more!  

With your generous support, we hope to bring this program to hundreds of local economies worldwide, creating jobs and building bright futures for thousands of young people.

Your impact:

We believe that the future of the planet is in the hands of the world’s youth.

By giving them a chance to work, build dreams, have families, and have hope is essential for building peace and understanding between cultures worldwide.

Your contribution – of any amount – will help build their dreams.

Build your children’s’ future by supporting less fortunate children’s future.  When people have jobs to build dreams, they will build peace in their communities, and that will build peace for the world, one community at a time.

When people have jobs to build dreams, they will build peace in their communities, and that will build peace for the world, one community at a time.

story:
Who Are We?

The Society for the Study of Shamanism, Healing and Transformation is a non-profit educational society.  We are dedicated to supporting the ongoing dialogue and cultural exchange of indigenous wisdom and shamanic healers from around the world. We host an annual Shamanism Conference in San Rafael, CA and we publish ReVision, a journal highlighting healing practices and healers from various traditions. www.shamanismconference.org

What Is The Shamanism Conference?

We have hosted an annual conference on shamanism and healing for over 30 years. This gathering provides a forum in which a deeper dialogue may take place about the transformation of consciousness, and wholeness on a personal, communal and planetary level. It is an opportunity to educate the public about shamanism and to explore new ways of healing in the 21st century.

Every year we invite several indigenous shamans and healers to share their wisdom and practices at the conference. This supports their visionary work at home and abroad. Shamans hear about our conference from various sources and contact us about presenting. Some shamans are able to pay their own way, but many need funding for travel and expenses. 

What Are Our Fundraising Goals?

Our overall goal is to raise $15,000.

Your support helps us achieve three goals:

1) DONATE to the Elder Program: Fund the travel expenses and accommodations for shamans and healers. 

2) DONATE to the Youth Program: Support scholarships for young people to attend the conference to learn about earth-based spiritual traditions and healing practices that are so needed at this time. 

3) Ensure the ongoing work of our nonprofit.

What Do You Get for Your Donation?

We appreciate your contribution to support our work. Any amount counts! As a thank you, you will receive perks! 

All benefactors, sponsors, and supporters will be acknowledged in our conference program booklet, as well as ReVision. The larger the donation, the more perks you receive. Some additional perks include: one or more past ReVision issues, mp3 recordings or DVDs of past conferences, books published by the Society, conference passes, and an individual session with a shaman at the conference!

Why Do We Need the Support?

In 2013, our organization experienced a serious blow when all our funds were stolen. Despite efforts to pursue the matter through district attorney offices and other venues, the almost $20,000 lost remains unrecoverable. This theft has left the Society without a scholarship fund, funds for Indigenous shamans, conference down payments, and ongoing expenses.

The future of the Society and the conference will only be secure once we have basic funding in place.

Help Us Spread The Word!

We understand if you can't contribute financially, but spread the word through FB, Twitter, Instagram, email, etc.! 

THANK YOU!!!

story:
Short Summary

 Smart Kids Don’t Get High Foundation is about saving children lives. Our vision is to help millions of children Worldwide say “No” to marijuana and “Yes” to education.

Education is the key to our children’s future, but with the legalization of marijuana, our children’s future will be jeopardized by poor choices of the use of marijuana and it’s affect on their brains. 


What We Need & What You Get

We hope to give 55,000 books to kids and 10,000 color posters for classrooms. We need to raise a minimum of $50,000

All funds will go toward buying books for kids and providing posters to classroom.


The Impact

Billions of dollars are being spent to legalize marijuana and there has been very little money spent on marijuana awareness for our children about the harm it can cause. It appears that America has forgotten about our kids.

Marijuana continues to be the most commonly used illicit drug, according to Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration7.3 percent of Americans over 12 reported using pot last year. 

Smart Kids Don't Get High Foundation have assist children with books and lesson plans to teachers. 

A study from The Lancet Psychiatry, found that people who smoke marijuana, as teenagers are more likely than people who don't to drop out of high school, become dependent on cannabis.   We need to provide books and posters in communities and schools to educate our youth.


Other Ways You Can Help

In order to provide these resources, we are looking for funding. Here's how you can help!

$5.  Give one classroom a 18”x24” color poster

$10. Give a book to one child

$250. Give a book to a classroom of 25 students

$10,000. Give books to an entire school

Every $10 you donate will give a child an offer of literacy and the tools to say “NO” to marijuana. 

We need your contribution, your support and your help in spreading the awareness of drug prevention.

Help us fight the war on marijuana use!

The child you don’t help could easily be your own child. We need to come together and make a difference. Marijuana is the # 1 drug choice among underage teens in America. 

Social Media

Smart Kids Don’t Get High Foundation and John Watts, Founder, need your help in spreading the word about how America has forgotten about our children. We, as adults, have a responsibility to protect our children from the use of marijuana.  Share our website with friends, family members, co-workers and your social media friends.

story:
We have relaunched our campaign, check it out here!




As Seen On:

  • Read Article on: The Scientist
  • Read Article on: NRK
  • Read Article on: Scientific American
  • Read Article on: Fox News
  • Read Article on: ZME Science

First things first:

All backers have the option to remain 100% ANONYMOUS The campaign was launched internationally March 11th. We will extend and re-launch the campaign and continue as long as it takes :)

Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

Stand up for your human right to enjoy MDMA and Psychedelics!

The world might become a healthier and happier place if MDMA ('ecstasy') and psychedelics (such as psilocybin, found in 'magic mushrooms') were made more available. 

These substances often induce profound experiences while at the same time having a safety profile comparable to many commonly accepted activities.


Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs 

What do I get?

We will expand access to quality-controlled MDMA and psychedelics, and promote human rights and medical use. Backers have the opportunity to pledge for a MDMA box and a psilocybin box. In the future, we imagine that MDMA and psilocybin could be bought in smart shops. We have designed this perk, so you can hold the future  in your hand!



Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

Your contribution:

Will cover the estimated start-up cost and the first batch of MDMA and psilocybin for medicine, therapy and research, and will support EmmaSofia's work to legalize recreational use!

We have examined the start-up costs for MDMA and psilocybin in Norway, and made large margins so we are sure we can keep our promise. The start-up cost for MDMA and psilocybin is $300,000.

Our promise to you!

If we receive less than $300,000, we will continue our outreach efforts until we secure enough funding to deliver free MDMA and Psilocybin world-wide!

Why Indiegogo?

"I treated my alcohol issues and PTSD with MDMA and pscyhedelics, now I want to help others. You can read my story here" -Pål-Ørjan Johansen


Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

Founded by Scientists

Founders: Pål-Ørjan Johansen and Teri Krebs

Teri and Pål-Ørjan have had visiting research fellowships at Harvard Medical School. Pål-Ørjan received a Fulbright Fellowship from the US State Department to study at University of Washington. Their research on MDMA and psychedelics was funded by a grant from the Norwegian government.

Teri and Pål-Ørjan conducted the first meta-analysis of LSD as a treatment of alcoholism and the first large population study of mental health in people who have used psychedelics. 

Their research has been featured in Nature, BBC, Scientific American, and even The Onion, has gone viral on social media, and has contributed to the increasingly open global conversation about psychedelics. 

Teri and Pål-Ørjan have been working for years to promote medical research with psychedelics and human rights for psychedelic users. Here they are with their two adorable girls Katla and Nuna (photo from VG newspaper).


Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

The Science

Psychedelics have long been recognized as an ancient spiritual practice, protected under freedom of religion and belief. In surveys, most people who use psychedelics say that they do so to induce deeply personally meaningful mystical experiences.

In clinical studies, most participants say that the psychedelic experience was among the most significant and transformative events of their lives, comparable to the birth of their first child.

Research from the EmmaSofia founders is featured in Nature this week:

Watch Teri Krebs live on BBC World News

But can we do this?

Yes, yes we can!! MDMA and psilocybin can be used today in therapeutic settings. Procedures may vary between countries. All patents on MDMA and psilocybin expired decades ago, so for-profit companies have little interest in developing these medicines. 

HOWEVER, it is not necessary to wait years for marketing approval. Medications can be used after consultation with a physician and after making a request to your local medicines regulatory agency. In the US, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants over 99% of requests to use medications that do not have marketing approval!

EmmaSofia will distribute MDMA and psilocybin for free!

All the MDMA and psilocybin that we manufacture from the donations will be distributed for free — for medical or other legally authorized use. Distribution will be subject to legal conditions in manufacturer's and receiver's country and to manufacturer's ethical discretion. Receiver is responsible for obtaining necessary legal authorizations, fees, and shipping. See also legal statement. 

Help us make a difference

Your donation will also intensify our efforts to...

  • Contribute in scientific journals. For instance (5 Mar 2015): Psychedelics not linked to mental health problems or suicidal behavior: A population study (Full-text). 

  • Contribute in global media. Lots of media are covering our latest publication (5 Mar 2015). For instance: Legal ban on LSD and magic mushrooms 'against human rights', say scientists.

  • Prepare a formal request to the World Health Organization (WHO) to remove MDMA and psychedelics from the schedules of the UN 1971 Psychotropic Convention.

  • Participate in the 2016 UN General Assembly Special Session on drugs in NYC, in order to, in the words of the Global Commission on Drug Policy: "Ensure that the international conventions are interpreted and/or revised to accommodate robust experimentation with harm reduction, decriminalization, and legal regulatory policies."

  • Assist in human rights court cases involving MDMA and psychedelics.

  • Prepare for clinical trials in Norway. We will seek state funding for the trials themselves, but protocol development, project acquisition, and application processes are resource-demanding.

  • Develop an MDMA/psychedelic clinic in Oslo, which will welcome international clients. The clinic will treat posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), alcoholism, drug addictions, and other disorders.

    •


Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

Supporters

EmmaSofia's Legal Consultants

Ketil Lund is a former Justice of the Supreme Court of Norway and a member of the International Council of Jurists. Hans Fredrik Marthinussen is a law professor at the University of Bergen. Several other talented, experienced lawyers are also on the EmmaSofia legal team. 


Why | What | Our Campaign | The Scientists | The Science | Supporters | FAQs

FAQ

Q. When can EmmaSofia deliver MDMA and psilocybin?

A. Within months after we have secured the funding.

Q. Where is my money going?

A. Your contribution will cover the estimated start-up cost and the first batch of MDMA and psilocybin for medicine, therapy and research, and will support EmmaSofia's work to legalize recreational use. We will continue to campaign as long as it takes!

Q. Can you explain the stretch goals?

A. The more we raise, the more you get!

If we reach:

  • Stage 1: $300,000 — we will produce psilocybin :)
  • Stage 2: $600,000 — we will produce MDMA as well :D
  • Stage 3: $1,000,000 — we will intensify EmmaSofia's work towards legal access to MDMA and psychedelics for everyone!

Q. Do I need to sign up for PayPal to donate?

A. No! Any standard credit or debit card can be used through the PayPal gateway. Simply select the choice for people who do not have a PayPal account and enter your credit card information as you normally would.
