story:
About Westchester Secondary Charter School

When we asked our students and families to describe Westchester Secondary Charter School in three words or less, we kept hearing the same three phrases:

                                Rigorous.              Personal.           Community-Focused.

As an independently-authorized and accredited charter school, we are able to offer our families the best of two worlds: public education along with all the benefits of an independent school-- a truly college preparatory curriculum, a 13:1 student faculty ratio, and partnerships with organizations and corporations that take our classrooms out into the world around us. Our goal is to grow young people who are not only responsive to the world around them, but who have been seen, valued and educated in ways that allow them the confidence and character to serve their communities.

What We Need & What You Get

Creating an independent school experience for public school prices requires extraordinary commitment from our families and community partners. Part of our fundraising need for this year is for $20,000 through a direct giving campaign from our families and community partnerships.

What we offer at WSCS is extraordinary for a public school, and in order to maintain the quality of our program (music, choir, guitar, yoga, drama, AP classes, and more) and our low student teacher ratio, we must raise $20,000 through this campaign.

Challenges and Rewards

Raising money for a public school is hard. Even families who have disposable income struggle to wrap their wallets around donations to a non-profit educational organization.  We know that. We also know that our school educates, nurtures and challenges 300 teenagers every day. We're succeeding:

  • Last year, over 90% of our 10th grade students passed the CAHSEE (California High School Exit Exam). These numbers far out perform other high schools in Los Angeles.
  • Our drama program has yielded over 10 place winners in the regional Drama Teacher's Association of Southern California (DTASC) Festival for the past two years.
  • Two of our English students placed (in 2nd and 3rd place) in a national writing contest about their reflections on the movie Selma and our school-wide field field trip to see the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't send us $5 a month or $50, you can help. Forward our campaign to your friends, family members, local Rotarians and community activists.

  • If 200 people gave $100 each, we would reach our goal.
  • If 500 people gave $50 each, we would surpass it by $5,000.
  • Let's dream big!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About me

I am a Brazilian-Italian playwright, PhD. I am currently a visiting scholar at the Martin E. Segal Theatre Center, at the CUNY Graduate Center, in New York. This position is not funded and therefore I am seeking support through this campaign for the project I have developed: The Open Voice Project. 

My project

Over the next year, I will interview Master Playwrights from around the world. I will ask for their insights on how they transfer their craft to younger generations. I will capture and share their insights in two important ways: a teaching handbook and a comparative studies book. 

The teaching handbook will help aspiring playwrights and teachers who use creativity to empower students to find their voice. It will provide practical exercises and insights from the Master Playwrights. 

The comparative studies book is an international comparison of contemporary playwriting pedagogy, written for academics, teachers, and also aspiring playwrights. This is the first in-depth study of its kind. 

Why help

  1. Because you will be helping to keep arts education alive. 
  2. Because this project will make accessible some of the most advanced teaching techniques, including for those who cannot afford to attend expensive educational institutions. 
  3. Because American artists will have the opportunity to access a global perspective, and vice-versa.
  4. Because educating the next generations of artists, just like other fields, deserves attention.
  5. Because you will be making possible an important, one-of-a-kind study in a field that needs funding.

The Impact

The research and teaching materials produced by the Open Voice Project will benefit teachers, teaching artists, professors and aspiring playwrights pursuing self study. 

At Higher Education Institutions: There is no comparable study on this topic yet. This project will advance the understanding of important teaching techniques that will develop the next generation of playwrights.

For High School Teachers: The teaching handbook will provide materials for teachers who use creativity to help empower students to find their voice. 

For Aspiring Playwrights: The handbook materials will enable low cost self-study with new information that is normally restricted to Academia or expensive teaching institutions.

Who Benefits


What I Need & What you Get

My fundraising target is $25,000, which pays for my time to produce the books over a one-year period.

You can donate as much as you want, even $ 10 dollars help. 

Please, help me make this real! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

Make this real! 

If you want to know more about my artistic and academic work, visit: www.anacandidacarneiro.com

story:
Le MOOC Gestion de projet est le premier MOOC certifiant créé en France : plus de 80.000 inscriptions ont été enregistrées sur nos 6 éditions.


Notre objectif ? Donner à tous l’accès à une formation de qualité : Management des projets, démarches de gestion des risques, créativité, évaluation d’impact... douze thématiques sont disponibles.


En plus des deux sessions annuelles du MOOC, les formations restent en accès libre en permanence. Ainsi, les statistiques de nos vidéos montrent que sur les 365 derniers jours, plus de 122.000 heures de cours ont été suivies.


Nous voulons maintenant, grâce à votre aide continuer à développer le MOOC.


À quoi servira ma contribution ?

Elle sera gérée par "les Amis du MOOC GdP" notre association à but non lucratif administrée par les encadrants et créateurs du cours. Elle a  pour objet de "soutenir le développement de l’accès à la connaissance pour tous"


Si nous atteignons notre objectif de 3.000 €, voici ce que nous ferons :

  • traduire en anglais (ou d'autres langues) et enregistrer plus de cours que ceux qui existent actuellement
  • offrir des bourses d'examen : Permettre à des étudiants manquant de moyens financiers de passer gratuitement l'examen surveillé du MOOC
  • mettre en place un site web en anglais pour y partager les cours : projectmanagementcourse.pm sur le modèle du site actuel qui a été développé grâce aux dons des éditions précédentes.


 ... mais aussi d'autres actions, par exemple : enrichir les ressources du site actuel gestiondeprojet.pm, utiliser les données du MOOC GdP pour la recherche, améliorer les plateformes de MOOC existantes en développant de nouvelles fonctions.

story:
Breve reseña

RENOVA MAGAZINE está dedicada a difundir en temas de energía renovable y eficiencia energética, a las empresas involucradas en el sector tanto en productos como servicios a través de medio digital y en papel reciclado.
Las mejores noticias, las entrevistas a los protagonistas del sector, reportajes y análisis de lo que realmente sucede en este sector tan importante para la competitividad de la economía de toda la región Centroamericana.
Además, información útil para los usuarios: el precio de la luz, normativa actual y nueva que permita realizar proyectos a nivel Centroamérica.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Renova Magazine necesita $10,000.00 para sacar las ediciones en papel y digital a través de toda Centroamerica pero con papel reciclado lo cual incrementa los costos.  Ademas de tener un grupo de escritores y diseñadores que estén constantemente actualizando y renovando la forma de la revista.  Además queremos que nos midan la huella de carbono al momento de realizar nuestro proceso de producción de la revista y poder certificarnos.

El impacto

Queremos dar a conocer los temas de energía que nos impactan diaramente, además de hacer conciencia en las personas de lo importante que es cuidar nuestro medio ambiente a través de proyectos amigables con el medio ambiente.

Modificar el pensamiento de las personas por medio de educarlos concientemente en temas de energía.

Riesgos y desafíos

Tenemos riesgos de que la gente no crea en el propósito educativo de la revista, cuyo fin es educar al consumidor promedio de energía eléctrica de un país Centroamericano.  Ademas de encontrar proveedores de papel reciclado de buena calidad.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

A nosotros también nos pueden ayudar difundiendo el propósito de la revista y que las empresas se quieran pautar o poner anuncios de publicidad en ella.

story:
Dear friends and supporters,

my funding action has successfully finished now and I love to send you a

BIG BIG THANK YOU.

Read here how we succeeded and how you still can contribute!

Love

Manuela

********************


Until Christmas Manuela, founder of Vanilla Way, is collecting 7.430 Euros for a training at the Presencing Institute in the US. The training will be a big stepping stone towards the...

:::: Next Level of Vanilla Way ::::

Vanilla Way is an Agency for developing real life Win-Win-Win Projects by play and creativity.

Win-Win-Win = Win for the earth, Win for community, Win for you personally.

Vanilla Way serves projects that make a difference.
They come along in form of Communitiy Projects, Arts, Social Start-Ups, Healing, Cultural Hubs and Creative Activism.

Vanilla Way 2.0 is about to be born:

  • Our team of facilitators and process-designers will grow.
  • Our Seminar, Festival, Training and Retreat Formats will be deepened.
  • The new Vanilla field of impact will be THE GAME , a product with the power for transforming societal mainstream.    

(Vision of Vanilla Way 2.0 - created on my betabook, weaving dreams together)

Contribute to the evolution of Vanilla Way as an Agency for Process-Design, Faclitation, Win-Win-Win Culture Training and Transformation-Game-Developer.

Be prepared for the Vanilla Menue 2016 that is widely represented in the perks.

Find DETAILLED LIST OF PERKS HERE

Find the VANILLA CALENDAR 2016/2017 HERE

(The Vanilla Menue 2016, drawing created @ The Nest –community event)

THANK YOU VERY MUCH

Manuela Bosch, Founder of Vanilla Way


___ READ THE FULL STORY:

FACILITATING PROJECTS SUPPORTING SOCIETAL CHANGE

As a Berlin based change maker I love to support teams and individuals in building community and help realizing projects like eco-villages, social start-ups, cultural hubs, healing centers and all that is in line with values for a sustainable society.

Since 5 years I have been doing this full-time and self employed under the label Vanilla Way - Agency for Integrative Communication and Processes. It’s a highly rewarding work.  Though the reward mainly comes in personal contentment, financing my life remains challenging. Saving something extra for big expenses has not been possible at the moment.


"Social Presencing Theater gives a creative and awareness based framework to supports teams in situations where they feel stuck, expecially with problems that can not be simply solved by thinking and talking."


SOCIAL PRESENCING THEATER AS SOCIAL TECHNOLOGY FOR TRANSFORMATION

For me, Social Presencing Theater (SPT) is a social technology and art form that has a high potential to serve societal, organisational and personal change. In 2013 I got in touch with Theory U and in 2014 I got first time in contact with SPT through Daniel Ludevig and later Arawana Hayashi from Presencing Institute, who co-founded SPT.
Since, I have been applying it in my work with groups as good as possible.
I perceive it as a tremendously powerful and truly innovative tool for action research, especially in high complex stuck situations related to systemic dynamics. It helps in a gentle yet powerful way, building resilient teams and re-connecting to ones higher self. But, I am kind of self-trained in applying it so far. To take my ability working with SPT to a next level, It's time for me to attend the advanced SPT training.


WHAT I HOPE TO PERSONALLY ACHIEVE THROUGH MY PARTICIPATION IN THE YEAR-LONG ADVANCED SPT TRAINING.

Despite having successfully integrated SPT in my work so far, I feel I am just at the beginning of what is actually possible.
For accessing the highes future possibility I hear calling me, I must integrate SPT deeper into my work and being and also spread it into my communities. Therefore I would like to attend the year-long advanced training program, that takes place in New York State (for three intensive week-long blocks) and Berlin (local integration all year long), starting in June 2016 ending May 2017.
The training will support me to grow personally and to bring my work of contributing to societal change to a next level.



WHAT I HOPE TO ACHIEVE THROUGH MY PARTICIPATION IN THE YEAR-LONG ADVANCED SPT TRAINING IN TERMS OF GLOBAL IMPACT FOR CHANGE

Besides my personal learning, that will contribute to the local SPT community and the projects I am working with, I see huge possibility on another level: CONNECTING TO THE GLOBAL FILED OF CHANGE MAKERS through visiting the US and sharing deep experiences with international participants of the training program, connecting with the Presencing Institute and visiting projects and communities in America before or after the training blocks. I can not even really imagine yet the impact of this, though I know for sure, that the actual potential of my training is lying in my passion to connect and collaborate for supporting and doing projects for societal change.


WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT IN FUNDING MY YEAR-LONG TRAINING

The idea of asking you, my family, friends, fans, communities and network to support is not only connected to the lack of funds at my end. For that it might be even more easy to take a loan or wait another year or two.
I feel if this project shall now come true, then because it is wanted from a whole crowd.
I do not want to deep dive into Social Presencing Theater only for my personal and professional learning. For that crowdfunding wouldn't be fitting.
The idea behind this campaign is to TEST and find out, if the training and I AM really "worth" it! Is it worth using the resources of time, money, the environmental impact of my flight and so forth for bringing SPT to Berlin, integrating it further into my work as facilitator, process-designer, change maker and global networker? I don't know. Though I have committed myself to finding it out and for that, I want to give all I can.
Now the power to make this come true is also up to you, to let it fail, is lying in your hands too. I am open to listen to your feedback. And whatever I receive, I will take it with gratitude.
THANK YOU VERY MUCH

______________________Funds called for:

SPT ADVANCED YEAR LONG TRAINING
€ 4,200
__Tuition and fees, housing and meals.
Read more info about the program.
__note: I have also applied for a scholarship. The average amount possible is about 1.000 USD per scholar. Unfortunately, the chance for acceptance with my profile is low, beacause it prioritizes empowering people from the global south.

TRANSPORTATION  & CO2 COMPENSATION
€ 1,750
__three times transportation to Rosendale, New York State.
The program consists of three training sessions: June 8-12, 2016; Nov 30- Dec 4, 2016; and May 3-7, 2017. High expenses are therefore three round-trip economy flights Berlin-NY and local transport to Rosedale:.
€ 230
__Contribution to Atmosfair for CO2 compensation.

SPT PRACTICE DAYS IN BERLIN
€ 900
__Part of the year-long training is integrating and practicing what we learn in our locally. One way is by gathering as a community of practitioners in Berlin, where I will share my training by facilitating practice days about once a month.
__Costs occur for renting the Dojo Workshop, Art and Bodyspace (where we met also for doing the film for this campaign). This adds up to 100 Euro x 9 days of practice days, starting from July 2016.
Dates are:
Sa 16. Juli 2016      
Sa 13. Aug. 2016      
Fr 16. Sep. 2016      
Sa 15. Okt. 2016      
Fr 18. Nov. 2016      
Sa 14. Jan. 2017      
Sa 11. März 2017      
Fr 21. Apr. 2017      
Sa 10. Juni 2017      
Participation will be free of charge and only limited to space. If you are interested in becoming part of the practice-group and meet 9 times once a month for one day, simply write to manuela@vanillaway.net for more info and sign up.

INDIE GOGO FEE –  MONEY TRANSFER ALTERNATIVES
€ 300
__If I am able to raise all the funds through this platform, I will have to cover a fee of 5% of the funded fees.
__If you want not or can not use creadit card or a paypal, feel free to get in contact with me.

_________
Total Budget  = €  7.430

I will communicate here transparently what amount I have received through other channels like bank transfer and cash.
If I do not reach the funding sum, I will look for other possibilities for bridging the missing amount. If this is not possible, I will communicate transparently what will happen with the funds and you will have the possiblity, to recieve your contribution back.

Thank you very much for your trust and support.

Yours’
Manuela


Special thanks for supporting me so far goes to:

Lilli Breininger
www.lillibreininger.de
(Video- & Foto-Art)

Ron Hofman
www.dasinstrument.de
(Sounddesign)

Marie Espe
www.lalalution.com
(Jam Launch Event)

Clara Espe
www.lalalution.com
(Hosting Launch Event)

Oliver O. Rednitz
www.litekultur.net
(street art postcard design)

Dojo – Workshop, Art & Bodyspace
(Venue Berlin, Neukölln)

Arawana Hayashi and Daniel Ludevig,
the Presencing Institute
and the worldwide SPT Community.
www.presencing.com
(Teaching, Method, Wisdom & Generousity)
story_txt:
Dear friends and supporters,my funding action has successfully finished now and I love to send you a BIG BIG THANK YOU.Read here how we succeeded and how you still can contribute!LoveManuela********************Until Christmas Manuela, founder of Vanilla Way, is collecting 7.430 Euros for a training at the Presencing Institute in the US. The training will be a big stepping stone towards the...:::: Next Level of Vanilla Way ::::Vanilla Way is an Agency for developing real life Win-Win-Win Projects by play and creativity.Win-Win-Win = Win for the earth, Win for community, Win for you personally. Vanilla Way serves projects that make a difference. They come along in form of Communitiy Projects, Arts, Social Start-Ups, Healing, Cultural Hubs and Creative Activism.Vanilla Way 2.0 is about to be born:
Our team of facilitators and process-designers will grow.
Our Seminar, Festival, Training and Retreat Formats will be deepened.
The new Vanilla field of impact will be THE GAME , a product with the power for transforming societal mainstream.     

(Vision of Vanilla Way 2.0 - created on my betabook, weaving dreams together)Contribute
 to the evolution of Vanilla Way as an Agency for Process-Design, 
Faclitation, Win-Win-Win Culture Training and 
Transformation-Game-Developer.Be prepared for the Vanilla Menue 2016 that is widely represented in the perks. Find DETAILLED LIST OF PERKS HEREFind the VANILLA CALENDAR 2016/2017 HERE(The Vanilla Menue 2016, drawing created @ The Nest –community event)THANK YOU VERY MUCHManuela Bosch, Founder of Vanilla Way___ READ THE FULL STORY:FACILITATING PROJECTS SUPPORTING SOCIETAL CHANGEAs a Berlin based change maker I love to support teams and individuals in building community and help realizing projects like eco-villages, social start-ups, cultural hubs, healing centers and all that is in line with values for a sustainable society. Since 5 years I have been doing this full-time and self employed under the label Vanilla Way - Agency for Integrative Communication and Processes. It’s a highly rewarding work.  Though the reward mainly comes in personal contentment, financing my life remains challenging. Saving something extra for big expenses has not been possible at the moment."Social Presencing Theater gives a creative and awareness based framework to supports teams in situations where they feel stuck, expecially with problems 
that can not be simply solved by thinking and talking."SOCIAL PRESENCING THEATER AS SOCIAL TECHNOLOGY FOR TRANSFORMATIONFor me, Social Presencing Theater (SPT) is a social technology and art form that has a high potential to serve societal, organisational and personal change. In 2013 I got in touch with Theory U and in 2014 I got first time in contact with SPT through Daniel Ludevig and later Arawana Hayashi from Presencing Institute, who co-founded SPT.Since, I have been applying it in my work with groups as good as possible.I perceive it as a tremendously powerful and truly innovative tool for action research, especially in high complex stuck situations related to systemic dynamics. It helps in a gentle yet powerful way, building resilient teams and re-connecting to ones higher self. But, I am kind of self-trained in applying it so far. To take my ability working with SPT to a next level, It's time for me to attend the advanced SPT training.WHAT I HOPE TO PERSONALLY ACHIEVE THROUGH MY PARTICIPATION IN THE YEAR-LONG ADVANCED SPT TRAINING. Despite having successfully integrated SPT in my work so far, I feel I am just at the beginning of what is actually possible.For accessing the highes future possibility I hear calling me, I must integrate SPT deeper into my work and being and also spread it into my communities. Therefore I would like to attend the year-long advanced training program, that takes place in New York State (for three intensive week-long blocks) and Berlin (local integration all year long), starting in June 2016 ending May 2017.The training will support me to grow personally and to bring my work of contributing to societal change to a next level.WHAT I HOPE TO ACHIEVE THROUGH MY PARTICIPATION IN THE YEAR-LONG ADVANCED SPT TRAINING IN TERMS OF GLOBAL IMPACT FOR CHANGEBesides my personal learning, that will contribute to the local SPT community and the projects I am working with, I see huge possibility on another level: CONNECTING TO THE GLOBAL FILED OF CHANGE MAKERS through visiting the US and sharing deep experiences with international participants of the training program, connecting with the Presencing Institute and visiting projects and communities in America before or after the training blocks. For that crowdfunding wouldn't be fitting.The idea behind this campaign is to TEST and find out, if the training and I AM really "worth" it! Is it worth using the resources of time, money, the environmental impact of my flight and so forth for bringing SPT to Berlin, integrating it further into my work as facilitator, process-designer, change maker and global networker? I don't know. Though I have committed myself to finding it out and for that, I want to give all I can.Now the power to make this come true is also up to you, to let it fail, is lying in your hands too. I am open to listen to your feedback. And whatever I receive, I will take it with gratitude. story:
Who We Are: Yachay Wasi Family

The Yachay Wasi, translated from Quechua, means ¨house of knowledge¨. We are a small kindergarten located in the Sacred Valley of Peru, in the small Andean town of Ollantaytambo. Starting out as a cornfield, with the love and determination of over 150 volunteers, we have transformed into an environment for 29 children to learn and grow. 

We are a flowering project of a seed planted by Guillermina Sanchez and Jose Manuel, who wanted to help the children of the Sacred Valley--a place where education is not a priority. Jose and Guillermina have committed themselves so entirely to this project, that they now live in the school with their own two children. With this type of commitment comes a lot of sacrifices, and a need for the love and support of others. 

Our Mission

Search ¨Ollantaytambo¨ in any search engine, and you will be flooded with images of the Incan ruins scattered throughout our town. What cannot be expressed by these photos, is the rural beauty and charm that the town itself holds. With its cobblestone streets, buildings older than you can imagine, and rich culture experienced through food and interaction with the locals, it´s as if you have stepped back in time. 

The way of life here has maintained a lot of its simplistic and traditional aspects. With this, comes certain mindsets that have remained the same over the years. Most notably is the thought that violence within homes is normal. Violence between a husband and wife, or parents and children, is not viewed here the way it is in other parts of the world. There is a huge lack of education on this topic, and without that, this is a problem that will be continued to be perpetuated through the coming years. 

Here at the Yachay Wasi, we acknowledge that violence is not a solution to any problem that may be faced. With this ideal, we strive to educate the children on the importance of problem solving. As a non-traditional school, we find creative ways for the children to interact with their teachers and classmates, while learning valuable life skills. We express learning and growth through love, empowerment, and respect for others and nature. Therefore, establishing a peaceful foundation for these children to build their lives. 



Why We're Fundraising

We are determined to provide another year of growth and education for the beautiful children of Ollantaytambo. Our goal is to grow as a school as well, adding another classroom for 2 year olds and being able to accept more children in need of a place to grow and learn. As a non-government organization our funds depend upon the love and understanding of the importance of education to keep this project going.



How Your Donation Will Help 

Your donation will allow the Yachay Wasi to continue to be a place for growth and development for children of the sacred valley. 

Donations will go to maintaining the school as a whole, as well as helping us to expand.

-Our Staff: The teachers here are the core of this project. We currently have two classrooms with a teacher and a teacher's assistant in each room. They not only create an intimite, comfortable environment for the children, but also prepare lunch, clean the dishes, create the lesson plans, and organize activities, while still empowering all 29 children with the freedom of love. 

-Supplies for the Children: With certain tools and supplies we can continue to allow the children to explore their creativity. Having a variety of supplies allows us to create activities to develop their fine motor skills and a strong understanding of problem solving.

-Maintenance: One of the fundamental aspects of keeping this community afloat is being able to keep the electricity on, the telephone and internet running, and paying the rent. 

-Expansion: One of our goals for the future is to create another classroom that will provide more children of Ollantaytambo the opportunity to learn and grow with us. There is a high demand from parents in the community who need a place for their children to go while they work. Right now, we are able to support the education of 29 students, but are hoping to raise this number to 45 over the next year. In order to make this happen we need to expand our staff and materials. Being a non-government organization we depend on people such as yourself who deem education a necessity in life. 



Please help us to continue to grow this environment for learning and development. Any little bit you can contribute to our cause will help us provide another year of quality education through peace and love at the Yachay Wasi.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About us

World Repair is an organization dedicated to creating and promoting positive change in the world.

This winter we're thinking about the less fortunate who will struggle with cold temperatures, hygiene concerns and lack of food.

With this in mind, we've decided to create care packages that we can deliver to them as gifts. 

The Emotional Challenges Of Living On The Streets

Unfortunately, unlike most folks these individuals living on the streets don't get to find peace and comfort on these cold winter days by sharing it with their loved ones.

Too often these fellow human beings are faced with disgruntle looks and rejection on a daily basis. We believe this kind of behavior is counter productive on many levels and adds on to the negative feelings of despair and being neglected. 

The campaign "Handout A Smile" was created to help work against this, by not only giving them things that they may need but also adding ordinary items they could appreciate; all while shaking their hands and sharing a smile.

The Build Up Process

Through our efforts, we hope to accumulate $2500 to create several care package gifts that can be brought directly to people in need of a helping hand.

With this campaign, we want You to be as involved as possible with the process of giving and sharing.

With each level of donnation you can hand pick what you would like to be included and help build the care packages. 


$5 - Magic Gloves 

       

One size fits all unisex gloves to keep warm on those chilly nights. 

$10- Warm Winter Tuque + The Gloves

                                                     

With each extra dollar you can afford to donate the more we can include in the care packages! At $10 we'll be able to add a tuque to the care package.

$25- Personalize Your Donnation!  Include An Inspiring Note. 

Write a little something special. Your favorite inspiration quote or just a short personal message of hope. Along with the gloves and tuque we'll be able to add a warm scarf and also print out your personalized message to deliver with the care packages.

Please note that if you wish to include a personalized note with this contribution you can do so by sending us a message directly on Indiegogo or by email at promote@worldrepairvisions.com


$50- The Full Package 

  +  

  

+ 

 

                               

Complete winter care package including a warm scarf,tuque,gloves,basic hygiene products your message of hope and we'll also get them giftcard for a hot meal. 

$100- Get One Of Our Exclusive Brand T-Shirts 


Along with the good deed of having put together a care package of your choice to have delivered to the less fortunate. We want to send you one of our brand's exclusive T-Shirts to thank you for all of your generoisity!


Donation Usage

All donations received go directly into building the actual care packages to help the less fortunate living in the streets.The more we can accumulate the more we can give!

We are grateful for any amount you can give and any help you can provide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some other ways to get involved.
  • Spread the word by "liking & sharing" our efforts from our Facebook page.
  • Bring attention to our campaign by using #HandoutASmile in related posts
  • Visit our World Repair website for future campaigns.
  • Get in touch with us and share your innovative ideas for a better world!

This holiday season, get involved and help us Handout Smiles :)

story:
(Versioni shqiptar do e keni poshte)


Dear Friends of Music,

one  of  the  main  aims  of opening our  Tirana Music School is  to support  Tirana´s Faculty of Music.

As a support for the  new  Departament of Jazz & Improvization  we  are starting  to organize  guesting  of  an  excellent  German  musician  Andreas Buchmann  as   the Professor  of   Improvisation   and  Jazz  for  the   academic  year  2015-16.

A  lot  of  students  would  like  to  become  good  drummers,  but  they  will  have  no chance  unless  there  are  funds  to  buy  instruments  and  other  equipment for the Faculty.  One  of  the  best  Czech  musicians  Kladius  Kryspin  is ready  to assist the establishing of the Department of  Drums & Percussion.

We  approached  a  big  music  shop in  Europe - German  company  Thomann.  They made  us  a  special offer  for our  crowdfunding  campaign. Cost of the instruments, their  transport  and  custom  duty   (with  a  deduction  of   VAT)  will   be  more than 20 000 USD. You can see the invoice here:

http://musicschool.al/index.php?p=Activities-EN

The   graduates  of   the  University  of  Arts  in  Tirana  are  high-level   professionals, but  we  are  asking   you to  support   other  talented   Albanian  students  in  helping them  increase  the  level of  the  Faculty of  Music to  become  one  from the  best  in Europe.  Step by step, we hope to see its horizon soon  


Yours, 

                    Team of Tirana Music School

                     www.musicschool.al                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 


Instrumentet Muzikore per Fakultetin e Muzikes ne Tirane

Mbledhje fondevesh per instrumente muzikore te cilet ndihmojne per hapjen e Departamentit te Baterise dhe Perkusionit


Te dashur miq,

te muzikes nje nga qellimet kryesore te  hapjes per  Shkollen e Muzikes Tirana eshte te  suportoje  Fakultetin  e  Muzikes  se  Tiranes.

Si  nje  suport  per  Departamentin e  Ri  te  Xhazit  dhe te  Improvizimit ne jemi duke filluar  organizimin   e   pritjes   te   nje   muzikanti    te   shkelqyer   gjerman   Andreas Buchmann  si  Profesor  Improvizimi  dhe  Xhazi  per  vitin  akademik  2015-16.

Shume  student  do  te  donin  te  beheshin  batersit  te  mire por ato nuk do te kishin asnje  mundesi nese nuk  ka  fonde per te blere instrumente dhe pajisje  te  tjera  per fakultetin.

Nje   nga   muzikantet  me   te  mire  cek   Klaudius  Kryspin  eshte  i  gatshem  per  te ndihmuar  per  hapjen  e  Departamentit  te  Baterise  dhe  Perkusionit.

Ne  iu afruam nje dyqani te madh muzike ne  Europe, kompania gjermane Thomann. Ato  na  bene ne nje  oferte  specile per  cmimin e  instrumenteve, transportin  e tyre dhe  dogana  do  te  ishin  me  shume  se  20 000 dollare, ju  mund te shikoni cmimin e  fatures  ne  kete  adrese  http://musicschool.al/?p=Activities-AL

Te  diplomuarit e  Universitetit  te  Arteve  ne  Tirane  jane  profesioniste  te  nivelit te larte,  por  ne  jemi  duke  kerkuar  qe  te  mbeshtesim  student  te  tjere  te  talentuar shqiptare  per  te  ndimuar ato te rrisin nivelin e Fakultetit te Muzikes qe te behet nje nga  me te miret ne Europe. Hap pas hapi ne shpresojme te shohim horizontin e tyre se shpejti  :)

I yti!

          Kolektivi i Shkolla e Muzikes Tirana

            www.musicschool.al   


20 dollare

Bilet per koncert

Per  cdo  dhurim  20 dollare  ne do ju  japim  ju ose per cilin ju te deshironi 1 bilet per koncert  ne  Sallen  e  madhe  te   Universitetit  ne  vitin  2015-16. Ju mund te ftoni te aferm tuajin, femije nga jetimorja, ose dike nga azili…



50 dollare

Bileta dhe leksion te lire

Per  cdo  dhurim  50 dollare  ne do ju japim ju ose per cilin ju te deshironi 2 bileta per koncert  ne   Sallen  e  madhe  te  Universitetit  ne  vitin  2015-16.  Ju mund te ftoni te aferm  tuajin,  femije  nga  jetimorja, ose dike  nga azili… Gjithashtu do  keni mundesi te  degjoni  ju ose ke deshironi  te merrni  te afermt te degjojne ore te lira mesimi tek Shkolla e Muzikes Tirana.



100 dollare

Biletat dhe leksione te lire

Per cdo dhurim 100 dollare ne do ju japim ju ose per cilin ju te deshironi 5 biletat per koncert  ne  Sallen  e madhe  te  Universitetit  ne  vitin  2015-16.  Ju  mund  te ftoni te aferm tuajin,  femije  nga  jetimorja, ose dike nga azili… Gjithashtu  do  keni  mundesi te degjoni  ju ose ke deshironi  te merrni  te afermt   2 ore te lira mesim tek Shkolla e Muzikes Tirana.



500 dollare

Biletat, leksione, solo

Per cdo dhurim 500 dollare ne do ju  japim ju  ose per cilin  ju  te deshironi 25 biletat per  koncert  ne  Sallen  e  madhe  te  Universitetit  ne vitin 2015-16. Ju mund te ftoni te aferm tuajin, femije nga jetimorja, ose dike nga azili… Gjithashtu do  keni mundesi te  degjoni  ju ose ke deshironi te merrni  te afermt  5 ore  te  lira  mesim tek   Shkolla  e  Muzikes  Tirana.   Dhe  do  luaj  solo  ne koncertet qe do zhvillohet me muzikantet tane.


1 000 dollare

Biletat, leksione, koncert

Per  cdo  dhurim   1 000  dollare  ne  do  ju  organizojme  koncert  special  per  ju  ose firmen tuaj.  Ne do ju  japim  ju  ose  per cilin  ju  te deshironi  50  biletat  per  koncert ne  Sallen  e  madhe  te  Universitetit  ne  vitin  2015-16.  Ju  mund  te  ftoni  te  aferm tuajin,  femije  nga  jetimorja,  ose  dike nga  azili …  Gjithashtu  do  kemi  mundesi  te degjoni  ju  ose  ke  deshironi  te  merrni  5  ore  te  lira mesim  tek  Shkolla e Muzikes Tirana. 


2 000 dollare

Biletat, leksione, koncert, kanto

Per  cdo  dhurim   2 000 dollare  ne  do  ju  organizojme  koncert  special  per  ju  ose firmen  tuaj  dhe  kolektivi  Shkolles  e Muzikes Tirana do kompozoj kenge vetem per ju.  Ne  do  ju   japim   ju  ose  per  cilin  ju  te  deshironi  100   biletat   per  koncert   ne Sallen  e  madhe  te  Universitetit  ne vitin  2015-16.  Ju mund te ftoni te aferm tuajin, femije nga jetimorja, ose dike nga azili … Gjithashtu do kemi  mundesi  te  degjoni  ju ose  ke  deshironi te  merrni 5  ore  te  lira mesim  tek  Shkolla e Muzikes Tirana. 



Raiffeisen Bank Albania, Rr.Kavajes, Nr.44, Tirana

SHOQATA NDIHMO NJE NJERI

Barrikadave, Ish Kinema 17 Nendori, Tirane, Albania

IBAN:  AL32 2021 1051 0000 0000 0105 0231 (LEK)

              AL17 2021 1051 0000 0000 1105 0231 (EUR)

BIC/SWIFT:  SGSBALTX

story:
Who we are:

Staten Island MakerSpace is a non-profit community based organization dedicated to building economic growth and supporting small manufacturing in our community. Our education programs open new doors to learning, creative problem solving, and invention through the sciences, new technology, and vocational skills for all ages. We believe it is critical that the children in our community are exposed to careers in science, engineering, and new technology because they are pathways out of poverty. Hands-on experimentation and creative problem solving helps students succeed in all areas of their lives. 



What exactly is the STEAM Wagon?

The STEAM Wagon is a mobile STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts, and math) education and innovation lab that brings hands-on programs in science, technology, engineering, arts and math to your school or event!

The STEAM Wagon offers students and teachers access to fabrication equipment including a 3-D printer, computers, a laser cutter, soldering and microcontroller stations, alongside hands-on sewing and woodworking stations. Our programs can be adapted for children K-12 and all developmental abilities. The STEAM Wagon is handicapped accessible.  

Why we need your help:

 The funding you help us raise will go to supporting us in bringing the STEAM Wagon to schools that are unable to afford it.  We are strongly dedicated to teaching and instructing students in topics and projects they might not otherwise be able to learn.  Our hope is to be able to bring the STEAM Wagon to as many schools as possible to demonstrate and provide, creative, educational, and hands-on learning experiences.

Of course every little bit helps, but we are also looking for people who can help sponsor longer events, such as having schools participate in our Make A Difference Challenge. 

The Make A Difference Challenge is an education program for middle and high school students that encourages social responsibility through real world manufacturing innovation.  Modeled after engineering events called "hackathons," in which individuals collaborate intensively on projects with the goal of prototyping a product from start to finish in a short period of time, students use our manufacturing equipment, and expert staff guidance to research, develop, design, and build innovative solutions to global problems.

At Staten Island Makerspace, we believe in building our local and global community. With your help, we move closer to that goal. Your sponsorship will help ensure that the children we inspire today will become tomorrow's leaders.

Please share our STEAM Wagon campaign with others so we can continue to grow and educate!

Thank you!

story:
My Story

  • My name is Mr. Lou Louis Koboji, South Sudanese, Managing Director of Kajo-Keji Health Training Institute and graduate of BioMedical Laboratory Technology from Makerere University. I was born 33 years ago and at the age of 5 years I realized that I was a refugee in Northern Uganda. I got all my education from Uganda and even worked for the government of Uganda for 5 years.
  • I still  remember well the evening of 22/09/2012, I witness Kiden die in rural Terekeka County South Sudan, when she was delivering. Later I learned that Kiden is one of the many women in South Sudan who die while giving birth to live. Again in upper Nile Deng, 3 year old boy died of Malaria when it is preventable.
  • Later I learned that Kiden is one of the many women in South Sudan who die daily while giving birth to live. South Sudan has the highest  maternal mortality in the world with 2054 per 100,000 die.
  • South Sudan also has the highest under 5 infant mortality within the region. 135 in 1000 children in South Sudan do not celebrate their fifth birth day.
  • South Sudan  has the least number of trained clinical officer, Midwifes Lab Technicians and Nurses. It will take a rural South Sudanese 5 years to see a qualified health worker.
  • Most of the causes of mortality are preventable if there were enough doctors/clinical officers and I said to my self I need to come back come after 28 years and contribute to the new nation. In 2013 I resigned my job in Uganda and ON 21/9/2013 we established Kajo-Keji Health Training Institute to train more health workers. We have 128 students, 23 staff and 7 Board Members.

What We Need & What You Get

WE NEED 50,000 USD. 

50,000 USD BLOCK OF CLASSROOM & LAB 

The first target is Block of classroom and lab, second is learning aids, medical equipment and text books.

The Impact

60 More students will be admitted

Two new courses introduced, nursing and midwifery 

64,000 pupils reached with hygiene and sanitation Health education

27,000 students reached with reproductive health education, STD`s

3% mother and children reached with treatment in hospital in our practicum annually and graduate 45 students in 2016 

Risks & Challenges

Two big risk in South Sudan
Geopolitical situation in South Sudan though peace is sign but still it is not conducive 
Inflation is high

  • Hard working, dedicated and experienced team

  • Our cost is low as compared to competitors

  • Location of Kajo-Keji Health Training is in the safe part of South Sudan

  • Early in- service clinical exposure

  • High Quality clinical instructors and tutors

  • SOLUTION

  • Students are selected in all the 10 states of South Sudan with Ministry of Health selection Committee 

  • Graduates go back to the villages and treat the people in private and public sector.

  • It is a sustainable model

My name is Mr. Lou Louis Koboji, South Sudanese, Managing Director of Kajo-Keji Health Training Institute and graduate of BioMedical Laboratory Technology from Makerere University. I was born 33 years ago and at the age of 5 years I realized that I was a refugee in Northern Uganda. I got all my education from Uganda and even worked for the government of Uganda for 5 years.
I still  remember well the evening of 22/09/2012, I witness Kiden die in rural Terekeka County South Sudan, when she was delivering. Later I learned that Kiden is one of the many women in South Sudan who die while giving birth to live. Again in upper Nile Deng, 3 year old boy died of Malaria when it is preventable.
Later I learned that Kiden is one of the many women in South Sudan who die daily while giving birth to live. South Sudan has the highest  maternal mortality in the world with 2054 per 100,000 die.
South Sudan also has the highest under 5 infant mortality within the region. 135 in 1000 children in South Sudan do not celebrate their fifth birth day.
South Sudan  has the least number of trained clinical officer, Midwifes Lab Technicians and Nurses. It will take a rural South Sudanese 5 years to see a qualified health worker.
Most of the causes of mortality are preventable if there were enough doctors/clinical officers and I said to my self I need to come back come after 28 years and contribute to the new nation. In 2013 I resigned my job in Uganda and ON 21/9/2013 we established Kajo-Keji Health Training Institute to train more health workers. We have 128 students, 23 staff and 7 Board Members.
   What We Need & What You Get WE NEED 50,000 USD. 
50,000 USD BLOCK OF CLASSROOM & LAB 
The first target is Block of classroom and lab, second is learning aids, medical equipment and text books.   The Impact 60 More students will be admitted
Two new courses introduced, nursing and midwifery 
64,000 pupils reached with hygiene and sanitation Health education
27,000 students reached with reproductive health education, STD`s
3% mother and children reached with treatment in hospital in our practicum annually and graduate 45 students in 2016 
    Risks & Challenges
Two big risk in South Sudan
Geopolitical situation in South Sudan though peace is sign but still it is not conducive 
Inflation is high  Hard working, dedicated and experienced team
Our cost is low as compared to competitors
Location of Kajo-Keji Health Training is in the safe part of South Sudan
Early
in- service clinical exposure
High
Quality clinical instructors and tutors
SOLUTION
Students are selected in all the 10 states of South Sudan with Ministry of Health selection Committee 
Graduates go back to the villages and treat the people in private and public sector.
It is a sustainable model

story:
Our Story:

Community School of Excellence, a Hmong charter school in Saint Paul, MN, is home to a predominantly low income student population, with many being refugees from Southeast Asia.

It is also the home of a group of kids intent on making a difference! The CSE Asian Penguins (our school's computer club) works to close the Digital Divide by recycling used computers for the needy. In the last three years, the Asian Penguins have:

  • Learned to use, install, and configure software. 

  • Recycled computers that were given away to needy families, providing computers for dozens of households in the Twin Cities metro area.
  • Sent laptop computers to our sister school in Thailand, helping to close that school's Digital Divide.

Now, it's time for a new project!

Operation Upgrade!:

We need $4,500 to replace some of the aging laptops in our middle school. Our middle school has laptop carts for teachers to use in their classes and those laptops are showing their age, with many broken and all worn and underpowered.

This project will give the students of Mr. Keroff and Mrs. Yang (the teachers that will share this cart) a cart with 30 laptop computers with i5 processors, 4 gigabytes of RAM, all running Ubuntu Linux (the operating system of the Asian Penguins).

Cost Effectiveness and Learning at the Same Time:

By using recycled computers, we can greatly lower our cost per unit for buying the machines. By using Linux and open source software, we can get these computers up and running without having to buy software. The Asian Penguins will install the software themselves and will run the necessary upgrades. This way, the kids will learn, serve others, and keep costs down.

If we are unable to reach our full goal, whatever funding we do receive will go towards the purchase of as many of these computers as possible.

If by chance we are fortunate to EXCEED our goal, extra donations will go to replace additional laptops on another cart.

The Impact:

By making a donation, you are empowering the Asian Penguins to help others right at their own school. You will also be greatly improving the technology experience of our middle school students, enabling them to get their schoolwork done and gain 21st Century knowledge and skills.

Why we need YOU:

Our school, like most charter schools, struggles with resources. The Asian Penguins have seen the need. In fact, they have experienced it themselves, as they use the old laptops when they are in class. The Asian Penguins are genuine go-getters, but they do rely on the generosity of others to make things possible.

Other ways to help:

Even if you can't personally contribute to our campaign, you can help get the word out over Facebook, Twitter, and other social media networks to help make as many people as possible aware of this project.

On behalf of the CSE Asian Penguins, thank You for visiting and considering donating to our campaign.

For more information about the CSE Asian Penguins, please visit these links:

Asian Penguins Home Page

Asian Penguins You Tube channel

story:
A Foot Soldier for Peace

Pastor Frederick Ogara is a man of God located in Bungoma, Kenya. He works tirelessly throughout the nation to bring peace and reconciliation to a nation that has been torn by tribal violence. Pastor Frederick’s work is supported by the Kenyan government and a network of 70+ churches, his work is severely limited because he does not have vehicle. Traveling throughout the rough terrain requires a reliable 4-wheel drive vehicle or expensive taxi service. This severely limits the reach and influence that Pastor Frederick can have in Kenya. Beyond his mission of peace, Pastor Fredrick is a local church pastor, runs an orphanage and oversees more than 70 churches.

What We Need

  • $7,500 is needed for a 4x4 reliable vehicle to be purchased in Kenya

The Impact

Providing a reliable vehicle for Pastor Frederick would:

  • Allow Pastor Frederick to mobilize 70+ churches to bring lasting peace
  • Preach the gospel of peace and Jesus Christ to more people
  • Money would be saved each day/month on expensive taxi rides to allow for more orphans to be served in Pastor Frederick's orphanage

A Letter From Frederick January 15th, 2015

"On January 15th gunmen invaded a village and began shooting and killed 2 young people and injured several more. I went with a  team to help conduct the funeral service, console the bereaved family, present Jesus as a peacemaker to bitter villagers who were looking for revenge.

Many people attended the funeral/peace service. I was given time to speak the word of God and the response was so encouraging because many repented, and over 120 people gave their lives to Jesus Christ for the first time! Later, we prayed for the sick and we saw Jesus heal many people from different ailments."
- Pastor Frederick Ogara

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps. Please contribute as much as you can to help us reach our goal.  No amount is too little!

Remember, this fundraiser relies on crowdfunding.  Please share this campaign with family and friends using all media at your disposal, including Facebook, direct email, Twitter and other social media.

100 % of donations raised will go to support Pastor Frederick Ogara's mission for peace in Kenya. Pastor Fredrick Ogara is the Senior Pastor of Victory Faith Kenya and is a 501c3 nonprofit of Victory Faith Spokane, WA.

story:
Everyone that is pitching in now is not only helping the kids with cancer but the future of the world. That's what this is y'all. If they keep this law they already passed? SB 277 forcing vaccinations on our kids? The rest of America will follow along with the other rich white bank owned countries. We are all so fucked if this happens. So this is it folks. D Day. I'm on front lines. Appreciate all the love. If you can't donate money send light.

My name is Ian Jacklin and I'm not going to take it anymore!  I was already pissed off when I found out that although I know how to cure cancer thanks to making my last film "iCureCancer.com"...  yet, I'm not allowed to use that kind of medicine on my own children?  I want all children to be free of the tyranny of the Nazi government trying to take over America.  So I'm picking up my camera, since I can't use a gun...  to capture the truths and spread the truths in order to save what freedom we have. 

As many of you know I never got any kind of sizable investment last time and we fell way short of goal so here we go again.  Especially because:

When I found out that California Governor Pan and Brown both took bribes, not to mention "legally" financially benefiting from passing the Nazi law in to place...   I snapped on my religious friends.  lol.  I blamed them at first.  lol.  Sorry guys.  But I had to let off steam and get everyone riled up for this.  We have to recall Senator Pan in Northern California and support the referendum of Jerry Brown and SB 277...  Or... We are done!

It is not only un-American; it is murder.  The Gardasil vaccine will be murdering 1 in 912 girls next year if California imposes this law!  If this happens I wash my hands of the USA and free world and go underground.  So this is my last ditch effort to help humanity.  Please help me keep gas in my Jeep and food in my belly while I continue across this country with my camera from Mexico to Canada this summer visiting different folks to interview for my film along the way.  I have decided to make iCureCancer2 - Baby Killers include the vaccination horror show going on right now in America.  Califuckenfornia of all places?  Does Nazi Germany ring a bell at all folks?  They will be injecting your children without your say next year!  One in 912 girls will die from Gardasil alone and that vaccine does nothing for them!  Vaccines are a myth!  A total myth by Big Pharma.  End of story.  Follow the money trail.

If you too are sick and tired and don't want to take it anymore then support me.  Help me help you.  I was able to get from Tijuana to Northern California thanks to donations.  I need to get back and forth from Mexico and then across to the East Coast and up to Canada and back.  This trip will only cost gas and lodgings for me.  I can shoot and edit myself on the way and you will see my progress in youtube video's.  I will eventually have "Baby Killers" in the can and edited to continue our revolution to wake people up.  I mean this is our children folks.  Fuck the pink!  ACS ("American Cancer Society") is bullshit.  Donate here to a real cause.  If nothing else we get a ton of great information on youtube.  And in time, an amazing award winning film.  Baby Killers.  The name will go down in history.  Mark my words.  They fucked up.

So needless to say, my thanks to each and everyone one of you that has my back!!!  I send back a million fold in warrior light.  They say I have Arch Angel Raphael in me.  So for whatever that's worth...  Love and light all around!

What We Need

An executive producer.  The plan is to take my Jeep to Montana, where my good friend and old producer of my yesteryear films, Fred Stallone, has a Ford Truck Conversion waiting for me.  He is chipping in for some gas and we are hoping the rest can be raised on here. Only 5 an a bit of the origninal 20 was raised so we are trying again.  $37,000 is enough to make sure I survive on the road and have a little to get the post production rolling with.  We want the film out ASAP to go with the vaccine murders they are about to force on Cali mothers. 

Again, the movie is coming out in chunks anyway on youtube for those that want to subscribe!  Make sure you follow me on facebook:  gijacklin and on youtube.com/icurecancer2 and the icurecancer group on facebook etc.... 

Thank you so much! 

Ian Jacklin

story:
RavenWood Outdoor program offers children the opportunity to spend their entire day outdoors exploring, learning, growing.   We provide an alternative educational program designed to foster awareness, respect, connection and growth with the outdoors through hands-on experiences.  Our curriculum is focused on earth living skills, community building, sensory exploration, nurturing relationships through the joy of mentoring, and care of our environment.  It is directed by the students as much as possible. 

Part of our mission is to keep programs accessible to as many as possible.  

We do this by offering scholarships for those in need.  

This helps with our goal of increasing diversity.  

Please help make it possible for all children who choose to attend by donating to our scholarship fund!



 With growing concerns about "Nature Deficit Disorder" and the ever increasing demands the modern world places on our families, help us to awaken our Hilltown children to the beauty and power of the natural world.


This program is sponsored by RavenWood Freedom Farm and Learning Center, Inc, a not for profit organization.  Our mission is to provide an engaging educational experience focusing on nature and the life sustaining importance of human and ecological diversity; where children may grow fully and experience themselves as unique and essential members of the world and community.

RavenWood's Outdoor program runs 9:15 to 3:00 on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from September 1st through the end of June.  It is located in Plainfield, MA. We still have openings for children ages 5 to 12.  Please call Saralinda at 413-325-4039 if interested.

story:
This campaign is to educate and support children who live on the streets in India. They are originally from Thakuti (Zila: Ajmer, India) 20 kms from Naseerabad. These children are 3-10 years old, travel for 300 days a year with their parents who participate in fairs in different parts of India. There is no electricity in their camps and they have no access to a school. 

As a Professor in a university in Los Angeles,CA, I am deeply moved by what I saw. These kids live with their families in tents and don't have proper clothes, shoes, socks.

I spent four hours with them in Udaipur (Rajasthan) where their families participated in a fair today (August 17, 2015) and I was able to stream my experience on Periscope. The parents of these kids have named them Shahrukh Khan, Altaf Khan, Garima, Bhuri and Arbaz Khan(all stars in Bollywood cinema). They were very excited to see a teacher in their tent.

I asked them "Are you happy, what do you want to say to the rest of the world?" --- Their response was "thank you" and I asked them "are you okay living without power?" They pointed to the street lamp and said "LIGHT".  

These students travel throughout the year making it impossible to enroll in a school. They want to learn about the world, they want to read and write. We are hoping to generate funds so that we can support their basic needs and provide them elementary education.

Thank you for your support.

story:
About the Festival

The New England Indonesian Festival is an annual event hosted by the Indonesian Student Association in Massachusetts (PERMIAS MASS) during the Fall semester. The festival comprises of many traditional and contemporary Indonesian food, various music and cultural  performances, as well as arts and crafts workshop. 

Some of this year's highlight includes the Batik Workshop, the Wayang showcase and the Saman Dance. 
Find us this year at Copley Square on September 12, 2015. 

Goals of the Festival

The main purpose of the festival is to celebrate and share Indonesian Arts and Culture to the people of Massachusetts. In addition, we also hope to bring the Indonesian and the International Community of Massachusetts together. And last but not least, we strive to create an unforgettable experience both for our vendors and our guests. 


Risks & Challenges

Every year, we aim to create an even grander festival with even more people (last year, we had 5,000+ guests checked in). However, our expansion plan hit a roadblock as we are currently facing problem in raising funds which was caused by the fact that:

1. We do not have a nonprofit ID number in the US which means companies have less incentive to donate to our cause. 

2. Indonesian companies do not have market in the United States. 

3. Fund from the government is limited.

We need your help to launch our campaign next year, any amount of donation will be gladly accepted. Help us spread the Indonesian culture through the festival. 


Ways You Can Help

  • Share - Ask your friends and families to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Volunteer - Lend us a helping hand during the day of the festival, from decorating the festival's space to serving delicious Indonesian delicacies. 
  • Vendor - Be one of our vendor and make a profit by sharing and selling Indonesian food, arts and basically anything else that you can think of! 
  • Donate - Donate to our cause (every donation above $10 will receive an exclusive gift from us). 



Our Gift for You

This year we are launching a new exclusive limited edition product which is one of Indonesia's finest treasures: Batik. Batik is a dye-resist textile technique first found and developed in Indonesia, thousands of years ago. This year collaborating with Lucy's Batik we got a chance to actually work with local artisans and craftsmen in West Java. 

So our gift for you is an exclusive handmade Batik scarf (for donations above $10). In donating to our cause, keep in mind that you are also supporting local craftsmen and cultural heritage. Go get yours before it runs out! 

And that's all from us <3

story:
Summary

 

Mission: Inspire Peace. 

Peace in every heart. Peace in every home. Peace in every school. Peace in every community. Peace on Earth.

Vision: Naramata Chapter

  1. Share peace and yoga playdates with Naramata kids and comm​unity.
  2. (Co) Create a sustainable retreat, education, community center by the lake, including:
    1. Sustainable accommodations, community room and kitchen;
    2. Permaculture gardens, fruits & nuts trees, with emphasis on native and ancient seeds;
    3. Farm-to-table vegetarian and commensalist community meals experience;
    4. Yoga, well-being, SUP & sail workshops and camps;
    5. Self-Directed Education Learning Center;
    6. [to be continued...]

Vision: Web 2.0 Chapter

  1. Build bridges for peace through this Website, social medias, wikis, conferences and peer emulation;
  2. Share resources about kids yoga, positive parenting and peace pedagogy;
  3. Unite children, parents, educators, teachers, leaders and  peacebuilders through an open source wiki and forum for positive and conscious parenting, peace pedagogy, kids yoga tools, etc.

Values

  • Peacebuilding
  • Reverence
  • Interfaith
  • Interdependance
  • Emulation & Cooperation
  • Sustainibility
  • Kindness

To learn more about Peace. Love. Yoga. projects, visit the About page on Peace.Love.Yoga. website.

 

Bio - Leelou completed a bachelor degree in Education (2011) and a short program in Kid’s Literature (2012) at Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières, a Reiki certification (levels 1 & 2) with Reiki Samasati school in San Cristobal de las Casas, Mexico (2013), and the Rainbow Kids Yoga Teacher Training in Montreal (2013). She became Ambassador of Nutopia in June 2009, when visting Yoko Ono's mind-blowing, heart-melting exhibition in Montreal: IMAGINE: The Peace Ballad of John and Yoko. She visited alternative schools in Québec, France and Belgium, cultivating a passion for self-directed education and connected learning movements, yoga and mindfulness for children and families.

In the past ten years, she worked and volunteered with children from different cultures, countries and mother tongue,  in various environments such as schools, daycares, French Immersion programs, outdoor base camps, community events, festivals, etc. Since she moved to the Okanagan in 2014, she shared rainbow yoga love and joy at Apex Moutain Resort daycare, Jumping Beans Play Café, Naramata Community Market, Naramata Playschool, and more. She created the Website Peace. Love. Yoga. to support her work and as contribution to make this world a better place.

She launched this IndieGoGo campaign to support her work and move forward with business registrations, insurances and other expenses to get started properly and share more rainbow yoga love Online and in her community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding will help:

  • Register Leelou Poppins Yoga Playdates business and other business expenses;
  • Finance free / by donation community yoga playdates;
  • Finance free / by donation peace playdates;
  • Finance the continuity of Peace. Love. Yoga. website;
  • Get a reliable vehicle to visit yogis where they are:
    • Parks, beaches, markets, community events, festivals, etc. 
  • Get new fun props, yoga mats, yoga books, yoga songs, etc.
  • Set up a kid's yoga booth for markets this summer;
  • Make my life purpose a living;
  • Make this world a better place.

     

    The Impact

    To offer yoga playdates at parks, beaches, makerts, community events and festivals is a great way to share peaceful, mindful and playful moments with families and bring more love and joy in this world. It allows people to stop and connect where they are, rather than asking them to commit and drive to a yoga studio. It makes it accessible to everyone, together. 

    Since I completed the Rainbow Kids Yoga Teacher Training in 2013, I have been struggling working odd side jobs in order to get the yoga project started. The projects are flowing and I need to move forward, register the business and get organized to rock these little yogis' summer!

    In order to share the essence of my work, I created the website Peace. Love. Yoga. in February 2017, in hope this will be helpful for parents, educators, teachers, kids yoga teachers, peacebuilders, changemakers, leaders, and most of all, kids, to be part of the change we wish to see in this world.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    Risk: make this world a better place.

    Challenges: naysayers.

    Plan for solving these challenges: keep on believing.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you like this project but feel like there's a hole in your pocket, here's what you can do to help:

    • Share this campaign!
    • Visit my website: Peace. Love. Yoga. 
    • Subscribe to my mailing list.
    • Buy the PeaceMakers game through the banner on my website. I'll get a commission.
    • Tell your principal to buy the PeaceMakers game through the banner on my website. I'll get a bigger commission. And promote making this world a better place.
    • Share my website with parents, educators, teachers, kids yoga teachers, principals, leaders, Kid President, etc.
    • Follow me on social medias: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest.
    • Show up to yoga playdates.
    • Send me pictures of your little ones practicing yoga, with or without me, to share on my website and social medias.
    • Write a testimonial about your experience with me.
    • Share this campaign. Share this campaign. Share this campaign.
    • #PeacePedagogy #Interfaith #GlobalCitizen #EcoKid #PlayYoga #RainbowYoga #KidsYoga #Yoga4Classroom #KidsBooks #HappySongs #HappyFamily #PositiveParenting #NaramataLove #OneWorld

story:
WORLD SCHOLARS PROGRAM

The World Scholars Program has as its ultimate goal the development of Village Leadership Academy’s (VLA) students into conscientious global leaders of tomorrow.  At the beginning of each academic year, our students' education foundation is expanded through a year-long exploration of the socio-cultural, political, and economic histories of a Community of Focus e.g. Costa Rica.  This cultural and academic journey culminates in an educational voyage to the Community of Focus. During this international expedition, our students engage in cultural exchanges with other children of the world, develop new friendships that extend beyond the boundaries of their communities, and acquire first-hand knowledge about the challenges that other communities face. For Village Leadership Academy students,

“The World is the Classroom.”
 

What We Need

 

Why Do We Need This Money?

This year a cohort of 25 students, from third through eighth grade, will have the opportunity to embark upon a global experience in Costa Rica. Throughout the expedition, students will explore practices and cultural beliefs shared amongst this group of people. In Turrialba, students will be gain valuable leadership and interpersonal skills as they interact with their Costa Rican peers during a service learning project. They will visit the Center for Tropical Agricultural Research and Higher Learning (CATIE) to participate in an environmental sustainability workshop about the importance of water and biodiversity. In Cahuita, students will visit the BriBri Village and learn about the history and culture of the indigenous people. We will also visit the Cahuita National Park to learn about the tropical flora and fauna. Overall, this travel experience to Costa Rica will enable WSP participants to gain a better understanding of both the complexities and commonalities of Costa Rican life.

What is the Impact on VLA Students?

These unique learning experiences and opportunities have broadened our students' perspectives, enabling them to recognize their privileges as American citizens while simultaneously expanding their expectations, visions, and social justice endeavors for their own lives.  After World Scholars Program trips, our students have been inspired to become diplomats, philanthropists, humanitarians, school founders, environmental scientists, and international entrepreneurs.

 

 

OUR PAST EDUCATIONAL EXPEDITIONS

 

Ghana 2017

Visited the Elmina Castle where students learned about the enslavement of African peoples, the Triangular Slave Trade, and the Gold Coast

Cuba 2016

In Santiago de Cuba, VLA students visited the Fernando Ortiz African Cultural Center and Casa del Caribe to learn about the history and culture of Cubans of Haitian descent.

Panama 2015

Participated in the Embera Indian Village tour. VLA students were able to visit the native community and travel along the famous Chagres River.

Dominican Republic 2014

VLA students worked alongside Haitian immigrants sorting trash in a Dominican landfill to learn about immigration and labor tensions within the country.

South Africa 2013

VLA students volunteered with youth at Red Hill, Children of Hope Educare Centre and Masipumelele's Library, all of which are housed within an informal settlement outside of Cape Town South Africa.

Mexico 2012

VLA students visited the Mayan village of Santa Elena where they learned about the education system in Mexico while also providing an Elementary School with extra resources such as books, notebooks, pencils, and other educational supplies.

The Democratic Republic of the Congo 2011

VLA students volunteered on a farm to learn about the agriculture of Gemena.  They explored the cultural connections between the people of the DRC and African Americans via a community gathering hosted by Communaute Evangelique de l'Ubangi-Mongala (CEUM).  Students also participated in a youth-led open forum with Little Things, a grassroots, non-profit youth advocacy group that provides educational support and empowerment opportunities for young women in the DRC. 

Brazil 2010

VLA students attended capoeira classes with Brazilian children and organized a fundraiser to support capoeira school for local children.
